access: Private 3 bedroom apartment with 1 private bathroom. The back yard, laundry room, patio, and garage are shared with other tenants in the building. This apartment is on the first floor/ street level. Garage parking is available for $25/night. This is a spot in a 2 car garage. Only cars can fit, no trucks or SUVs. If you have a larger vehicle, let me know and I can help you find another place to keep it during your stay!
description:
Soak up the modern charm of this Chicago apartment. Conveniences include no stairs, fully fenced backyard, patio, grill and outside TV- perfect for celebrating after a Cubs win! This bnb is pet friendly and has a fully stocked kitchen. Walk to Wrigley and tons of restaurants and bars, including two on the corner. Want to explore the rest of the city? No problem! There is garage parking available or you can walk to the Addison El train stop just down the block

There are 3 bedrooms and one bathroom, plus sleeping space in the living room. The kitchen is fully stocked and has a dishwasher.

Private 3 bedroom apartment with 1 private bathroom. The back yard, laundry room, patio, and garage are shared with other tenants in the building. This apartment is on the first floor/ street level. Garage parking is available for $25/night. This is a spot in a 2 car garage. Only cars can fit, no trucks or SUVs. If you have a larger vehicle, let me know and I can help you find another place to keep it during your stay!

Host is available through text or email, sean@chicagoprg.com. We are available if you need anything but won't stop by unless you need us.

Amazing walkable neighborhood let's you truly get to know Chicago! Roscoe Village is a nice area with lots of shops, restaurants and bars within walking distance. The apartment is on Addison St, so just go straight down the street to go to Cubs games and all the popular Wrigleyville bars. If you want to go downtown, take the Brown line El (on the corner) to the loop.

Brown line El is on Addison just East of the property can take you downtown or to other neighborhoods like Lincoln Park, Lincoln Square, or Old Town. Addison bus stop is outside the front  door, and will take you East to Wrigley Field and the lakefront. The Damen bus is 1 block West of the property and can take you to Wicker Park neighborhood. This apartment is extremely well located for anyone that wants to explore Chicago's neighborhoods!

Garage parking is $50. Street parking is free on Addison and Wolcott

access: Guest enter though Western Ave.  apartment entrance and walk up flight of stairs to access apartment unit. Common hallway has free washer and dryer that is shared with other tenants.
description: Sink into the gray wood-framed sofa and admire city views from the wide grid windows at a cozy, city abode with modern lighting, leafy plants, and pearlescent tiles. Stop off at ‪Ipsento‬ Coffee downstairs before heading downtown for the day.
house_rules: Quite hours after 10pm, with respect to our other tenants. No parties or events. No smoking. No pets.
interaction: Meet and greet is not necessary but always encouraged. We have a retail store that you can pick up and drop off your key during hours of operation. There is also a lock box option. The code will be sent 24 hours before your visit. Available to answer questions via email or text preferred. Property management only minutes away from the Airbnb to assist if needed.
neighborhood_overview: Bucktown is a blend of new families and longtime residents. There are a couple of parks within walking distance and the 606 trail is a short ride or walk away. Restaurants, shopping, and nightlife in both Bucktown and Logan Square are nearby.
notes:
This apartment is ideal for 2 people. Sleeping arrangements for additional guests include a couch and air mattress available upon request. 

Parents with small children:
We also have 2 small folding strollers and a pack and play available upon request.
space:
Our newly designed living space is a reflection of our unique style.

 Our sunny Chicago retreat features a fresh and modern vibe, with furnishing and design elements thoughtfully chosen. 

Make yourself at home

Contemporary open layout kitchen and common area is perfect for for lounging and enjoying downtime or a nap. Comfortable, modern living room complete with smart tv and Netflix for your ultimate home away from home experience. 

Kitchen
Enjoy a fully equipped kitchen, brand new appliances ( fridge, stove, oven, microwave and dishwasher) and better then basic cooking tools and essentials Bar/Island seating table for 2. 

Bedroom 
Comfortable queen size bed with dresser, desk and large walk in closet. 

Bathroom 
Beautifully tiled bathroom with full tub and shower with glass door. Complimentary  toiletries, and clean towels provided. 

Other features include:
Iron, ironing board,hair dryer, hangers, self controlled A/C and heat. 
Washer/Dryer, shared with tenants, please be respectful. The space is very well kept and professionally cleaned and after each stay.
summary: Sink into the gray wood-framed sofa and admire city views from the wide grid windows at a cozy, city abode with modern lighting, leafy plants, and pearlescent tiles. Stop off at ‪Ipsento‬ Coffee downstairs before heading downtown for the day.
transit: Centrally located near CTA blue line train, 606 trail, and Milwaukee Avenue.  Within a mile from expressway exits.

additional_house_rules:
HOUSE RULES

Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking:

-No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250).
-If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair.
- The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred.
-Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
-Lost key fee - $300
-Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc.
-Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc.
-Smoking - $300
-Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300



**-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

access: In addition to the apartment, the community amenities include an outdoor pool, picnic area, fitness center, cyber cafe, game room with foosball and billiards, resident lounge, on-site parking, and more. There’s even a high-tech conference room with PC and Mac computers!
description:
You can’t find luxury and convenience like this in the city! This spacious 2BR/2BA is near Chicago’s biggest corporate headquarters, high-end shopping, and fantastic restaurants of the upscale Oak Brook suburb. This brand-new development boasts luxurious amenities like a gym and resort-style outdoor pool. The community also has 24/7 security and free parking. Get the best of urban living and residential comfort just a short drive from Downtown Chicago and O’Hare.

Besides the apartment itself, you’ll have access to the spectacular amenities of the Lakeside Village development. In the summer, take advantage of the sparkling outdoor pool and the picnic area, and in the winter, cozy up to the fireplace in the resident lounge or get some exercise in the fitness center.

In addition to the apartment, the community amenities include an outdoor pool, picnic area, fitness center, cyber cafe, game room with foosball and billiards, resident lounge, on-site parking, and more. There’s even a high-tech conference room with PC and Mac computers!

We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

Just east of Downtown Chicago, the upscale suburb of Oak Brook is known for its rolling golf courses, high-end shopping, and concentration of corporate headquarters that draw visitors from around the world.

Within a short drive of the apartment, golfers can go for holes-in-one at Butterfield Country Club, Butler National Golf Club, Chicago Highlands Club, Fresh Meadow Golf Club, and more. These country clubs are also known for their banquet and social event facilities.

Golf courses aren’t the only places to relax around here; don’t miss the beautiful Morton Arboretum, known for hiking and biking trails and summertime picnic spots. The Danada Forest Preserve is home to lush parkland and the Danada House, a popular wedding venue. Craving a delicious meal? Don’t miss Oak Brook’s impressive dining scene, which features high-end steakhouses like Michael Jordan’s Restaurant and The Capital Grille.

When the Windy City weather takes a turn, head inside to the plethora of leisure attractions in the Oak Brook area. Shopaholics from around the Chicago metro head to the Oakbrook Center for stores like Restoration Hardware, Apple, and Louis Vuitton. It’s anchored by Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, Macy’s, and Sears. In addition to the AMC Theatre at this mall, movie buffs can also catch the latest blockbusters at the AMC Dine-In at Yorktown Center, about 5 minutes from the apartment by car.

Oak Brook also means business; a plethora of national and global corporations have headquarters here. The head offices of Kellogg’s, RedBox, Ace Hardware, Microsoft, and more are within a few minutes’ drive.

Of course, no Chicago trip is complete without a selfie in front of the Bean or a slice of deep dish pizza. If you’re heading into Downtown Chi-Town, our apartment has easy freeway access, which makes accessing the city center a breeze.

While taking the L train is the best way to get around Downtown, we recommend driving to get to the highlights of Oak Brook. The apartment has free, secure parking - as does nearly every business, restaurant, and venue in Oak Brook.

If you’re flying into Chi-Town, we recommend renting a car and driving to the apartment. We’re a short drive from both O’Hare International Airport (about 20 minutes) and Midway (about 25 minutes).

Downtown Chicago is about a 30-minute drive from the apartment, depending on traffic. Keep in mind that traffic may increase during rush hour. If you’re heading into town for drinks, Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro.

This apartment is in a building full of other units. Though none of the living spaces are shared, you may see your friendly neighbors coming and going. 

**Swimming Pool is closed during the winter season.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.
house_rules:
HOUSE RULES

Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking:

-No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250).
-If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair.
- The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred.
-Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
-Lost key fee - $300
-Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc.
-Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc.
-Smoking - $300
-Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300



**-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

additional_house_rules:
1. Please replace your shoes at the entrance. 

2. Quiet time is after 10:00pm and before 8:00am. Including kitchen. 

3. Kitchen is shared. Just LIGHT COOKING once or twice per week is acceptable,  like boiling, heating etc.  And clean afterwards. Baking like turkeys and breads with powder are not allowed.  Heavy cooking are not welcome. 

4. Washer and dryer are downstairs and free.  Usually provide once a week.  Please DONOT treat as a laundry store.  And please follow the notice on the dryer.

5. Please don’t leave expensive and important things in the room if you mind.  And for some emergency or service, we keep the right to enter the rooms.

6. Anything please turn on and turn off. Open and close.

For long term guests:

1. Because you will get the long term(over 28 days)price.  What you paid is not included the body wash, shampoo, toilet paper, and etc.  But you still will see everything when you arrive. Just to welcome you. 

2. Here is airbnb.  Not an entire apartment by contract. We are shared.  We have no contract and no deposit. You have to pay first, stay later.  Without pay you have no right to enter the place or keep your stuffs in my rooms.   Also you can decide how long you need to stay and let us know in advance so we can block for you . The same we also have the right to decide how long to host you and let you know in advance . And we keep the right to enter the room for keeping the whole place safe or for some repairs while your stay even there is a keypad lock on each door. Commonly we will not enter your room without notice you. 

Once you decide to stay , that means you agree with all these and will follow the rules of our place.

description:
Luxury newly renovate PRIVATE room and shared full bathroom free parking on the street

I understand usually people come to Chicago will be very busy while the stay.  Messages through airbnb message system or the phone number which one we  registered on airbnb is best. Or it will be hard for us to know who are who.

For everyone: 

1. Kitchen is shared. Just LIGHT COOKING once or twice per week is acceptable,  like boiling, heating etc.  Baking like turkeys and breads with powder are not allowed.  Heavy cooking are not welcome. 

2. Washer and dryer are downstairs and free.  Usually provide once a week.  Please DONOT treat as a laundry store.  And please follow the notice on the dryer. 

For long term guests:

1. Because you will get the long term(over 28 days)price.  What you paid is not included the body wash, shampoo, toilet paper, and etc.  But you still will see everything when you arrive. Just to welcome you. 

2. Here is airbnb.  Not an entire apartment by contract. We are shared.  We have no contract and no deposit. You have to pay first, stay later.  Without pay you have no right to enter the place or keep your stuffs in my rooms.   Also you can decide how long you need to stay and let us know in advance so we can block for you . The same we also have the right to decide how long to host you and let you know in advance . And we keep the right to enter the room for keeping the whole place safe or for some repairs while your stay even there is a keypad lock on each door. Commonly we will not enter your room without notice you. 

Once you decide to stay , that means you agree with all these and will follow the rules of our place.

access: I guests Will have access to the entire space except for the closets. There is a wardrobe in the living room underneath the TV provided
description:
My space is decorated in a chic way. There was a wardrobe in the living room that can be used by the guests. There’s plenty of space to move around and feel right at home.

Guests are allowed to use the bedroom the bathroom, the living room, and the kitchen, which is the entire space. Please be mindful that I do sleep on the couch in the living room so after 9:30 PM you will not be able to use the living room

I guests Will have access to the entire space except for the closets. There is a wardrobe in the living room underneath the TV provided

I am only partially available to gas. I work full-time, I have a dog and we are very active in the city. I can suggest places for the guests to visit while visiting the city, but I will not be able to join.

MySpace is one block away from the lake and very close to public transit. The neighborhood is blossoming with new restaurants in new bars every month.

If you want to use Uber, my space is only 15 minutes away from the magnificent Mile downtown Chicago. You are very close to all of the very best shopping, Clubs and restaurants.

You can either use Uber, the public transit, or you can rent my vehicle through Turo.

There is a dog that weighs 45 pounds living in the space. She is very friendly and loves people. If you do not like dogs this may not be the space for you.

access: All of the space on our property including the backyard and front yard, front porch all are to be used at the guests discretion. We do honor volume control in the family neighborhood and ask that there not be  events hosted in the home that would supersede the number of guests.  Quiet hours to be observed are  9pm- 7am
description:
Quaint Historical Home with eclectic collections from around the world.  This one-of-a-kind Home Charms all of it's visitors and leaves you feeling deeply cared for and connected to the heart of Wheaton.  Everything is in walking distance, yoga studio,  grocery stores, pharmacies, libraries, banks, prairie path, parks, church, etc. Two blocks from the Metra station that services comfortable rides to downtown Chicago in under an hour. Footsteps from public trans. Pace bus 714 to fun in Naperville

The entire home is available for your use. 

As soon as you enter the home; there’s a stairwell to the left which takes you upstairs to the three bedrooms and full bath.  

Continue to walk in through the entryway and you’ll see the dining room, living room to the right and Library to the right. 

The library has a door for privacy, contains a sofa bed, and is attached to a half bath. 

Then there is the kitchen! 

You will see windows on the far-side of the countertop.  

As you walk by those windows you will see stairs going down to the basement on your right hand side. Midway through those stairs is a door that will lead you out to the backyard. 

If you continue down the stairs to the basement you need to watch your head. 

You will find a common room,  -a sitting area and a “linen closet,” a black armoire where you will find extra blankets pillows towels as well as hairdryer and other amenities. 

To the right is bedroom #4- woth queen size bed and a curtain for privacy. 

A few more steps and you will see the laundry room to the left, The second bathroom with the shower in front, and bedroom #5 to the right.   Here too there is a queen size bed and a curtain for privacy rather than a door.  

Since the closets, dressers and cupboards store personal belongings, We have worked toward clearing out a few spaces on shelves and counter tops per room in order to accommodate personal items. 

The kitchen is open and available for your use.  Feel free to serve yourself to the coffee, coffee- maker, teas, mugs etc.  the fridge, stove and oven are all ready to be used along with all of the other necessities.  

Beneath the sink of the kitchen, you can find cleaning supplies, as well as the space between the fridge and the wall to it’s left- you will find broom and mop.  

Additional supplies can be found Behind the wooden door, to the left of the entry room. 

The space upstairs holds cleaning supplies in the bathroom inside of the armoire.  

The key fits all of the locks in each of the doors to the outside.

All of the space on our property including the backyard and front yard, front porch all are to be used at the guests discretion. We do honor volume control in the family neighborhood and ask that there not be  events hosted in the home that would supersede the number of guests.  Quiet hours to be observed are  9pm- 7am

Available if needed or requested

Across the tracks from Wheaton College’s beautiful campus!  Three blocks away from Marianos grocery store, CVS pharmacy,A few steps away from Prairie Path

Everything is in walking distance, yoga studio,  grocery stores, pharmacies, libraries, banks, prairie path, parks, church, etc. Two blocks from the Metra station that services comfortable rides to downtown Chicago in under an hour.  Or if you are looking for Quaint older Towns, go in the other direction to Geneva and see the Fox River, run through the old town with modern shops and unique boutiques.   Footsteps from public trans. Pace bus 714 travels to popular & fun town of Naperville and much more.

We are Across the train tracks from Wheaton College, where there are many fantastic resource including, a science building with fantastic displays.

Up to three cars fit in our driveway. 

During the day you can park on the East side of the street, in front of the house, but at night you will want to avoid getting a ticket and have all of the cars off the street.

additional_house_rules:
Absolutely no parties allowed without strict pre-approval with designated amount of guests. If you violate these terms you will have to vacate the property , with no refund. 

No House Parties.  If you have additional guests that will be on the property, beyond what is specified, you must get prior approval.  

This is a strict policy as this neighborhood is not tolerant of this kind of activity. If you get pre-approved for a get-together, it is 
 
No tobacco smoking inside- Decks and rooftops ok, but must use ashtrays.

Parties are allowed for specifically these rules:
The number of guests at party must be the same as the number in the party, unless pre-approved.

There is a party fee additional of at least $100 depending on the details of the party.

access: You have use of the upper unit in this house. This includes decks and roof space as weather permits.
description:
Located in Wicker Park, this  4 bedroom house has 3 kings & 3 queens & one day bed that opens as 2 twins, ideal for kids and makes the capacity as much as 14. 
Wicker Park was voted the best neighborhood to live in Chicago bc proximity to best restaurants & bars Chicago has to offer. 
House has everything needed to stay in and cook your own meals- relax or go out & hit the bar scene and return to your temporary pad for more festivities. The outdoor kitchen/roof perfect for celebrating outside.

This house is has both an indoor kitchen and an outdoor kitchen. We keep spices and cooking supplies on hand so you can whip up your own meals if you are tired of eating out. Do you enjoy an nice hot steam shower? One of the three bathrooms also doubles as a steam showed and it is large enough for more than a couple of people. If weather is permitting, you can enjoy the rooftop deck. Perfect spot for special occasions like baby  showers or bachelor parties. Parties should not get out of hand and if police are called, then the guests may have to end the party.

You have use of the upper unit in this house. This includes decks and roof space as weather permits.

We have guest services available, but we won't be knocking on the door unless you need us. Typically you will never meet us, as we have self check in.

This is Chicago's most desirable neighborhood. Not off the beaten path, but instead located in an area everyone wants to live. Our street is safe and has lots of young people.

You are 2 blocks from the Chicago CTA, train to downtown and O'Hare Airport. Recently these scooters have started to appear everywhere and for sight seeing it might be pretty handy. 1 block away are rental bikes that can be used to get to lakefront or tool around Wicker Park.

We do allow small parties, but if they get out of hand, we reserve the right to terminate your visit. Please show respect to the house and its neighbors.
house_rules:
Absolutely no parties allowed without strict pre-approval with designated amount of guests. If you violate these terms you will have to vacate the property , with no refund. 

No House Parties.  If you have additional guests that will be on the property, beyond what is specified, you must get prior approval.  

This is a strict policy as this neighborhood is not tolerant of this kind of activity. If you get pre-approved for a get-together, it is 
 
No tobacco smoking inside- Decks and rooftops ok, but must use ashtrays.

Parties are allowed for specifically these rules:
The number of guests at party must be the same as the number in the party, unless pre-approved.

There is a party fee additional of at least $100 depending on the details of the party.

description:
If you like a unique vibe, good energy, cool experience, eat or learn how to make Sushi or European food, wine, smoothies, fun activities, and tours or just relax in the front of the TV our home is for you! 

Property professionally managed by Ran Fridman - Airbnb Superhost with more than 15 years of experience in the Hospitality Industry WORLDWIDE. 

We take care of each guest like Family, come and experience our hospitality. 

Thank You,

Fridman Properties

All our locks to apartments and rooms are digital so you would not need to worry about security & keys. 

You will have access to your private room with 1 bunk bed (single bed), the shared living room has TV ( Netflix, Amazon Prime and more ) dining area, working desk,  kitchen + FREE private parking in the back of the building.

We love to help visitors!  We take care of each guest like family.  We want your experience in Chicago to be AWESOME.  Please see our guest’s feedback & testimonies; actual clients who stayed with us.  

We assist students, faculty and visitors with many other services as well ... like helping  you to find long term rentals if you are relocating, room rentals for functions, meetings and study rooms, airport pick up & drop off services, storage space, moving, renting or buying furniture,  shopping, driving lessons, opening bank accounts and much more!  

Please contact us for complete details.  We are here to help you to focus on studying, working or to simply have a great time doing what you love to do best!  

We also offer 50% off on special tickets to the Science and Industry Museum + FREE parking and even 3D movies for your entertainment.  We sincerely hope you will have a truly pleasant stay with us.

1 block to Metra station - 12 minutes to McCormick Place - stop by Metra.  We can help you with transfers from and to the airport.  We can also drive you around the city.

1 block to the Metra Station - 12 minutes to McCormick Place - stop by Metra.  We can help you with transfers from the airport and to the airport.  We can also drive you around the city.  

We provide transportation from the airport for your safety and convenience for only $69.00 and someone will even meet and greet you at the airport baggage area to help you carry your bags.  We want you to fully enjoy your stay with us, worry-free.

additional_house_rules: We have a lot of fun here but it is a relatively quiet community of young professionals. It is very peaceful here and very fun. No additional overnight guests are allowed during your stay unless I pre approve them. Think of it:  If I don't know them, and I don't know you, there's too great an opportunity for safety risks and drama by inviting additional unknown elements into the mix. I'm happy to meet new friends for drinks at any number of neighborhood bars, tho! "Quiet time" at Beatle Central means nothing loud (music, talking etc) before 10AM, or after 11PM during the week. Weekends nothing loud before 11AM but we've been known to occasionally carry on til 3AM on weekends if everyone in the house is cool with it.  I am a professional musician who has traveled quite a bit and I always appreciate comfortable dwellings with polite hosts when traveling in unfamiliar surroundings. That is what I aim to provide for you, in a music-friendly environment. Whether you have a casual appreciation for The Fab Four or you're obsessed with every album, film, movie or Beatles concert (and that includes solo Beatles), a splendid time is guaranteed for all when you stay here!

access: It's a two level house and the bedrooms are upstairs so you will need to climb a short flight of 14 stairs to get to your room. You will be given a key for your room as well as keys to the front door and gate. The gate stays manually locked at all times. Besides having your own private room, there is a shared bathroom, laundry, computer work desk, treadmill, kitchen and living room available for all guests. In warmer months there's a courtyard for grilling, brats n beers.  Fall season brings out the fire pit for cozy courtyard hangs. Just be mindful to keep voices chill and be super respectful to neighbors. After 11PM there's not much socializing going on during the week. Everyone in our community is super chill, but as I am the landlord my rule of thumb is : Be friendly but don't get into anybody's affairs and don't let them get into yours. No drama = No problems. Super chill, no worries here.
description:
Welcome to "AirBnBEATLES"! 
* Please read my entire profile to get the best experience out of your stay.
. Safe, quiet neighborhood with public transportation right at your doorstep. 
. 20 min to downtown /35 min train ride direct to O'Hare Airport. 
. Nightlife & restaurants within two blocks in any direction. 
. Courtyard gardens all housed in a creative, safe, Beatles themed friendly  environment. 
. Great for couples, creative artists, touring musicians & traveling Wilburys.

This listing is a coach house, which is a stand alone brick building set back from the street.  The bedrooms are upstairs so you will need to climb a short flight of 14 stairs to get to your room. The place is safe and comfy, with lots of Beatles collectibles all around & plenty of music. Please note that I am in the process of renovating the house. Your stay at AirBnBeatles helps to offset my renovation costs while my dream upgrades quietly unfold . As for what happens OUTSIDE the coach house, you’re in the middle of Chicago's cultural universe!  Free parking out front & on neighboring streets.  It is a quiet community of young professionals.  Perfect for festival travelers , touring musicians, visiting couples, traveling novelists, business excursions, medical professionals on residency, etc. Public trans to downtown l, restaurants & nightlife just 2-3 blocks away.  I have a great affinity for The Beatles and whether you have a casual appreciation for The Fab Four or you're obsessed with every album, “a splendid time is guaranteed for all” So book now!

It's a two level house and the bedrooms are upstairs so you will need to climb a short flight of 14 stairs to get to your room. You will be given a key for your room as well as keys to the front door and gate. The gate stays manually locked at all times. Besides having your own private room, there is a shared bathroom, laundry, computer work desk, treadmill, kitchen and living room available for all guests. In warmer months there's a courtyard for grilling, brats n beers.  Fall season brings out the fire pit for cozy courtyard hangs. Just be mindful to keep voices chill and be super respectful to neighbors. After 11PM there's not much socializing going on during the week. Everyone in our community is super chill, but as I am the landlord my rule of thumb is : Be friendly but don't get into anybody's affairs and don't let them get into yours. No drama = No problems. Super chill, no worries here.

I manage the property and live on the premises. I'm usually working around the house on various projects every day, but I am often out gigging playing live music on the weekends so weekend travelers won't see much of me.  I'm super open, friendly and I want your travels to be most excellent! However I also respect privacy and won't play 'tour guide' or be overly chatty unless I'm asked. If you're not out seeing the sights there is certainly time for Beatle events here at the house, vinyl listening, big screen movie screenings,  cookouts, whatever time allows for . The best experiences I've had in life are ones with The Beatles & the people who love them! Whether you have a casual appreciation for The Fab Four or you're obsessed with every album, a splendid time is guaranteed for all , in a super chill atmosphere when you stay here. Cheers

Logan Square is one of the friendliest and booming neighborhoods in Chicago with plenty of nightlife options on every corner. The Beatle house is within two blocks of Revolution Brewery, Logan Bar, Cole's, The Boiler Room and a host of other hot spots (and for mornings - 3 blocks south is the much loved Cozy Corner Diner for pancakes, skillets, bacon and eggs).  Vegetarians & Vegans will enjoy the highly
lauded Chicago Diner, right around the corner from the house.  I'm just a few blocks from The Logan Theater, a restored vintage movie theater and comedy showcase room with it's own bar , and on the corner from the theater there's no "banker with a motorcar", but you will see an actual barber shop called Penny Lane : )

Public trans (Blue Line train and street buses) are within two blocks.  You can get downtown within 20 minutes and the blue line train will get you out to O'Hare International Airport within 35 minutes.

Free parking out front, as well as on neighboring streets. If ‘ Studio 2’ is not available on my calendar please check out my other listing, “Beatles Themed En-suite In Logan Square!”

lauded Chicago Diner, right around the corner from the house.  I'm just a few blocks from The Logan Theater, a restored vintage movie theater and comedy showcase room with it's own bar , and on the corner from the theater there's no "banker with a motorcar", but you will see an actual barber shop called Penny Lane : )
notes: Free parking out front, as well as on neighboring streets. If ‘ Studio 2’ is not available on my calendar please check out my other listing, “Beatles Themed En-suite In Logan Square!”
space: This listing is a coach house, which is a stand alone brick building set back from the street.  The bedrooms are upstairs so you will need to climb a short flight of 14 stairs to get to your room. The place is safe and comfy, with lots of Beatles collectibles all around & plenty of music. Please note that I am in the process of renovating the house. Your stay at AirBnBeatles helps to offset my renovation costs while my dream upgrades quietly unfold . As for what happens OUTSIDE the coach house, you’re in the middle of Chicago's cultural universe!  Free parking out front & on neighboring streets.  It is a quiet community of young professionals.  Perfect for festival travelers , touring musicians, visiting couples, traveling novelists, business excursions, medical professionals on residency, etc. Public trans to downtown l, restaurants & nightlife just 2-3 blocks away.  I have a great affinity for The Beatles and whether you have a casual appreciation for The Fab Four or you're obsessed with every album, “a splendid time is guaranteed for all” So book now!
summary:
Welcome to "AirBnBEATLES"! 
* Please read my entire profile to get the best experience out of your stay.
. Safe, quiet neighborhood with public transportation right at your doorstep. 
. 20 min to downtown /35 min train ride direct to O'Hare Airport. 
. Nightlife & restaurants within two blocks in any direction. 
. Courtyard gardens all housed in a creative, safe, Beatles themed friendly  environment. 
. Great for couples, creative artists, touring musicians & traveling Wilburys.
transit: Public trans (Blue Line train and street buses) are within two blocks.  You can get downtown within 20 minutes and the blue line train will get you out to O'Hare International Airport within 35 minutes.

additional_house_rules:
Before you book, please be aware of the following:

We strive to maintain the absolute highest standard of service on Airbnb. However, we are not a 5-star hotel and are therefore unable to provide everything that you would expect from a hotel. If you have specific things that you are very picky about, please discuss with us before booking.

Due to changing regulations on Airbnb in Chicago, we must ask that you maintain discretion with building staff. Please do not approach them with any requests. Definitely do not approach them to collect keys or to “check-in.”

Once you arrive, we will ask you to follow our house rules. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously. Failure to comply can result in forfeiture of your deposit and termination of your reservation without a refund.

- This building is 100% non-smoking. No smoking or vaping of anything inside the unit or on building premises. Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance.
- This a quiet and upscale residential building. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM - 8:00 AM daily. Our neighbors are very sensitive and they will report loud noise. Any noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police will result in forfeiture of partial or full deposit.
- Absolutely no guests not in the reservation are allowed in the apartment or the building common areas.
- No pets allowed unless approved. Bringing in a pet without notice or approval will result in a forfeiture of partial or full deposit.
- Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed-upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out fee.
- Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence. Additionally, lost keys will incur a $250 per key fee.

description:
Luxury 3b/3b Outstanding sky view of Chicago from your every room. Massive 1600 sq ft modern condo features wood floors, granite, leather and Egyptian cotton finishes. Luxury bedding and plenty of fresh towels and a fully stocked gourmet kitchen. Indoor/Outdoor pool open year round, outdoor lounge, cabanas, grills, and fire pit, and it's located  near Magnificent Mile shopping and Navy Pier. Parking is available at this building for ENVITAE members, and is subject to availability on a first come first serve basis.

This 3 bedroom/3 bath is the perfect location for exploring Chicago and sets the standard for Chicago luxury.

Master Bedroom - King Bed
Second Bedroom - Queen Bed
Third Bedroom - Queen Bed
An additional Queen Air Mattress

•Microwave
•Refrigerator
•Fully Equipped Kitchen
•Washer & Dryer
•Flat Screen TV/Cable
•High-speed internet
•Ample square footage
•Energy Star GE appliances
•Spacious, walk-in closets
•Individually controlled heat and air

The beds have fresh, clean and crisp linens and the bathrooms are stocked with fresh towels, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. We will also include 1 hair dryer. The kitchen is full of our cooking utensils and feel free to help yourself to anything in the cabinets and fridge. An iron/ironing board are also in unit for your convenience.

•Other Amenities
•Fitness Center
•Indoor/Outdoor Pool
•Sun Deck & Gardened Patio/BBQ

Everything you need is right outside your doorstep! Downtown Chicago is a city with an appetite—for food, of course, but also for design, history, and culture. Come here to marvel at the cutting-edge architecture or take in the gorgeous views of Lake Michigan; to spend a day cheering with baseball fans and a night laughing at a comedy show; to shop, to visit renowned institutions like the Field Museum, The Art Institute and the Adler Planetarium, and to experience the legendary blues scene. To do all this, you'll need nourishment: taste deep-dish pizza, piled-high hot dogs, Italian beef sandwiches, and more.

You are minutes away from bus and train stops.  

We find our guests prefer to use Uber, which is a very convenient and cheap way to get around the city.  Please note that the building is located just outside of the blue indicator circle to the east, closer to the river.

There is no parking available in the building, however there are several garages and lots within a block of the building.  We recommend the apps SpotHero or ParkWhiz to find and book parking.

- You will be provided 1 set of keys to access the property.
- Parking is available at this building for ENVITAE members, and is subject to availability on a first come first serve basis. Please inquire for further information.

Please be advised that all guests will be asked to sign a rental usage agreement that governs the terms of your stay.  For the protection of all parties, the booking party will also be required to provide a copy of a valid government issued ID and matching credit card prior to check in. This information is collected for verification purposes only and is not stored or otherwise used for any other purpose
By completing the reservation you agree to the following:
    - I agree to be bound by our rental terms and conditions.
    - I acknowledge that I will be required to provide a copy of a valid government issued ID and matching credit card prior to check in.
    - I acknowledge that I may be required to undergo a background check if mandated by the property management company or the building, as stated in accordance by my rental agreement and condition of the booking.

One block from blue line (Division). From O’Hare via train – 35 min.  10 min to the city via blue line.  Possibility of leaving bags before check in and after check out.

additional_house_rules:
1.  The lock box is located on the front porch on the railing and contains 2 sets of keys.  The code will be provided. Please use the front entrance instead of rear.  The back steps need to be fixed (plus, there are fewer steps in front).
2.    The alarm is over the TV. The code will be provided to turn off.  To turn on, simply hit Motion and exit within one minute. 
3.   The Metra line is the MetraElectric (ME) District to University Park (coming from downtown). The closest stop is 59th St (University of Chicago) Please go online to look up the schedule if needed:  www.metrarail.com
4.   Parking is available behind the building.  It has to be accessed from the front driveway to the south of the building.  It seems narrow but larger vehicles (up to vans) can pass through. 
5.   Street parking is permit only, but as long as you’re parking very late and leaving early, you’re probably ok.
6.   Towels are located in the right hand drawers in the master bathroom and on the shelf in the closet in the first bedroom. 
7.   Small shampoos, conditioners and soaps are located in the medicine cabinets of both bathrooms.  
8.   Complimentary coffee/tea and some spices are located in the cabinet above the sink.
9.   Any concerns, please text me at 773-401-0511 and I will do my best to respond as quickly as possible. 
10. Please be respectful of the downstairs neighbors and try to keep noise to a minimum after 10pm. 
11. Wifi is Mourillon, password 7733636607
12. Have a fantastic stay!

description:
My place is close to University of Chicago, Metra train and CTA. You’ll love my place because of the light, the coziness, the kitchen, and the high ceilings. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). Very safe with University of Chicago campus police always present and visible.

Very roomy and long hallway gives the bedrooms privacy.

As needed.

Downtown is less than a 10 min drive. Close to the Lakefront with plenty of scenery for runners, bikers and strollers.

Yes! One block from the CTA bus and a pleasant 10 minute walk on U of C's campus to the Metra train

2nd floor, not wheelchair accessible.

additional_house_rules:
We ask that guests observe quiet hours from 10pm to 7am. During this time, guests should use minimum volume for music, television, radio, and conversation. Please also do not do laundry during these hours.
We ask that guests not congregate in the common areas of the building (foyer, laundry room, rear staircase), and when entering and exiting the apartment to do so quietly, especially during quiet hours.
We ask that guests remove their shoes inside of the apartment to ensure that flooring remains in good condition for future guests. A shoe rack is provided for you to store your shoes while in the apartment and is located at the top of the stairs.
We ask that guests be sure to lock all doors and gates they enter or exit through during their stay to keep the space secure for all residents.
We ask that guests who smoke refrain from smoking inside of the apartment and within 15-25 feet of the building. Smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detectors will activate if there is smoking in the space.

description:
Loft style 2 bedroom apartment on the top floor of a Victorian-style 3-flat multi-family home in Oak Park's Ridgeland Historic District. Includes parking and access to washer/dryer in basement. 2 blocks from the green line for a 20 minute ride to Chicago. Near downtown Oak Park, Frank Lloyd Wright and Hemmingway Districts.

This newly remodeled top floor flat runs the length of the building so you'll find the space cozy and private. It features contemporary furnishings and all of the necessities for your stay. We are located on a quiet street that still offers easy access to all that Oak Park and Chicago have to offer. You'll have free parking on site, as well as use of the washer/dryer in the basement included.

We live onsite and are happy to answer any questions you have about the area.

We live on a quiet residential block in one of Oak Park's historic districts surrounded by 100+ year old homes. Just down the road you'll find all of the best attractions in Oak Park, including Frank Lloyd Wright homes and the Unity Temple, Ernest Hemmingway's childhood home and museum, and a number of excellent restaurants and food spots. There's also a wonderful local grocer a couple of blocks away if you prefer to prepare your own food (with a delicious hot bar and cafe in case you don't).

We have wonderful access to transportation from our property. The CTA Green Line is just 2 blocks away. From there, it's 2-3 minute ride to downtown Oak Park, or a 20 minute ride in the other direction to downtown Chicago. If you are driving, the 290 highway is 5 minutes away and can get you to downtown Chicago in 15 minutes. You can get to either O'Hare or Midway airports in 25 minutes by car.

If you prefer to take in Oak Park on foot, you can get to most attractions in 20-25 minutes. It may take you longer if you stop to admire the beautiful homes set on tree lined streets.

There's also a wonderful local grocer a couple of blocks away if you prefer to prepare your own food (with a delicious hot bar and cafe in case you don't).

We are located on a quiet street that still offers easy access to all that Oak Park and Chicago have to offer. You'll have free parking on site, as well as use of the washer/dryer in the basement included.
summary: Loft style 2 bedroom apartment on the top floor of a Victorian-style 3-flat multi-family home in Oak Park's Ridgeland Historic District. Includes parking and access to washer/dryer in basement. 2 blocks from the green line for a 20 minute ride to Chicago. Near downtown Oak Park, Frank Lloyd Wright and Hemmingway Districts.
transit:
We have wonderful access to transportation from our property. The CTA Green Line is just 2 blocks away. From there, it's 2-3 minute ride to downtown Oak Park, or a 20 minute ride in the other direction to downtown Chicago. If you are driving, the 290 highway is 5 minutes away and can get you to downtown Chicago in 15 minutes. You can get to either O'Hare or Midway airports in 25 minutes by car.

If you prefer to take in Oak Park on foot, you can get to most attractions in 20-25 minutes. It may take you longer if you stop to admire the beautiful homes set on tree lined streets.

access:
*Fully furnished eat-in kitchen is large and equipped with full stove, as well as wide array of cooking implements
*Wireless WI-FI-- Please note: This is a vintage building with good, strong Wi-Fi. It is not an office environment, so if you are plugging in multiple devices and streaming and running video, please do not expect lightening speeds. The house is serviced by ATT and is as fast as the neighborhood has!
description:
Did you know stays over 30 days have significantly lower fees added? 
Long time SUPER HOST--PLEASE send a message before making a booking request!
I book through several sites and want to make sure I can host you!
Ukrainian Village Named The Hottest Neighborhood In The U.S. By Redfin.

Perfect location, Great flat.
Enjoy a great urban experience staying in the Ukrainian Village of Chicago! --

ACCOMMODATIONS:
2 bedroom flat perfect for short + long term stays. This main floor apartment includes the following amenities:
Two comfortable bedrooms with double beds, clean bedding and soft lights for reading

*Fully furnished eat-in kitchen is large and equipped with full stove, as well as wide array of cooking implements.

This beautiful three story Victorian house was built in 1885, in the heart of Ukrainian village/West town, one of the oldest neighborhoods in the great city of Chicago. 
NOTE:
*Please check availability before booking--We book through several sites and want to make sure it's available for you.

* Please post your profile as we don't rent without profile information! A picture and general information about you and your traveling style are needed.

*Fully furnished eat-in kitchen is large and equipped with full stove, as well as wide array of cooking implements
*Wireless WI-FI-- Please note: This is a vintage building with good, strong Wi-Fi. It is not an office environment, so if you are plugging in multiple devices and streaming and running video, please do not expect lightening speeds. The house is serviced by ATT and is as fast as the neighborhood has!

Owner lives on the premises (not in the apartment), but you are on your own, unless you need something. Complete privacy!

NEIGHBORHOOD:
This beautiful three story Victorian house was built in 1885, in the heart of Ukrainian village/West town, one of the oldest neighborhoods in the great city of Chicago. 

This is a popular and safe neighborhood, with alot of young people, as well as little church going ladies and street food carts, local businesses. 

Walk to small or larger grocery store, mexican, thai, pan-american, mexican-french restaurants, a great pie shop, mexican bakery, wonderful coffee and sandwich joints, boutique shopping and that's just Chicago Avenue. Walk four blocks and you're on lively Division Street and the list starts all over again!

Spend some time in the fabulous Ukrainian Village, Chicago's 1st Ward

You are seconds to Chicago Avenue and CTA transportation that runs all the time to give you easy access to downtown in 15 minutes and anywhere else you want to go in the city. Shared Ride available in minutes. Walk to grocery, restaurants, parks, bars, and boutiques all within blocks. It's a great walking neighborhood!

No unregistered overnight guests without prior host approval, photo ID must be shown upon arrival.

turn off lights and  lock the doors and windows when you leave the house.
Please recycle (check the pamphlet in the apartment for Chicago rules on recycling)
Check out is 11 am. 
We want you to have fun and enjoy your stay, and respect the property and guests in the other apartments in the house.

additional_house_rules:
HOUSE RULES

Please review and adhere to the following to avoid penalties and/or cancellation of booking:

-No Drugs; Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property; ONLY guests included on the reservation are permitted on the premises. Fines will be issued for breaking these rules (Fine $100-$250).
-If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair.
- The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however, if you leave the place excessively dirty, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred.
-Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
-Lost key fee - $300
-Unsalvageable stained linens - $15/pc.
-Unsalvageable stained towels - $10/pc.
-Smoking - $300
-Unauthorized bringing of pets - $300



**-No pets, except dogs & cats. If you have a dog or a cat,  an extra $50 pet cleaning fee will be added to your reservation.

description:
You can’t find luxury and convenience like this in the city! This spacious 2BR/2BA is near Chicago’s biggest corporate headquarters, high-end shopping, and fantastic restaurants of the upscale Oak Brook suburb. This brand-new development boasts luxurious amenities like a gym and resort-style outdoor pool. The community also has 24/7 security and free parking. Get the best of urban living and residential comfort just a short drive from Downtown Chicago and O’Hare.

After a busy day of meetings or retail therapy, retreat to your own swanky residence in the new Lakeside Village of Oak Brook community. Enjoy being one of the development’s first tenants and among the lucky few Chicago visitors to enjoy perks like a refreshing outdoor pool and state-of-the-art fitness center. You also get to park for free - you won’t find that Downtown!

This 2-bedroom apartment can comfortably sleep 6, with two private bedrooms and plenty of space. One bedroom features a queen-size bed, and the other bedroom has 2 queen-size beds. If you did some shopping at the upscale Oakbrook Center (7-minute drive away), home to stores like Neiman Marcus and Nordstrom, you’ll find plenty of closet space to store your finds.

Two bathrooms ensure everybody has privacy with modern fixtures worthy of a five-star hotel. For your comfort and convenience, we provide all towels, linens, toiletries, a hair dryer, and an iron. 

If you’re traveling on business, maybe to visit the nearby corporate headquarters of Microsoft, Ace Hardware, or Kellogg’s, you’ll be happy to know the apartment includes homey amenities like a full kitchen and a spacious living room. Cook up some breakfast in the kitchen, which features modern appliances and all the dishes, serveware, and utensils you’d need. And when the day is done, kick back and relax on the couch.

Or if your Windy City trip is a family vacation or getaway with friends, the apartment is the perfect place to spend time with loved ones. Hang out around the dining table with some Chicago craft beers and deep dish pizza, or just chat for hours in the living room.

Families love our residential location for the quiet, safe atmosphere - the community has on-site security 24/7 and you won’t hear any of the typical city noises. And if you’re in town for a social event, you’ll be in close proximity to the numerous wedding venues, banquet halls, golf courses, country clubs, and restaurants of Oak Brook.

Besides the apartment itself, you’ll have access to the spectacular amenities of the Lakeside Village development. In the summer, take advantage of the sparkling outdoor pool and the picnic area, and in the winter, cozy up to the fireplace in the resident lounge or get some exercise in the fitness center.

We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

Just east of Downtown Chicago, the upscale suburb of Oak Brook is known for its rolling golf courses, high-end shopping, and concentration of corporate headquarters that draw visitors from around the world.

Within a short drive of the apartment, golfers can go for holes-in-one at Butterfield Country Club, Butler National Golf Club, Chicago Highlands Club, Fresh Meadow Golf Club, and more. These country clubs are also known for their banquet and social event facilities.

Golf courses aren’t the only places to relax around here; don’t miss the beautiful Morton Arboretum, known for hiking and biking trails and summertime picnic spots. The Danada Forest Preserve is home to lush parkland and the Danada House, a popular wedding venue. Craving a delicious meal? Don’t miss Oak Brook’s impressive dining scene, which features high-end steakhouses like Michael Jordan’s Restaurant and The Capital Grille.

When the Windy City weather takes a turn, head inside to the plethora of leisure attractions in the Oak Brook area. Shopaholics from around the Chicago metro head to the Oakbrook Center for stores like Restoration Hardware, Apple, and Louis Vuitton. It’s anchored by Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, Macy’s, and Sears. In addition to the AMC Theatre at this mall, movie buffs can also catch the latest blockbusters at the AMC Dine-In at Yorktown Center, about 5 minutes from the apartment by car.

Oak Brook also means business; a plethora of national and global corporations have headquarters here. The head offices of Kellogg’s, RedBox, Ace Hardware, Microsoft, and more are within a few minutes’ drive.

Of course, no Chicago trip is complete without a selfie in front of the Bean or a slice of deep dish pizza. If you’re heading into Downtown Chi-Town, our apartment has easy freeway access, which makes accessing the city center a breeze.

While taking the L train is the best way to get around Downtown, we recommend driving to get to the highlights of Oak Brook. The apartment has free, secure parking - as does nearly every business, restaurant, and venue in Oak Brook.

If you’re flying into Chi-Town, we recommend renting a car and driving to the apartment. We’re a short drive from both O’Hare International Airport (about 20 minutes) and Midway (about 25 minutes).

Downtown Chicago is about a 30-minute drive from the apartment, depending on traffic. Keep in mind that traffic may increase during rush hour. If you’re heading into town for drinks, Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro.

**Swimming Pool is closed during the winter season.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.

description:
Studio apartment. As a new addition to the Logan Square neighborhood in Chicago, Noca Blu is one of the most luxurious apartment experiences in the area. Blending style, culture, and convenience with an unbeatable location only minutes away from the Blue Line and downtown, our apartments for rent in Chicago are here to put all the shopping, dining, and entertainment of Logan Square on your doorstep. Plus, we’re confident our pet-friendly community will easily make your dream home in Chicago.

Noca Blu brings forth all the creature comforts of home and welcomes you with an abundance of amenities, impeccable services, and inspired floor plans. From the rooftop terrace, resident lounge, and fitness center to the indoor and outdoor parking, bike storage, and in-home washers and dryers, we’ve left nothing to chance. Inside your new studio, one or two-bedroom home, more lavish features and comfort await. You’ll love the open floor plans of our apartments, full bathrooms, and soaking tubs. Not to mention the well-equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, and large walk-in closets. To make it even more convenient, our residents also enjoy an exclusive discount for furniture rentals via CORT, efficient VRF heating & cooling systems, and, in select units, high ceilings, IOTAS smart home tech or private terraces.

Find out more about our luxury apartments in Chicago’s Logan Square and make sure to set time aside and swing by for a personal tour. We’d love to show you everything Noca Blu has to offer and help you pick out the perfect home for you!

access:
***The room is at 1st floor***

I have many rooms fits all needs in 3 different places close by loop Chicago. 
Room1- big space with queen bed + sofa + twin bed 
Room2- big space with queen bed + sofa 
Room3- queen bed + a bed table 
Room4- queen bed + a desk 
Room5- queen bed + a desk 
Room6- queen bed + a desk 
Room7- queen bed + a desk 
Room8- queen bed + a desk   - (private bathroom)
Room9- queen bed + a desk
Room10- full bed + a bed table 
Room11- queen bed + a desk + twin bed 

***The room is at 1st floor***

Special party:
-- If needed an additional twin bed for 3rd guest, could choose room 1/6/7/9 with $15 extra. 
(Need to notice me when reserving, so I could arrange it)
-- If needed a private bathroom, could book room 8.
-- If needed a private space & bathroom, could book room 3 and 4 together it's entire apartment. 
-- Early bird & late arrival / departure.
Anytime you arrive could check in with digital door and password. 
Each room has its own lock.
Luggage could storage in till before/ after check out. 
-- Any other special needs feel free to ask.
description:
Welcome to Chicago! 

Michael and I felt in love with this city, the lake, the buildings, the city. 
So we decided to stay and share our home for travelers like you! 

Close to downtown chicago/ McCormick Center.
Walking distance to public transportation.

❤️ Guaranteed parking 24/7 for free. ❤️
@ 1st floor

- New bed and towels for every guest!
- Walking distance to tons of great restaurants! Altantic Chinese foods! Milk tea, cafes! 
- To downtown Chicago, McCormick center, IIT, UIC and the Lake Michigan is less than 15 mins.
- Guaranteed free parking 24/7 at Canal in front of the house. 
***❤️The room is at 1st floor❤️***

***The room is at 1st floor***

I have many rooms fits all needs in 3 different places close by loop Chicago. 
Room1- big space with queen bed + sofa + twin bed 
Room2- big space with queen bed + sofa 
Room3- queen bed + a bed table 
Room4- queen bed + a desk 
Room5- queen bed + a desk 
Room6- queen bed + a desk 
Room7- queen bed + a desk 
Room8- queen bed + a desk   - (private bathroom)
Room9- queen bed + a desk
Room10- full bed + a bed table 
Room11- queen bed + a desk + twin bed 

***The room is at 1st floor***

Special party:
-- If needed an additional twin bed for 3rd guest, could choose room 1/6/7/9 with $15 extra. 
(Need to notice me when reserving, so I could arrange it)
-- If needed a private bathroom, could book room 8.
-- If needed a private space & bathroom, could book room 3 and 4 together it's entire apartment. 
-- Early bird & late arrival / departure.
Anytime you arrive could check in with digital door and password. 
Each room has its own lock.
Luggage could storage in till before/ after check out. 
-- Any other special needs feel free to ask.

What to offer:
1- High speed internet
2- Make you easy meal in the gourmet kitchen with all supplies.
3- Inside the room
A real queen bed, new towels, desk, water, candies.
4- Outside the room:
Neat bathroom, new towels, soap, shampoo, slippers, iron, hair dryer, straighten, supplementary fruit, energy bar, candies etc.

Getting around: 
Uber to downtown $5 
Uber to MDW airport $15
Uber to ORD airport $25

Bus #62 to downtown.
Bus #44 stop is at the corner of the building.
Walking distance to Orange Train / Red Train. 7-11 mins. 
**Chicago bus and train are from the same company call CTA
***You could online search their schedule. 
**Cost 2.25 transfer for free.

Check in is flexible. 
Check in anytime with password to get in the house whenever you arrive.
* The room is ready to check in and out around 11am-11:30am. 
* House could still have access to such like living room/ bathroom/ kitchen. 
Cleaning staff come everyday at 11am to prepare the room for next guest.
You're welcome to stay whenever your schedule goes with. BUT, since my airbnb listing very full booked. 
Luggage will prefer to bring outside of the room, so that I could clean the room for the next guest! 
Thank you.

this is a entire 960   square ft.  main floor renovated ; two bedrooms , living room , dinning room, kitchen , bathroom and porch .

the main floor has all rooms hardwood floors . bathroom it's complet new renovate with  marble floor , new  shower tile and tub . new mirror , vanity and light fixtures. the kitchen has  new granite countertop and back splash  , stainless steel sink , hood exhaust , new fridge , pots , pansand  and dishes . profecional paint  all rooms whit  new cortines , blankets,  pillows,   floor mats  and  3 new  screen tv ,  one each room and one in the living room. you can park on the street is plenty of parking but make sure you read the rules of sweep days , thursdays south side and friday north side.

access:
Guests have total access to the studio, though the pool and gym available in the building is partially shared.
You have totally access to the kitchen furnitures and equipments: stove, oven, refrigerator, electric kettle, coffee maker, toaster, dishes, glasses and cutlery. Also, to the bathroom amenities: shampoo, conditioner, body soap and hair dryer.
description:
Our place is great for couples, sports & entertainment enthusiasts, foodies, small families and city adventurers. We are in River North neighborhood, close to the Museum Of Contemporary Art Chicago and historical city arts, a variety of bars and restaurants like the True Food Kitchen, Catch 35 and Somerset. For an easily tour in the city, the building is close to the major subway and train lines. You have no excuses to do not enjoy this beautiful city with a  comfort that you deserve.

Our studio apartment is totally private and have an open concept.  You can relax on comfortable furniture and sunbathe on summer days in the pool available for guests through the building. Inside you will find a comfortable queen-sized bed, a complete kitchen, and a lovely bathroom with the essential amenities. There is a table for your meals that is convertible in a place for work. The WiFi has high-speed internet, and in the living room there is a flat screen TV with Netflix, which you can watch while unwinding in the sofa (that can be convertible in a single bed). There is a full closet with adequate room for coats and clothes storage as well.

Guests have total access to the studio, though the pool and gym available in the building is partially shared.
You have totally access to the kitchen furnitures and equipments: stove, oven, refrigerator, electric kettle, coffee maker, toaster, dishes, glasses and cutlery. Also, to the bathroom amenities: shampoo, conditioner, body soap and hair dryer.

We want to make sure you have the most convenient experience possible. Once booked, you will be e-mailed detailed instructions for check-in process. During your stay we can help with questions such as the wifi password and other general property-related. If this has not covered your questions, and you still need to reach us for any reason, we are readily available for questions or concerns via Airbnb messaging. Of course in case of emergency you can always reach us via phone call or sms texts.

If you are interested in receive any information about restaurants or places to go, you can contact us, anytime :) Please let us know in prior if you have any problem with the apartment. We will send someone to assist you.

access: Private bedroom and private bathroom.  Guests will also be able to mix/mingle in the common living space (living room, dining room, and kitchen).
description:
Wake to tasteful green walls in wood-floored rooms with a pared-down aesthetic. Rent one room for up to two people. Lovingly restored shared spaces have high ceilings, original beams and moldings, and a Tiffany window. The 2-storey home offers private bathrooms and a study.

We have two bedrooms that you can choose from and each, has their own bathroom. The first is comfortable bedroom with a Queen tempurpedic/memory foam bed. Bedroom has two side tables and closet available for use during your stay. The second is offers a full-size bed with a dresser to store your things. Either room is available for use and  if you have more than 2 people in your party,  ask me for pricing details. 

Short term rentals are preferred, however, if you are looking for a month or longer, please reach out to discuss.

Additionally, we do have a Peleton. If you like to ride, bring your shoes along as your more than welcome to take classes during your stay.

Private bedroom and private bathroom.  Guests will also be able to mix/mingle in the common living space (living room, dining room, and kitchen).

I (Johnny) work from home but tend to be in and our during the work day and would welcome some distraction from time to time.  Please, feel free to join me for coffee in the morning or for a cocktail in the evening.  Of course, if you just want to come in and out, please feel free to do so.

Charming, quaint, tree-lined Andersonville is very walkable, with lots of restaurants, coffee shops, antique stores, and boutique shops. Embrace the neighborhood’s slower pace, knowing that just a few miles away is the Mag Mile.

Andersonville is well connected to the rest of Chicago.  About a 10 minute walk is the Red Line train (either Bryn Mawr or Berwyn), runs north/south in the city. Many other bus lines accessible.  Uber/Lyft come in handy as well if you're not a fan of public transit.

Events held in this space are prohibited.

I live in this beautiful home with my partner, Brian, and our dog Roxie.

WE have owned this building for 35 years and still live there but, we just retired and travel to Mexico and Dallas ,Tx.

we have owned this building for 35 years and still live there but, we just retired and travel to Mexico and Dallas ,Tx. They are in  & out and very friendly. There is a crew we have that will take care anything you may need.

The neighborhood is safe.  There is free street parking.  There is a grocery store 3 blocks away. There is a few coffee shops and restaurants  within mins away.

The blue line train is a few mins away. The Metro is also close by. 
There is a bike rental a block away . The ohare airport is 20m away. downtown is 15m away, cubs stadium is 7min away. one bus there if no car.

access: Guests will have access to the entire condo and one parking space in the garage. The garage space is just 75" tall so some taller vehicles may not be able to fit.
description:
This stylish 4 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom condo is beautifully decorated and has been featured recently on HGTV! The condo has three outdoor decks, including an incredible roofdeck with amazing views of the Chicago Skyline. There is one parking space in a secure, private garage. There is also convenient access to the train, which allows you to explore all of the incredible things Chicago has to offer. This is a great option for families and friends looking for a large, luxurious floor plan.

The 4 bedroom condo is laid out over two floors. The main floor features the kitchen, living room, three bedrooms, and two outdoor patios. The kitchen and living room are part of an open concept that is perfect for groups to enjoy. The kitchen is fully stocked and provides everything a chef needs to prepare a fantastic meal. The large island provides counter seating in addition to a dining room table. There is a large outdoor patio with access from the kitchen that is a great option for entertaining when the weather allows. The living room enjoys vaulted ceilings and large windows that bring in tons of natural light. There is a small outdoor patio with access from the living room. 

There are three bedrooms on the main floor of the condo that are located down a hallway from the kitchen. The master bedroom has a queen bed, tons of closet space, and an en suite bathroom with a large, luxurious walk in shower. The master bedroom also has access to the outdoor patio that has access from the kitchen. The second bedroom on this floor is a guest bedroom with a queen bed. Lastly, the third bedroom on this floor has two sets of twin over twin bunk beds. The second bathroom is located next to the bedrooms and has a shower tub, which is a nice option for groups traveling with children. 

The staircase to the upstairs level of the condo is located off of the living room. The fourth bedroom is located upstairs and has a full size bed. Additionally, there is a wet bar, sleeper sofa, and a powder room (half bathroom) on the upstairs level. Lastly, there is access to the roof deck, which is one of the most stunning parts of the condo. The roof deck has amazing views of the skyline and is spacious enough for everyone in your group to enjoy!

If you'd like a virtual tour of our home, check out Windy City Rehab Season 1 Episode 4!

Guests will have access to the entire condo and one parking space in the garage. The garage space is just 75" tall so some taller vehicles may not be able to fit.

We are off-site but nearby if you need anything!

Our home is located in the heart of Lincoln Park. One of the oldest neighborhoods of the city, LP features tons of nearby coffee shops, restaurants, and bars. There are a few city parks just a short walk away and you can catch the L at the nearby Fullerton stop. Guests can enjoy easy access to DePaul University, which is just half a mile southwest. If you're looking for family friendly fun, you can head 10 minutes east to Lincoln Park Conservatory and Zoo. The best part is that they're free!

Uber is available and there is an L station at Fullerton and Sheffield Avenues about a six minute walk from the condo. Buses also run along Fullerton and Sheffield Avenues.

There is only parking in the garage for 1 car. The space may fit 2 cars if the cars are small and compact. If you cannot park in the car, there is free street parking nearby, but please be mindful of signs.

description:
Location. Style. Comfort.
Our vintage 1906 home has been fully renovated by our in-house architect and offers a well-equipped gourmet kitchen, 5 bedrooms including an entire 3rd floor Master Suite, another suite on the lower level, and plenty of comfy indoor and relaxing outdoor spaces. We're fellow travelers and happy to host you!

Also enjoy our front porch, two-level back deck and pergola farm table that seats 10.

We're happy to respond to your needs in a timely way before and during your stay.

We live in one of the most desirable areas in the Chicago area, on a lovely tree-lined cul-de-sac. Our home is only a few blocks from downtown Oak Park and the Frank Lloyd Wright & Ernest Hemingway historic districts and to many restaurants, cafes, theaters and shops.

We live in central Oak Park, so we're a short walk to 2 city train lines and the Metra.  Oak Park is a 15 min Uber and 20 min train to downtown Chicago.

Please remove shoes to protect original floors and rugs.
No smoking in or around the home.

description:
Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this cheery one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Gold Coast home with stunning  views over the city. (#CHI140)

Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your bright living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this Gold Coast apartment has to offer. 


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- In-Building Laundry
- Pet Friendly

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished rental is in the historic Gold Coast district. The area is located just north of downtown Chicago, nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline. Considered one of the most affluent neighborhoods in the country, the Gold Coast is every upscale shopper’s dream. The retail revelry on Oak and Rush Streets includes swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions. There are many celebrated restaurants to try, including Michelin-starred winners and classic Chicago steakhouses. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, there is a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
house_rules:
- A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled
- Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty)
- All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property.
- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details
interaction:
The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
