access: Everything in the house.
description:
Newly remodeled condo in Oak Park. 
Everything around the house is new. From tv to bed sheets to forks and towels.
Queen  size bed and for extra guests we have air mattress and a real comfortable couch.
Free parking spot.

Newly remodeled 1 bdr condo.

Everything in the house.

When necessary.

Striking the perfect balance between lively city and historical hub, west suburban Oak Park has been named one of the top ten neighborhoods in the United States.
American Planning Association named Oak Park the third best neighborhood in the U.S.--and their Frank Lloyd Wright Historic District contributed to the recognition. 
The neighborhood "contains the world's single greatest concentration of residences designed by architects collectively known as the Prairie School," the American Planning Association said on its website. "The extraordinary range of architecture illustrates Oak Park's evolution from rural village to urban suburb."
Frank Lloyd Wright moved to Oak Park in 1889 and the neighborhood has 23 buildings that he designed or remodeled.
Take a look at some of the places that make Oak Park a great place to live and visit:

1. Lake Theater - 1020 Lake st
2. Ernest Hemingway Museum - 200 N Oak Park Ave
3. Frank Lloyd Wright Home and Studio - 951 Chicago Ave and more

Getting around Oak Park is easy. You do not even have to own a car. Oak Park has an abundance of public transportation options that will let you get into, out of and around the community effortlessly.

Two Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) elevated rail lines (Blue and Green), the Metra (Union Pacific West Line) train, PACE and CTA bus lines serve Oak Park.

Bus station is around the corner.
house_rules:
No smoking, remove your shoes inside the apartment and be respectful with neighbors.
When you leave throw the garbage in trash located in back of the building.

access: All the common spaces are welcome to our guests.
description:
Comfy Bedroom Queen Suite with a private full bathroom attached to the bedrooms for private use for this  bedroom suite.  Plush crisp linens & ample pillows on comfortable queen sized beds. Fully stocked bathroom, with a shower/ bath tub , shampoo, conditioner and blow dryer for your use. Each room has its own independent lighting and separate private entrance and exit.  And a small dresser for clothing storage.

Guests are free to use the following spaces for me: the kitchen and all the appliances, dining room, the living space and the fireplace, and the smart television and back porch.

All the common spaces are welcome to our guests.

I am available to you as often or as little as you need. Of course always at your reach through the Airbnb app.

Whole foods, Italian, Portuguese, Mexican, southern restaurants and little cafés, along with movie theaters are all located in Hyde Park a quick 5 minute Uber ride. The lake is one and a half blocks from the space as well as the Marina’s and golf course. Thank you

Uber or Lyft is a wonderful option. And parking is free and ample on the street right in front of the property. Thank you

description:
This is a mid-century townhouse in the trendy Lakeview neighborhood of Chicago.  We are close to all amenities, restaurants, shopping, clubs, the park, the lake, and bus stops.  There is a washer/dryer and wifi. 
  The house has a newly remodeled kitchen.
  We are offering a small  bedroom with a double bed and a private bathroom just outside the room.  The bedroom is well-worn and in need of renovations, but cozy and comfortable.  The bathroom needs updating but everything works fine!

The Wi-fi network is sunnie and randy. The password is music123.

Our housekeeper is Vira Bernadina if you have any problems and can't reach us. Her email is viraberna@yahoo.com. Her cell phone is 773.771.4606

We are happy to interact as much or as little as is comfortable for you.

We never need to leave our neighborhood for anything. All the restaurants, shopping, services, and grocery stores are close by.


Super convenient! The bus to downtown and the Magnificent Mile is across the street.

description:
Beautiful & Luxurious King Master Suite w/The best of features designed with you and your guest in mind. Enjoy a plush pillow top California King bed & hydrotherapy jacuzzi with a custom double sided fire place & an in room mini bar for your private escape. Sink into a luxurious bath and choose from an aromatherapy backbar of  lavender or rose bath salts as you sip on a crisp glass of champagne. Your privacy is assured as your suite features a pin code lock pad that only grants you access:)

Find refuge in this mini private getaway suite. California king bed, crisp linens and a soothing fireplace.  Or escape  into  the master spa suite and relax in the hydro therapy jacuzzi next to the fireplace while you enjoy a beverage from our fully stocked mini bar.

You are free to enjoy every square foot of the space :)

I’m available to you as needed:)

The lake, the marinas, the golf course , Hyde park down town and the loop!

Uber and parking is free

WiFi password in the unit. And download google home to cast to the smart tv!
house_rules:
Kindly mind the beautiful carpets please<3

Please absolutely no loud music and no smoking cigarettes or marijuana in the house or outside of the house and absolutely no smoking marijuana on the property.

access: You will have access to the interior of the house and the patio which is accessible from our lower floor. The stairs attached to the back of our unit are private and reserved for our neighbors who live above us.
description: Gather your family and friends at this well decorated but comfortable triplex in the Southport neighborhood. Located just off the brown line L stop, this home is kid friendly and well suited for summer time gatherings. This location is perfect if you're looking to attend a Cubs game, walk to the lake or enjoy the amazing neighborhood and restaurants only a couple minutes away.
house_rules: No Bachelor or Bachelorette Parties
interaction: My wife and I absolutely love our area and want to make sure you have a fantastic time while staying at our place. As our previous guests can attest, we love providing recommendations and making sure everything you could possibly need is taken care of.
neighborhood_overview: The house is close to Wrigley Field, shopping (boutiques and mainstream retailers), bars, restaurants, and parks for the kids to play in.
space:
Our triplex includes 3 Levels, 2 Living Rooms, 2 Fireplaces and a private outdoor space.

Our triplex has been outfitted Smart Home capabilities which are available for all guest to utilize while staying with us. 

- Nest Thermostat
- Great Wifi Reception Throughout the House
- Smart TV's (YouTubeTV, HBO, Showtime, Netflix, )
- Multiple Sonos Speakers Throughout The Home

If you need access to parking, we have you covered! There is one dedicated parking spot behind our unit and street parking passes are available at no charge.
summary: Gather your family and friends at this well decorated but comfortable triplex in the Southport neighborhood. Located just off the brown line L stop, this home is kid friendly and well suited for summer time gatherings. This location is perfect if you're looking to attend a Cubs game, walk to the lake or enjoy the amazing neighborhood and restaurants only a couple minutes away.
transit:
Our place is only a 45 second walk to the Southport Brown line L stop. This will take you almost anywhere you'd like... Lincoln Park, downtown Chicago, River North etc.

Additionally you'll find that our neighborhood is extremely walkable with great restaurants and bars up and down Southport Avenue (just outside our door).

description:
Private room in a 2BR apartment (the other room is also available on Airbnb). Minutes from Wrigley field, countless nightlife options, great food, and public transit as well!

Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.

THIS TROVE HAS

✔ Fully equipped kitchen
✔ In-unit washer/dryer
✔ Dishwasher
✔ Coffee maker
✔ 44" Smart TV w/ Netflix (no cable TV)

--and more!

EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS

During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club and co-working space located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower (for reservations <14 days).  Included with your membership:

✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars
✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan
✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck

Metropolitan Club Hours:

Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm
Saturday: 5pm – 10pm
Sunday: Closed

HAVE A QUESTION?

Check out the “Other Things to Note” section of this listing for the answers to my most frequently asked questions.

WHY STAY WITH TROVE?

⭐ Fast Communication
We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes.

⭐ Experienced Hosts
We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years.

⭐ Exclusive Perks
Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower.

⭐ Easy Self-Check-In
Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay!

⭐ Central Location
You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.

We're located in Lakeview, one of Chicago's safest and most popular neighborhoods. Most of the area's restaurants, bars, and shops are concentrated on Belmont Ave,  Sheffield Ave, Clark St, Broadway St, and Halsted St. There are also plenty of hidden gems and tucked-away spots to discover for those who like to wander.

THINGS TO DO NEARBY

✔ Walk to Wrigleyville and catch a Cub's game.
✔ Admire the Chicago skyline from the Lakefront Trail.
✔ Catch a live show at the Vic Theatre.
✔ Choose from over 300 beers at Beermiscuous.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Belmont Red/Brown Line 'L' train station is a 5-minute walk away.
→ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?”

Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our building is just a short walk from the Belmont “L” train station. Search for “Belmont red line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest.

2. “Is there parking nearby?”

Parking in Chicago is always difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using an app called SpotHero to reserve a nearby paid parking spot. We love SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding one the day you arrive.

3. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3pm or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30am to drop off your bags in the living room (just note that our staff will have your room ready by 3pm).

Check-out is at 11am. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11am, but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30pm at the latest.

description:
Come relax in this stylish 1BD/1BA apartment, professionally managed by Kasa. 
In the middle of all Chicago has to offer - near Oak Street Beach, Michigan Avenue and Gold Coast are all within walking distance. Chicago's best shopping, dining and entertainment just foot steps away. 

Key features include: 
* Relax in the luxurious king-sized bed with memory foam mattress
* Queen Size Sofa Sleeper in living room
* Cook and enjoy wonderful cuisine with the modern high-end kitchen 
* Browse the web and stream HD video with ultra high-speed internet 
* Pet Friendly! Enjoy your Kasa with your furry friend! 
Note: Pet Fee of $15 per day will apply with a 1 pet limit.

House Rules: 
We created Kasa to be your home on the road.  We’re committed to being great neighbors and strictly enforce these House Rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. NO Smoking - Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property. This applies to the entire apartment (including the balcony or patio), as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. Noise - At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment. In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9:00 p.m. to 8:00 a.m.  Parties and large gatherings are prohibited.  Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy.   Occupancy – Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit. There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted.  Lost and Found - Kasa assumes no liability for lost, misplaced, stolen, or damaged belongings, including any belongings which are left in the unit after your departure time has passed.  Pets –With the exception of service animals, breed and pet restrictions are imposed by the building management. Requests to bring a pet must be approved by Kasa prior to booking. $15 Daily pet fee per day will apply. Pet fees are not included in the total reservation price. If you are authorized to bring a pet, an additional pet fee will be applied after the booking is complete. Kasa has a 1 pet per apartment limit.  Return of Fobs & Keys – All designated fobs, keys, and parking passes must be left in the apartment upon check out.  Failure to do so will result in an immediate replacement fee of up to $250.00 per item. Please alert Kasa staff immediately if any items are missing at the beginning of your stay.   Infestation - If Kasa determines that you have brought any infestation into the unit or onto the premises, Kasa reserves the right to charge you for any and all costs and expenses that Kasa deems necessary to address the infestation.  Parking at Own Risk - All vehicles parked on the premises must be registered with Kasa prior to arrival. Vehicles are parked at the risk of the owner. Kasa shall not assume liability or responsibility for any vehicle, occupants, or contents while operated or parked on the property.  Damaged or Missing Property - Guests are liable for any damage and/or theft at the unit, premises, or property caused by the guest, their visitors, or other persons present in the unit during the guest’s stay. This includes damage to rooms, fixtures, furnishings and equipment (such as towels, artwork, electronics, and kitchen equipment). Kasa reserves the right to charge guests for 120% of such amounts as it shall in its sole discretion deem necessary to compensate or make good the costs or expenses incurred or suffered by Kasa as a result of the damage and/or theft. Charges may include but are not limited to: all property damage; missing or damaged items; smoking fee; cleaning fee; and guest compensation.  Identity Verification - To protect against identity theft and fraud, and for the safety of other guests and neighbors in the community, you will be required to provide a scanned or photographed copy of your valid, government-issued photo ID during the virtual check-in process for the purpose of performing a background check or screening.  Use - The unit and amenity areas shall not be used for any unlawful or illegal purpose. No nails, screws, or other items may be driven into any portion of the unit. Guests shall use the unit for residential purposes only. Guests shall not conduct any commercial, industrial, or retail activity in the unit.  Client Accommodation Agreement - Prior to arrival, all guests must agree to abide by the Kasa Stay Rules, which will be provided to the guest for review and signature during the virtual check-in process. Security Deposit – Non-compliance with the House Rules and Kasa Stay Rules could result in a penalty and/or forfeiture of the Security Deposit and/or eviction without a refund.

additional_house_rules:
Check-in – between 3 pm - 8 pm (flexible subject to availability). 

Check-out – by 11 am (flexible subject to availability).

For the comfort of all guests, The Sono is a completely smoke-free environment.

All Rates include continental breakfast (8 am – 10 am in the kitchen area.

Children under the age of 14, unregistered guests, and pets, unfortunately, cannot be accommodated.

Each additional person above two guests in a room is $20 per night.

Parking – Free street parking with permit provided by The Sono Chicago. (Please be aware that parking is restricted within 15 feet on either side of fire hydrant and parking is restricted in school zone across from The Sono Chicago. We are not responsible for any parking violations received.

For the comfort of our other guests and neighbors, The Sono upholds a zero-tolerance policy towards commotion, excessive noise, and parties (between the hours of 10 pm and 8 am)

description:
We offer guests intimate accommodations in a quiet neighborhood to really have a peaceful experience in Chicago. Our cozy and charming rooms include luxurious beds in either king or queen size. The spacious rooms have one or two beds. Each room has a modern style and neutral tones for a refreshing, luxurious finish.

Head down to our ground floor kitchen for breakfast every morning before beginning your Chicago adventures for the day. We are located in Chicago’s historic Old Town neighborhood, within walking distance to North Avenue Beach or nearby other destinations such as the Chicago History museum, Royal George Theatre, and the Chicago Center for the Performing Arts.

Each room includes
Large flat screen TV
Free WiFi
Private en-suite bathroom

We have an inn-keeper who lives on-site. We are available for our guests at any time and love nothing more than providing recommendations for things to do and eat.

The Sono Chicago is conveniently located at 1428 N. Cleveland Avenue in Chicago's Old Town neighborhood. A variety of restaurants are within walking distance, offering options to mingle with both tourists and locals alike. North Avenue Beach, Chicago's most famous beach, is a close 20-minute walk, where you can soak up the sun, swim, play beach volleyball or participate in other water activities on Lake Michigan. Spas, boutiques, comedy clubs, parks, museums, sporting venues and more shopping than you can imagine are located in close proximity to The Sono, providing endless options for added relaxation and entertainment for your Chicago getaway.

access: You will have access to the whole apartment
description:
Located literally steps away from Christ Hospital in Oak Lawn and 5 miles from Midway Airport in Chicago, the rental space offers all of the amenities of home that one can ever hope for.  Two full bedrooms with full size beds along with a pullout couch can accommodate up to 6 adults.  Whether your in town on business, or here for personal reasons, our space has been meticulously designed to provide you with the best stay in the area!

The space features Amazon Alexa,  flat-screen TV's in the living room and both bedrooms, USB plug in wall outlets throughout the space, full kitchen with cookware, Murphy bed in bedroom 1, laundry facilities on site,  universal phone charging stations, high speed WiFI, Comcast Xfinity cable TV, iron and ironing board.....the list goes on and on!!!

You will have access to the whole apartment

I live in the building in the 3rd floor apartment, so I will be readily available.

The space is located literally steps from Christ Hospital.  It is 5 miles from Midway Airport and 2 miles from St. Xavier University.  There is a park a half block away that the kids will have plenty to do at.  95th st offers a ton of restaurant and bar options.  We have provided take out menus for some of our favorite spots to eat at on the kitchen table.  You can also feel free to ask Alexa what some of her recommendations are!

There are a number of different options around to navigate the south Chicago suburbs and the City of Chicago.  The space is located right off of the busy 95th and Cicero intersection in Oak Lawn.  It is also set between I294 and I90/94 and 2 blocks away from Southwest Highway.  There is a new Metra station that is about a mile west down 95th that can whisk you away to Downtown Chicago in about 15 minutes!

There is a new Metra station that is about a mile west down 95th that can whisk you away to Downtown Chicago in about 15 minutes!

- -No smoking. If you smoke inside the unit or property, we will cancel your reservation and we will fine you for $200 for damages.
- -No Drugs (including Marijuana).
- -Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property.
- -No Parties or events, No outside visitors, and No overnight guests without previous approval from your host.
- -Any approved additional overnight guests must pay the extra person fee outlined on our AirBnB profile.
- -No pets, except Dogs & Cats are allowed. -Bathroom is meant for Shower Use Only.
- -All food items should be stored in designated food areas and not left out, to avoid pests.
- -Use kitchen freely but clean up any mess that is created, including dishes, counters, stove, microwave; no dirty dishes should be left in the sink overnight.

The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however if you leave the place excessively dirty, with dirty dishes and garbage everywhere, that requires more cleaning, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred.

- -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
- -If you have pets an extra $50 dollar cleaning fee will be added to your reservation

access:
Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours. 

But that’s not all! You’ll also have access to the building’s gym (open 24/7 and stocked with cardio machines and weights) and lobby lounge area. The building’s common spaces and your unit are accessible via elevator.
description:
Cubs fans, deep-dish fans, and history fans unite! Chicago is a fabulous getaway city for any interest, and our spacious studio apartment is the ideal place to stay while you’re here. Featuring modern decor, a full kitchen, and access to a 24/7 gym, your time in Chi-Town will be comfortable and convenient. 

Our place is just a 5-minute walk to two CTA stations that will take you Downtown or north to Loyola or Evanston. And our walkable neighborhood has theaters, parks, and lots of good eats.

In the heart of trendy Uptown Chicago, our sophisticated studio apartment is the perfect launchpad for Windy City adventures or clinching that important business deal. Whatever brings you to town, you’ll rest easy in our charming, quiet neighborhood with easy access to the Red Line train to take you south to Downtown or north to Loyola and Evanston.

Illuminated by sunny natural light, our studio features a Queen-size bed, premium linens, and plenty of closet space so you can unpack and forget about your suitcase for a while. Enjoy the privacy of your own room, with doors that close and independently controlled air-conditioning units.

The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower!

There’s ample space for everyone to relax in our studio. Like the rest of the unit, you’ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor. 

Whether you’re craving a home-cooked meal or just somewhere to put the box of deep-dish, our kitchen is fully stocked with cookware, dishes, utensils, and has swanky granite countertops. Appliances include a full-sized fridge and freezer, gas stove, oven, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker. A nice space cozy bathroom with shower (half shower door) complete with basic bath essentials. The only things missing are your favorite farmer’s market finds!

And as a building resident, feel free to use the gym (open 24/7 in case the urge to work out strikes at any time), do a load or two in the laundry room, and kick back in the lobby. Pro tip: the laundry room operates on a BYOQ system - that’s Bring Your Own Quarters.

Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours. 

But that’s not all! You’ll also have access to the building’s gym (open 24/7 and stocked with cardio machines and weights) and lobby lounge area. The building’s common spaces and your unit are accessible via elevator.

We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

If you’re searching for Chicago history and culture, but you also want to get a good night’s sleep without the non-stop noise of Downtown, Uptown is your ‘hood. Uptown is slightly north of Downtown, and just a mile west of Montrose Beach and Lake Shore Drive. It’s safe, a little historic, a little trendy, and a perfect home base for any Chi-Town getaway. Our apartment is within walking distance of coffee shops (including a Starbucks), banks, and grocery stores.

More information

This hip neighborhood features old-school Chicago gems like the famed Riviera Theatre, the much-loved Fat Cat Restaurant & Bar, and easy access to Wrigley Field and Downtown via the Red Line from Lawrence Station. With plenty of good restaurants, vibrant bars, and exciting venues, you might find yourself not even wanting to venture downtown!

Some of our favorite nearby restaurants include Fat Cat, where you can indulge in tasty pub grub over a game of pool, and Demera, an Ethiopian restaurant serving top-notch coffee shareable small plates. Fat Cat is only a 2-minute walk from our place, and Demera is a 5-minute walk at most. Need a coffee fix in a hurry? There’s a Starbucks across the street from Demera, in the Bridgeview Bank Building.

Searching for some more global cuisine? Argyle Street, just 5 minutes by foot north of our building, is home to some of Chicago’s best Vietnamese restaurants. We love Tank Noodle, Nha Hang, and for dessert, La Patisserie P. Chinese fare is also popular on Argyle Street, like Chiu Quon Bakery (try the authentic egg tarts!) and the Hong Kong-inspired Sun Wah BBQ.

How about an adult beverage at the end of the day? Uptown has no shortage of nightlife, and one must-visit watering hole is the famed live music hotspot The Green Mill. Nearly every night of the week, you’ll find local or touring artists from the full spectrum of genres. Another classic music venue is the Riviera Theatre, which has been dazzling patrons since 1917. The Riviera is only a 5-minute walk from our apartment, as is the storied Aragon Ballroom. Aragon’s intimate theatre is the perfect place to see a show without the massive crowds of an arena concert. 

Baseball fans will be happy to know that our apartment is only a 7-minute L ride from Wrigley Field - just take the Red Line from Lawrence to Addison. Now that’s what we call a home run location! Sorry, we had to. Also a short walk from Addison Station is the 1920s-era Music Box Theatre, which now screens a fascinating variety of indie and international films.

Continue a few more stops on the Red Line, and you’ll enter Downtown Chicago, home to attractions like the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, and the mirrored Bean sculpture (whose real name is actually Cloud Gate). If you’re traveling with kids, don’t miss the Shedd Aquarium The ride is only about 20 minutes from Lawrence station, and during rush hour, you’ll avoid traffic by taking the L. 

But Downtown Chicago isn’t the only other neighborhood worth exploring; from our convenient Uptown location, Lakeview and Boystown are both easy accessible. From Wellington Station (about 10 minutes south on the Red Line), don’t miss the crispy Korean-style fried chicken at Crisp or a show at the 100-year-old Vic Theatre.

Unless you’re really into parallel parking or overpriced meters, we recommend using public transportation to explore Chi-town. Our place is just a 5-minute walk to both the Argyle and Lawrence stations, where you can catch the Red Line. The Red Line will take you straight to Wrigley Field (7 minutes), or keep on riding for about 15 more minutes to access the best of Downtown. Grant/State Station is most convenient to the tasty restaurants of River North, and Lake Station puts you just 3 blocks from the Bean. P.S. Locals call the subway the “L.”

Public transit is also an easy way to get to our place from O’Hare Airport, especially during rush hour. Hop on the Blue Line at the airport, and switch to the #51 bus at the Jefferson Park Transit Center. You’ll go from baggage claim to beautiful condo in only an hour!

If ridesharing is more your style, Uber and Lyft are available throughout the Chicago metro. Keep in mind that traffic can pile up Downtown during major events or rush hour, which usually makes fares increase. Another reason why we love the L!

***WIFI service is an open connection provided by the building management and is in the works of upgrading it. Outages may be experienced from time to time while the upgrade is on going. As of this moment, the service is NOT SUITABLE for remote work and can only cater mobile/portable devices.

We highly recommend keeping your key fob in a safe place, because if you lose it, you’ll lose access to the entire building. Not fun. It takes time to replace it, which means you might be locked out of the building and the apartment for a while, and any fob replacement will incur a fee of $300. That’s probably not what you have in mind for a “memorable” trip to Chicago, so let’s just keep track of the fob.

Our apartment includes lots of awesome amenities, but it does NOT include a parking space. If you need to park a vehicle, there is some metered street parking nearby. We recommend using the Spot Hero app to claim a street parking space. The city is easily accessible with public transit and ride sharing, so having your own set of wheels isn’t necessary unless you plan on exploring far outside the city limits.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.

Thank you for understanding, and we look forward to hosting you in beautiful Uptown Chicago!

description:
Real Places's 2nd floor east.  It has 1 full size bed and 1 half size bed. A second half size bed can be added, so that this room can accommodate  4 people. It is the largest bed room in the house. A large walk in closet. with shelves and storage space and cloth hanging rods provide ample space for your things. There is a small folding table with chairs for eating or for work or for entertaining. There is a large picture window  viewing the street activities. and providing light and fresh air.

There is also a half bath that is only shared if there both bed rooms on this floor is occupied at the same time which  is seldom. A microwave and a small refrigerator Is available for the room  for an additional fee. But you must dispose of your own trash and left overs.

I am usually there everyday. If I am not there when you need me, I am only a phone call away.

There are two family parks in this block. There is children's laughter in these parks, Children's laughter, the music of having fun.  One park is right across the ally from the house. It is also right across from the school and is often monitored by parents with their children.

Lyft, Uber, taxis are easiy available. public transportation is close by. The streets are nice paved streets. There is plenty street side parking. But do not park blocking the fire hydrants.  Hand Car washes are available provided by ambitious neighbors. Small in home restaurants offer great home cooked meals at great prices. The meals can be. delivered.

additional_house_rules:
- Quiet hours are reasonable for residential neighborhood..  A high level of consideration for others is important. 

- The additional “Guests after” pricing per night posted on the listing will be added onto all guest parties.

- Heavy party-type folks are not a match for this property location as it is located in a fairly residential area. 

- A garage space may be available at an additional nominal cost and requires a security deposit on the remote/s.  

We negotiate the garage space/s on a case by case bases and appreciate some advance notice with this respect.  

Since we have neighbors who also have interest in our garage spaces for their out of town guests and since accommodations vary in length of stay, please specify if you have interest in securing a garage space.  

The public parking on local street/s is extremly limited in this area.   It is not very attractive to feed the public meters on the time zone set by the City of Chicago who is infamous for issuing parking tickets at $100 a piece to unauthorized residential parking violators or public meter expired vehicles.    

-Lockout re-entry fee is $100; No Exceptions.

-Lost Key Set to any doorway is $250.  We change locks; No Exceptions.

-We offer limited basic cable.

-There is a small bird sanctuary of sorts in the backyard trees.  Please respect our natural visitors who feel we are their guests ! 

* In particular, for extended stay guests, we are willing to negotiate garage space costs and other limited aspects of stay .

*. During extreme snow storm conditions the ally may be blocked and garage parking unavailable. The owner is not responsible for any costs incurred by guests to deal with said “act of nature” conditions (like finding other suitable parking) except for refunding “prepaid” parking amounts during ally blocked time periods. The City of Chicago will not plow the ally’s behind our garages.

access: Regular access to 2 bedroom unit.  Access to Beautiful backyard with barbecue.  Access to Basement washer & Dyer.  There are three (3) security cameras which monitor the exterior front (1) & rear (2) entryway area/s.
description:
Complete 1st floor 2 bedroom ideal centrally located Bucktown neighborhood home - surrounded by great restaurants.   Newly painted, renovated and well kept with a private secured fenced in backyard, large grill and patio set.  Central air, washer/dryer, wi-fi, possible garage parking negotiated in advance.  I will negotiate longer stays & consider shorter term requests. This is also an ideal short term space for a family or group of friends.  Of course, International visitors are always welcome.

Ideal location & residential street.

Regular access to 2 bedroom unit.  Access to Beautiful backyard with barbecue.  Access to Basement washer & Dyer.  There are three (3) security cameras which monitor the exterior front (1) & rear (2) entryway area/s.

I’m local and around most of the time when I’m not visiting nearby family & friends.

In the heart of BuckTown and a stones throw from Wicker Park.  5 minutes from Logan Square & 5 minutes from Lincoln Park.  10-15 minutes to River North and Magnificent Mile.

Just a 5 blocks off  the North Avenue exit of I-90 and a 2 block walk to Blue line L Train

Walking distance of 1-2 blocks to StarBucks which is next to a famous donut place “Stan’s”.  Around the corner from a great super popular Bagel store.  There are multiple restaurants/shops within a short walking distance.  

The Jewel grocery store is .3 miles away. 
( Open 24 hrs. Mon.-Sat. & Sun 6-12a.m.) 
A fitness club, Verge Fitness, is 2 blocks away & offers daily guest passes.  Walgreens is 2 blocks away. (Open everyday 6 a.m.-12 a.m.)
house_rules:
- Quiet hours are reasonable for residential neighborhood..  A high level of consideration for others is important. 

- The additional “Guests after” pricing per night posted on the listing will be added onto all guest parties.

- Heavy party-type folks are not a match for this property location as it is located in a fairly residential area. 

- A garage space may be available at an additional nominal cost and requires a security deposit on the remote/s.  

We negotiate the garage space/s on a case by case bases and appreciate some advance notice with this respect.  

Since we have neighbors who also have interest in our garage spaces for their out of town guests and since accommodations vary in length of stay, please specify if you have interest in securing a garage space.  

The public parking on local street/s is extremly limited in this area.   It is not very attractive to feed the public meters on the time zone set by the City of Chicago who is infamous for issuing parking tickets at $100 a piece to unauthorized residential parking violators or public meter expired vehicles.    

-Lockout re-entry fee is $100; No Exceptions.

-Lost Key Set to any doorway is $250.  We change locks; No Exceptions.

-We offer limited basic cable.

-There is a small bird sanctuary of sorts in the backyard trees.  Please respect our natural visitors who feel we are their guests ! 

* In particular, for extended stay guests, we are willing to negotiate garage space costs and other limited aspects of stay .

*. During extreme snow storm conditions the ally may be blocked and garage parking unavailable. The owner is not responsible for any costs incurred by guests to deal with said “act of nature” conditions (like finding other suitable parking) except for refunding “prepaid” parking amounts during ally blocked time periods. The City of Chicago will not plow the ally’s behind our garages.
interaction: I’m local and around most of the time when I’m not visiting nearby family & friends.
neighborhood_overview: In the heart of BuckTown and a stones throw from Wicker Park.  5 minutes from Logan Square & 5 minutes from Lincoln Park.  10-15 minutes to River North and Magnificent Mile.

Newly painted, renovated and well kept with a private secured fenced in backyard, large grill and patio set.  Central air, washer/dryer, wi-fi, possible garage parking negotiated in advance.  I will negotiate longer stays & consider shorter term requests. This is also an ideal short term space for a family or group of friends.  Of course, International visitors are always welcome.

description:
Please note that photos are of a similar Domio unit in Chicago. The layout will be different, but will feature similar furniture and design.

Pair your Chicago experience with the perfect place to stay. Walking distance from some of Chicago's best areas, this gorgeous, stylish, and charming space was thoughtfully designed to capture local flair and create a relaxing environment. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of art, culture, and cuisine that Chicago has to offer and have an unforgettable experience staying at this Domio.

This space exemplifies the Domio standard: uncompromising style and maximum comfort. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath home boasts an exquisite living room, luxury furniture, and premium finishes. In addition to a fully-stocked kitchen with professional grade appliances, guests will be pleased to find local decor and artwork throughout the home.

Bedroom 1:
Queen Bed

Bedroom 2:
Queen Bed

Guests have exclusive access to the apartment. Additionally, guests have access to the following building amenities:
Indoor pool 
Indoor hot tub
Fitness Center 
Seasonal outdoor deck

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

Streeterville is one of Chicago's best neighborhoods and the perfect place to base your Chicago stay. This Domio is two blocks away from the spectacular John Hancock building and its famous 360 Chicago attraction and The Signature Room at the 95th. During the summer months, kick back at Oak Street Beach which is a quick stroll away. Additionally, Northwestern Memorial Hospital and Ann & Robert H Lurie Children's Hospital are less than a 10 minute walk away.

With a walkscore of 94, this Domio is conveniently located near many restaurants and attractions.
Nearest Bus Stop: Chestnut & Lake Shore Drive (157 bus) - 1 minute walk
Nearest Subway Stop: Chicago (Red Line) - 12 minute walk 
Closest Grocery Store: Potash Market - 5 minute walk

Chicago Registration: Pending

Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas.

description:
Private bedroom with multiple bathrooms in a vintage style apartment located on the main street of Old Chinatown. Minutes away from local restaurants, downtown, public transit (both bus and train), Divvy Bike Stations, and McCormick Convention Center. Flexible booking/check-in/check-out with around the clock manager for any questions/help.

整結衛生  ,  芝加哥  唐人街 中心,  交通  飲食方便, 机场接送服務, 免费无线上网｡唐人街中心区,周边各式中攴馆,地铁,巴士站就在旁边,到市中心,机场极为方便,默康尔国际会展中心就在附近,大量游客,商人,留学生,来自于中国各地,美国各地,是你到芝加哥中国城的最佳选择,价格经济买惠,适合大众。

无线上网｡近地铁､巴士站,近默康尼大会展中心,机场接送服务｡巴士、地铁直到市中心闹市区。唐人街中心区,周边各式中攴馆,地铁,巴士站就在旁边,到市中心,机场极为方便,默康尔国际会展中心就在附近,大量游客,商人,留学生,来自于中国各地,美国各地,是你到芝加哥中国城的最佳选择,价格经济买惠,适合大众。
summary:
Private bedroom with multiple bathrooms in a vintage style apartment located on the main street of Old Chinatown. Minutes away from local restaurants, downtown, public transit (both bus and train), Divvy Bike Stations, and McCormick Convention Center. Flexible booking/check-in/check-out with around the clock manager for any questions/help.

整結衛生  ,  芝加哥  唐人街 中心,  交通  飲食方便, 机场接送服務, 免费无线上网｡唐人街中心区,周边各式中攴馆,地铁,巴士站就在旁边,到市中心,机场极为方便,默康尔国际会展中心就在附近,大量游客,商人,留学生,来自于中国各地,美国各地,是你到芝加哥中国城的最佳选择,价格经济买惠,适合大众。
transit:
There is an abundance of transportation options (multiple CTA bus stops 24&62&12, multiple CTA Redline&Greenline train stop, Ubers/Lyfts/Taxi all over, Divvy bike stations)

公共交通非常便利

description:
Please note that the pictures are of a similar Domio unit in Chicago.

Complete your Chicago experience by staying in this elegant home! Centrally located in the heart of Chicago, this stunning space was thoughtfully designed to capture local flair and make you feel at home. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of art, architecture, and cuisine that Chicago has to offer and have an unforgettable experience staying at this Domio.

All Domios are designed with style and comfort in mind and this space is no different. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath home boasts a brand new living room, luxury furniture, and customized finishes. In addition to a fully-stocked kitchen with state-of-the-art appliances, guests will be pleased to find hand-picked decor and artwork throughout the home. 

Bedroom 1:
Queen bed

Bedroom 2:
Queen bed

Common Area:
Sofa bed
Air mattress

Guests also have access to the building's amenities which include:
- Fitness Center
- Outdoor Heated Pool
- Skydeck
- Indoor Hot Tub
- Yoga and Spin Room

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

Chicago Registration: Pending

There are stairs within the unit.

Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago.

description:
Open and sunny apartment in the Pilsen neighborhood.

Apartment located on a quiet block in Pilsen/Lower West Side.

Guests have access to both bathrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen (full kitchen with most all standard appliances), and back deck.

I live in the apartment but spend most of my time at my studio so it's possible you won't see me much.

Classic Old Chicago neighborhood. Safe and quiet, lots of Mexican and Italian restaurants, and located close to train lines as well as quick access to downtown and beyond.

Located six blocks from the Pink Line (Western Ave stop) which connects to all other train lines in the city.

3.5 mi to McCormick Place (10-15 mins)
7 mi to Millenium Park (~20 mins)

- A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled
- Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty)
- Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a fee.
- All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property.
- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

description:
Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom River North apartment with balcony views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this lavishly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, pretty living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI21)

Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your cheery living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this River North apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Pet Friendly
- Gym
- Indoor Parking
- Roof Deck

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
space:
Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your cheery living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this River North apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Pet Friendly
- Gym
- Indoor Parking
- Roof Deck

- Elevator
summary: Discover the best of Chicago, with this one-bedroom River North apartment with balcony views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this lavishly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, pretty living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#CHI21)

additional_house_rules:
1. Please replace your shoes at the entrance. 

2. Quiet time is after 10:00pm and before 8:00am. Including kitchen. 

3. Kitchen is shared. Just LIGHT COOKING once or twice per week is acceptable,  like boiling, heating etc.  And clean afterwards. Baking like turkeys and breads with powder are not allowed.  Heavy cooking are not welcome. 

4. Washer and dryer are downstairs and free.  Usually provide once a week.  Please DONOT treat as a laundry store.  And please follow the notice on the dryer.

5. Please don’t leave expensive and important things in the room if you mind.  And for some emergency or service, we keep the right to enter the rooms.

6. Anything please turn on and turn off. Open and close.

For long term guests:

1. Because you will get the long term(over 28 days)price.  What you paid is not included the body wash, shampoo, toilet paper, and etc.  But you still will see everything when you arrive. Just to welcome you. 

2. Here is airbnb.  Not an entire apartment by contract. We are shared.  We have no contract and no deposit. You have to pay first, stay later.  Without pay you have no right to enter the place or keep your stuffs in my rooms.   Also you can decide how long you need to stay and let us know in advance so we can block for you . The same we also have the right to decide how long to host you and let you know in advance . And we keep the right to enter the room for keeping the whole place safe or for some repairs while your stay even there is a keypad lock on each door. Commonly we will not enter your room without notice you. 

Once you decide to stay , that means you agree with all these and will follow the rules of our place.

description:
Luxury newly renovate PRIVATE main room & full bathroom free parking on the street

I understand usually people come to Chicago will be very busy while the stay.  Messages through airbnb message system or the phone number which one we  registered on airbnb is best. Or it will be hard for us to know who are who.

For everyone: 

1. Kitchen is shared. Just LIGHT COOKING once or twice per week is acceptable,  like boiling, heating etc.  Baking like turkeys and breads with powder are not allowed.  Heavy cooking are not welcome. 

2. Washer and dryer are downstairs and free.  Usually provide once a week.  Please DONOT treat as a laundry store.  And please follow the notice on the dryer. 

For long term guests:

1. Because you will get the long term(over 28 days)price.  What you paid is not included the body wash, shampoo, toilet paper, and etc.  But you still will see everything when you arrive. Just to welcome you. 

2. Here is airbnb.  Not an entire apartment by contract. We are shared.  We have no contract and no deposit. You have to pay first, stay later.  Without pay you have no right to enter the place or keep your stuffs in my rooms.   Also you can decide how long you need to stay and let us know in advance so we can block for you . The same we also have the right to decide how long to host you and let you know in advance . And we keep the right to enter the room for keeping the whole place safe or for some repairs while your stay even there is a keypad lock on each door. Commonly we will not enter your room without notice you. 

Once you decide to stay , that means you agree with all these and will follow the rules of our place.

description: One bedroom apartment in Jefferson Park Chicago neighborhood, everything included (WiFi, utilities, laundry)! The apartment is walking distance to all the local restaurants, stores and shops, and the blue line station. It is a short 10-minute walk to Mariano's. Free Street Parking - garage available upon request. Close to O'hare Airport. Available for longer stays - monthly. Weekly cleaning service available at extra fee. Safe location!

access: WiFi (no TV), kitchen (gas stove, microwave, toaster oven), free laundry done FOR you, iron/board, hoola-hoops!  You are welcome to borrow my sturdy slow bicycle known as "the tank".
description:
Brilliantly SUNNY, peaceful, restful, private room with balcony overlooking a lush yard, set back from street = no street noise!  1 block from Loyola U.,  3 blocks to CTA Red Line train.  Second floor, full-sized FUTON (Japanese firm mattress), shared bathroom.

Large, elegantly furnished room on the second floor of a historic (1920) building.  Full-sized futon, balcony, dresser, clothes rack, coat hooks, full-length mirror, desk + portable lap-desk.

WiFi (no TV), kitchen (gas stove, microwave, toaster oven), free laundry done FOR you, iron/board, hoola-hoops!  You are welcome to borrow my sturdy slow bicycle known as "the tank".

I enjoy helping guests as they explore the wonderful Edgewater neighborhood and city!  I'm available but also respectful of your privacy.  I have 2 wonderfully friendly dogs (small Barney + medium-sized Agnes), who you can either close out of your room or welcome in!  

A peaceful, restful spot that is ideal for tourists and students, and always friendly to LGBTQIA, POC, immigrants, refugees, and other than a flight of stairs, visitors of different abilities. Welcome!

Edgewater is lush, green, and peaceful, with beaches & parks, several small theatres, lots of restaurants and shops, and crafting places for ceramics and beading fun.  Near the hip Andersonville area, and close to "Little India".  My apartment has the following less than three blocks away:  4 coffee shops, 3 elegant breakfast cafes, a gourmet custard dessert shop, Sushi, Thai, Ethiopian, Mexican, & Middle Eastern restaurants.

- 40 minute train ride to Downtown Chicago/"Loop" ($2.50) on Chicago Transit Authority's (CTA's) elevated train "The El":
- 2 blocks to Red Line El (Loyola Station)
- 4 blocks to Red Line El (Granville Station)
- half block to #36 Broadway bus
- half block to #155 bus along Devon and North to Rogers Park
- half block to #151 bus south, local, to Lakeview, Lincoln Park and Loop
- 2 blocks #147 express/Lakeshore bus to Loop
- Protected parking for your bike
- CAR PARKING is easy on my block, as long as you have a visitor guest pass to place in your windshield.  I provide these free of charge.

neighborhood_overview: Edgewater is lush, green, and peaceful, with beaches & parks, several small theatres, lots of restaurants and shops, and crafting places for ceramics and beading fun.  Near the hip Andersonville area, and close to "Little India".  My apartment has the following less than three blocks away:  4 coffee shops, 3 elegant breakfast cafes, a gourmet custard dessert shop, Sushi, Thai, Ethiopian, Mexican, & Middle Eastern restaurants.
space: Large, elegantly furnished room on the second floor of a historic (1920) building.  Full-sized futon, balcony, dresser, clothes rack, coat hooks, full-length mirror, desk + portable lap-desk.
summary: Brilliantly SUNNY, peaceful, restful, private room with balcony overlooking a lush yard, set back from street = no street noise!  1 block from Loyola U.,  3 blocks to CTA Red Line train.  Second floor, full-sized FUTON (Japanese firm mattress), shared bathroom.
transit:
- 40 minute train ride to Downtown Chicago/"Loop" ($2.50) on Chicago Transit Authority's (CTA's) elevated train "The El":
- 2 blocks to Red Line El (Loyola Station)
- 4 blocks to Red Line El (Granville Station)
- half block to #36 Broadway bus
- half block to #155 bus along Devon and North to Rogers Park
- half block to #151 bus south, local, to Lakeview, Lincoln Park and Loop
- 2 blocks #147 express/Lakeshore bus to Loop
- Protected parking for your bike
- CAR PARKING is easy on my block, as long as you have a visitor guest pass to place in your windshield.  I provide these free of charge.

- Guests who violate House Rules may be asked to leave - Please be respectful of our neighbors; no loud noise between the hours of 11pm-7am

- Use of amenities (eg fitness center) is at guests’ own risk

access: You are welcome to access every part of the building including the amenities floors.
description:
Enjoy premium living & the best that Chicago has to offer with this luxury penthouse floor 2 bed/2 bath apartment with floor to ceiling windows offering unbeatable lake, sunset and city views!  Everything is designed for your comfort from the beds to furnishings to the flat-screen TV & Sonos Play Bar. Plus countless  in-building amenities & central location close to top attractions like Soldier Field, Museum Campus, Art Institute. This will be one of your favorite airbnbs ever!

Use of free parking requires you to give us at least 24 hours notice that you will need it! This apartment has it all: 2 large bedrooms each outfitted with luxury memory foam mattresses, super-soft linens and an abundance of pillows. The Master suite also has a flat screen TV in case you want to watch Netflix before bed or Sport Center while you start your day!

The living room features extra high ceilings because it is the penthouse floor, a wall-mounted 55” Smart TV, Sonos Sound Bar, incredibly comfy Pottery Barn sectional...but best of off: unobstructed views of Lake Michigan and Museum Campus!

The kitchen is equipped with all of your cooking and entertaining needs: full set of dish ware & glassware, a chef’s stove and oven, baking and cooking equipment, and a Keurig for your morning Joe! 

Both bathrooms are outfitted with high end fixtures and the master suite features a walk-in shower and double vanity. 

In short: this place is so amazing that you won’t want to leave!

You are welcome to access every part of the building including the amenities floors.

We are always just a phone call away (and we promise to respond within 15 minutes) and there will always be someone local available to help you onsite within an hour.

Grant Park, Millennium Park, Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Soldier Field, Navy Pier, Mag Mile, Theater District, McCormick Place, Willis Tower, Watertower Place...the list goes on and on!

I would recommend using public transportation since the unit is within 5 min walk to a central subway that connects to every El Line and several bus routes. There is also indoor garage in the building for roughly $25/day (prices vary).  If requested at least 24 hrs in advance we can provide complimentary parking in our onsite garage

Please be aware that in order to take advantage of the free parking, we need to know  at LEAST 24 hrs in advance so that we can get you the parking pass. Last minute requests for parking cannot be accommodated.

access: Guest has full exclusive access to the suites.
description:
Newly renovated condo in the heart of Chicago Chinatown with 3 bedroom/2 baths, a spacious living area and FREE private parking. This condo has 6 beds and can accommodate 9+ guests. Minutes to Downtown, McCormick Place, and popular attractions. Walking distance to public transit, stores, Starbucks, and many great restaurants.

We have other properties as well that could accommodate groups of 27+ guests or more. Please contact us for details.

Guest has full exclusive access to the suites.

We're conveniently located near the intersection of Wentworth and 18th Street. Public transportation (bus, train) are less than a block away. Major highways  (I-90/94, I-290, I-55) all converge in this area. For the foodies, this is the place to be with many great restaurants within walking distance and close by the downtown and South Loop area. Conventioneers will be glad to know that McCormick Place is a 16 minute walk/6 minutes drive away. See below for more details.


Driving distance to nearby Points of Interest:
Greektown (2.6 miles / 14 min)
Guaranteed Rate Field (1.2 miles / 5 min)
Illinois Institute of Technology (1.6 miles / 7 min)
Lincoln Park Zoo (7.8 miles / 20 min)
Little Italy (2.6 miles / 14 min)
Magnificent Mile (3.5 miles / 11 min)
McCormick Place (0.9 miles / 6 min)
Millennium Park (2.7 miles / 11 min)
Museum Campus (Aquarium, Field Museum, Adler Planetarium) - (1.8 miles / 10 min)
Navy Pier (5 miles / 15 min)
Soldier Field 2.3 miles / 7 min)
United Center (4 miles / 15 min)
University of Illinois at Chicago (2.7 miles / 11 min)
Wrigley Field (10.4 miles / 27 min)

Walking
Many of the city’s top attractions are a short walk or ride away from each other. Weather-permitting, walking is the best way to see the city and the hidden treasures of architecture and public art in the downtown area.
When planning your route, keep in mind that every 8 blocks equals 1 mile.

Chicago Public Transportation (CTA)
The buses and trains of the CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) are a fast and cost-effective way to get into and around the city. Known as the “L” (though they may be elevated or underground) the trains are a fun way to see The Loop from a new vantage point.
CTA visitor passes offer the best value, with unlimited rides on all CTA trains and buses. A 1-day pass is $10, a 3-day pass is $20, and a 7-day pass is $28.
Passes are easy to use. They activate the first time you use them and are valid for the number of consecutive days purchased. Just dip your pass into the bus fare machine or the train station turnstile.
Check the CTA website for the latest fares, travel alerts, and trip planners.

Taxis
Taxis are abundant throughout most of Chicago so finding a cab is typically easy. Taxi rates depend on gas prices and number of passengers and can get a bit pricey but provide a fast and convenient way to get around the city, particularly beyond downtown.

Biking
If time and weather permit, consider renting a bike. Chicago’s lakefront boasts 26 uninterrupted miles of easy bike and walking trails.
Half-day rentals are available from Bike and Roll at Navy Pier and Millennium Park.


From the Airports

O’Hare International Airport: 
Chicago’s O’Hare is one of the world’s busiest airports. It’s about 15 miles northwest of the Loop in downtown Chicago. O’Hare has 5 terminals, all of which have information booths and multilingual employees to assist you.

Midway International Airport:
Although it’s smaller than O’Hare, Midway is closer to the Loop and services more discount airlines (but fewer airlines overall). If you’re looking for a good deal on plane tickets, check out flights to Midway.

• Check-in time 3 PM or later. Check-out before 12 PM
• No Smoking (including e-cigarettes) in the house and common areas
• No pets
• No parties or events
• Observe quiet hours from 9:00PM to 7:00AM 
• Early check-in or late check-out can be accommodated based on occupancy and for a small fee. Please inquire if needed

No food in the bedrooms

access: The apartment is made ready for the guests.  The whole apartment is available for the guests (the host will notbe present).
description:
Available Dates: from 12-19-19 to 1-1-20 or 1-2-20 (2 weeks). $80/night.
Tapestry Building, 2550 Waterview Dr, Northbrook, IL 60062. This apartment complex is run like a hotel.   
1100sq -- 2 bedrooms -- 2 full bathrooms. White countertops, stainless steel kitchen appliances. Washer and dryer in the unit. Balcony.
Sleeps 3 people (comfortably). Could sleep 5 people, if needed.
Garage available.

Wonderful outside pool with the grilling and lounging areas. Fitness centre, yoga room, conference room, printer room and the party room with the pool table, table tennis, TV area and complimentary coffee. Street parking available.

The apartment is made ready for the guests.  The whole apartment is available for the guests (the host will notbe present).

Host will not be presnet on site, but available for any questions via phone and email every day.

Mariano’s grocery store is next to the building, 2-minute walk. Starbucks, Chipotle, CVS and LA Fitness are across the building, all in walking distance. Highway I-295 is a 3-minute drive from the building.

additional_house_rules:
Besides asking that you to treat our lovely home as you would your own, we ask you to follow these basic house rules:

• ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES!
• No bachelor or bachelorette parties
• No smoking inside (there are ashtrays on the balconies...smoking inside will result in forfeiture of security deposit)
• No Filming, Film Crews, Business, or Professional Productions without authorization
• No unauthorized guests/occupants/visitors other than those prearranged and approved with the host via airbnb
• No illegal substances or activities
• Please remove shoes upon entering
• No drinking wine from the wine wall
• Please report damage or problems with the home immediately

*** This townhouse contains stairs and may not be suitable for elderly guests or children.

***While the home is not child-proofed, children are welcome and DO count as guests.  Be sure to include children in your guest count.

***An extra fee ($45 per extra guest per night) applies for reservations that include more than 6 guests and 10 guests is the maximum (no exceptions).

***For your safety or ours, security cameras are posted at the front door and inside the garage.

access: Guests have Private Access to the Entire Townhouse and Garage for 1 regular-sized car or 2 very small cars...There is also free street parking available in the neighborhood.
description:
Spacious Townhome in Chicago's Foodie Heaven Neighborhood: West Loop/Fulton Market. This is a Private, 4-Story Townhouse on a Tree-Lined Street just Steps from the Action...while still quiet enough for a good night's sleep. Walk to some of the Nation's Top Restaurants (near Restaurant Row), Clubs, Groceries, Parks, Coffee Shops. Easy Train Transit to O'Hare, Navy Pier, Mag Mile, McCormick Place, etc...Terrace w/Skyline Views & Attached Garage Parking for 1 Regular-Sized Vehicle Included!

This Spacious, 3000 square foot townhome comfortably hosts up to 10 guests (4 beds, 1 queen air mattress, & 1 oversized sectional couch)

LEVEL 1
• ATTACHED GARAGE for 1 Car/Mid-Sized SUV or 2 Small Cars (free street parking for extra or oversized vehicles)
• SITTING ROOM with Leather Couch from Crate & Barrel
• 1/2 BATHROOM
• ENTRYWAY FOYER with Coat Closet and Umbrellas

LEVEL 2
• LIVING ROOM with Huge 8 Person Sectional Couch, 60" LCD TV, opens up to the
• DINING ROOM with Large 8-person Table
• EAT-IN KITCHEN with all you need to Cook a Fantastic Meal and an Attached Balcony and Weber Gas Grill. 

LEVEL 3
• MASTER SUITE LUXURY OASIS!  High-End, Memory Foam King-Sized Bed and Down Comforter & Feather Pillows & Luxurious 500 Thread Count Sheets
• SITTING AREA with Vanity, and Washer/Dryer
• MASTER BATH with Double Sinks, Deep Jacuzzi Tub for Soaking after a long day of Chicago Sightseeing plus a  Separate, Step-In Shower. Plenty of Fluffy, Clean, & White Towels Provided

LEVEL 4
• FAMILY ROOM with great Views of the City Skyline Wet Bar/Beverage Center, 50" Plasma TV with DVD Collection and Seating for 4 Guests. 
• 2ND BEDROOM has a comfy Queen-Sized Bed with 500 Thread Count Sheets
• 3RD BEDROOM has 2 Twin Beds (can be pushed together) with 500 Thread Count Sheets & Foam Toppers for extra Comfort.
• FULL BATHROOM with Tub and Shower Combo
• OUTDOOR TERRACE with Skyline Views and Comfy Lounge Seating for 6. Flowers planted in the summer months. 
• Have extra guests? There's also a Queen-Sized Air Mattress for the Family Room

Guests have Private Access to the Entire Townhouse and Garage for 1 regular-sized car or 2 very small cars...There is also free street parking available in the neighborhood.

I almost always meet guests in person to give a quick tour of the home, answer any questions, and give recommendations if requested. After that, I am available on an as needed basis, just a quick phone call away if anything comes up...or if you need a tip on the best place to have dinner, go shopping, see a game/show, or the best way to get from here to there.

This townhouse is strategically positioned in the middle of West Loop, Fulton Market District, and River West. It's foodie heaven with both Michelin-starred restaurants and cozy cafes, all within an easy walk.

• Many Chicago neighborhoods are easily accessible via foot (20 minute walk to Downtown Loop, 25 minute walk to Navy Pier, 25 minute walk to Wicker Park, 10 minute walk to West Loop)
• If you want to go a little further/faster, there is a Divvy Bike Station 3 blocks away (public bike sharing)
• If you bring a car, there is an attached garage is available for your use (fits 1 regular-sized car or 2 very small cars...additional free street parking available)
• 2 'El' stations within walking distance: 
5 minute walk to Blue Line, Grand Station (35 minutes to/from O'Hare Airport, 5 minute train to downtown)
5 minute walk to Green Line, Morgan Station (5 minute train to downtown)
• 2 Major Bus Lines within walking distance:
2 minute walk to Grand Bus (easy access to Navy Pier)
10 minute walk to Madison Bus (easy access to Loop/Millennium Park)

Not your average AirBNB!!

This home is a true luxury oasis in the heart of the big city.  If you're looking for space to enjoy and relax with all the comforts of home, search no further, this luxury townhouse is for you and your group!  Strategically located in between West Loop, Fulton Market District, River West, River North, and Downtown, you'll have no trouble reaching the hottest destinations in Chicago via foot, cab, uber, train, or bike.

2 living spaces feature big-screen plasma HDTV.  You have private access to 2 separate outdoor spaces (1 with skyline views!), a BBQ grill and spacious seating.  You can even cozy up to the fire with a glass of wine on a cold evening in the luxurious master bedroom suite.

Kitchen is fully equipped, feel free to use anything you need (including pots & pans, toaster, grill, dishwasher, coffee maker, tea kettle, blender, etc.) Light groceries are also included (including coffee, tea, cereal, oatmeal, snacks, spices, oils, etc.) The dining area offers a huge, beautiful table that seats 8 or feel free to share a meal at the eat-in kitchen or balcony.

The bathrooms are fully stocked with all the essentials (shampoo, conditioner, soap, hairdryer, & fresh towels and washcloths, etc.)

Guests may use our full-size, in-unit washer & dryer (don't pack detergent...we've got you covered!)

additional_house_rules:
- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. description:
Gorgeous 2BD/2BA Unit in the heart of Chicago - Magnificent Mile. Professionally managed and cleaned with stylish kitchen, free high-speed wifi and 24/7 support. Fully stocked with all the convenience you would expect at a hotel.

We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

Located in one of Chicago's lakefront neighborhoods. This apartment is ideal for those who want to have the best of both worlds. City living at it's finest with the best dining and shopping places and just a few minutes away is Oak Street Beach which is a great place for water sports and biking. Enjoy its warm red brick exterior that highlights the rich history that this apartment is known for. Floor to ceiling windows provides the open concept living/dining room apartment a lot of natural light. All units are furnished and provided flat screen TV's, free fast wifi service, kitchenware/cookware and bathroom amenities. Our amazing customer support team are always available to attend to your needs.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests

access: Dining room,  bathroom,  kitchen, and laundry room
description:
Please be dog friendly. Comfortable and cozy room with a Queen size memory foam mattress and 4 pillows, Mini-Fridge, and T.V. There is Keurig coffee maker, with a variety of coffee flavors. For those who don't drink coffee, I have Green Tea,  Lavender, Black Earl tea and a variety of others.
No eating in bedroom, dishwasher and living off limits.

Private bedroom with a  Queen size Memory Foam Green Tea Mattress.
* Four pillows
* Mini Fridge
* Extra sheets
* Towels
* Hair Towels
* Hair Dryer
* Curling Iron
* Flat Iron
* Laundry basket
* T.V. with amazon firestick
* Netflix
* A Closet with hangers
* A small dresser
* A full size mirror
* Ironing board
* Iron
* Lotion
* Kleenex
* Hand Sanitizer
* Body wash
* Shampoo and Conditioner
* Toothpaste
* Mouthwash
* Makeup wipes
* Guest who are checking in are only allowed
( No eating in room)
( Living room is off limits)
( Dishwasher is off limits)

Dining room,  bathroom,  kitchen, and laundry room

I am here to answer any questions you may have or assist you with anything you may need. Communication is very important and if there is a issue please feel free to address them to me.

The neighborhood is quiet, friendly,  and very safe. I am more West and although there are buses, the Metra, and blue line nearby. I am not close to bars and excessive loud noises. Except when the Cubs are on a winning streak, then you will hear all the excitement since I am off Addison and Keeler. The expressway way is 3 minutes away on Irving Park, if driving.

Along Addison Ave going east you will come across the Blue line on Addison and Avondale. It takes about 5 to 10 minutes to get there on Addison bus. 
There is also a series of stores and restaurants.
*Olive Garden
*Kmart
 Addison and Elston you will find
*Chase
*Jewel
*Sugar Hills Bakery
*Great Clips
*Subway 
*Chipotle
*Chinese Buffet 
*Dunkin Donuts/ Baskin Robbins
*White Castles
* Little Caesar's
 A little further East on Addison and Sacramento there is another shopping center with a 
*Target
*Dollar Tree
*Hallmark
*Famous Footwear

On Belmont and kimball there is a Aldi to buy groceries and on Diversey and Pulaski there is a Cermak Produce. On Irving park and Avondale you will find the *Metra station
*Pot Belly's
*Lou Malnatis pizza
* Chicago Taco Authority off of Irving       Park and Tripp
* Golden Nuggets
* YMCA
* Eris Brewery

Please note that I have dogs on property and If you are not a dog person this isn't the place for you. There are lysol wipes on dining room and kitchen table to wipe down after you are done eating. Rinse tub off of any hair with handheld.
No eating in bedroom, No dishes be left over night in sink, thank you for your cooperation.

additional_house_rules:
General Rules
-Please treat the home as if it is your own.
-Please respect our guest limit capacity of 3 people.
-Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property.
-If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest.
-We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out.
-Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing.

Quiet Hours
Quiet hours are between 10p-8a.
This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.

Receiving a noise complaint from the building or the device can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine. 

No Smoking
The home (and entire building including outdoor common areas) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in the building. Please respect our policy and step outside the vicinity.

Key Fob
The key fob is your way of accessing everything from your short-stay apartment to the amenity spaces in the building. If you happen to lose your key fob, you will be charged $75. 

Security
Please be advised that the building exterior and common spaces are equipped with surveillance devices. Please respect the building and its community. 

Emergencies
Contact your host immediately with any issues. An emergency maintenance number is provided in the home guide for any building issues that involve water or hazards in the home.

For medical, fire and police related emergencies please call 911.
