access:
The entire home is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay. You will also have access to all of the building's beautiful and unique amenities.

Parking
There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.
description:
Welcome to JENNEY JOY, a beautiful studio with luxury amenities. Lounge on the roof top and take in the skyline views or sweat it out namaste style in the yoga room . The rooftop includes Insta-worthy views, fire pits for rosé days, and plenty of space to host your friends. This urban enclave is built for you!

Sleeping Arrangements
Living Room -  1 Queen Bed & Fold Down Sleeper Sofa (Full)

Kitchen  
The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pants, utensils, silverware, plates, bowls, cups, knives, a cutting board, salt and pepper, a coffee maker, and cream and sugar – for however you take it.  
 
Cleaning Supplies  
You’re supplied with dish soap, a sponge, dish detergent and paper towels.

Washer/Dryer 
There is a washer/dryer in unit. We provide you with detergent for your stay!

TV
The Roku guide is posted next to the TV. There is also a digital antenna for local channels. Please remember to sign out of any of any Roku apps you’ve utilize during your stay. 

Non-Smoking 
The home and entire building is designated as a smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in unit or the building. Please respect our policy and step outside.

Deck
Enjoy access to the spacious roof-top lounge & deck complete with seating area, grills, and views of the skyline!

Parking
There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.

Noise 
Potential for noise - You can hear the train and other city noises from the unit.

The entire home is yours to enjoy for the duration of your stay. You will also have access to all of the building's beautiful and unique amenities.

Parking
There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.

We are off-site but available when needed. The best way to reach us is by emailing reservations@livly.io!  In case of maintenance emergency, the in-unit home guide will detail phone numbers of who to call immediately.

The Loop is the official downtown area of Chicago! This area is buzzing with a lively atmosphere, stunning architecture and many of Chicago's famous landmarks.

The area features some of Chicago’s cultural attractions such as the Chicago Cultural Center, Art Institute of Chicago and Theatre District! There is also no shortage of award-winning restaurants and shopping in the area.

Let’s not forget the incredible outdoor spaces that the Loop has to offer! The “Bean” is located in the famed Millennium Park, the perfect place to relax during a Chicago summer day. There are also the newly added Chicago Riverwalk and Maggie Daley Park!

There is no dedicated parking space for the home. We recommend using apps like SpotHero to locate discounted street or garage spots nearby.

The home is a 2 minute walk from the CTA brown, red, purple & pink line trains at the "LaSalle/Van Buren" stop. This train line will take you all over the city, including into the neighborhoods further north and south for exploring or transfer to another train line.

Check In / Check Out
Check in starts at 4 PM CT
Check out time is 11 AM CT

We do not offer early Check In or late Check Out. 

Luggage Hold 
If your travel arrangements have you arriving earlier or leaving later than our designated check in / check out times, we recommend using Wait Here Chicago. We have a partnership with them and can offer you discounted rates on their luggage hold options throughout the city.
house_rules:
General Rules
-Please treat the home as if it is your own.
-Please respect our guest limit capacity of 3 people.
-Do not engage in illegal activities anywhere on the property.
-If you accidentally damage anything during your stay, please contact the host for your safety and the future safety of the next guest.
-We pride ourselves on being green and would appreciate you turning off the TV and lights when you check-out.
-Please remember to sign out of any ROKU apps you utilized via your personal accounts before departing.

Quiet Hours
Quiet hours are between 10p-8a.
This is a residential building and ask that for the respect of permanent tenants basic courtesies of being mindful of your noise levels and not congregating in hallways outside of the unit be observed.

Receiving a noise complaint from the building or the device can result in the forfeiture of your stay and a $1000 fine. 

No Smoking
The home (and entire building including outdoor common areas) is designated as a strictly smoke-free community. There will be a $500 fee imposed if you choose to smoke in the building. Please respect our policy and step outside the vicinity.

Key Fob
The key fob is your way of accessing everything from your short-stay apartment to the amenity spaces in the building. If you happen to lose your key fob, you will be charged $75. 

Security
Please be advised that the building exterior and common spaces are equipped with surveillance devices. Please respect the building and its community. 

Emergencies
Contact your host immediately with any issues. An emergency maintenance number is provided in the home guide for any building issues that involve water or hazards in the home.

For medical, fire and police related emergencies please call 911.

access: The entire house is yours. Please treat it with respect.
description:
Cozy newly remodeled duplex coach house with private entrance - 2 Queen beds, 1 Queen sofa bed,kitchen, stove, fridge, breakfast dining table for 2, kitchen counter for 2, and a desk. Includes internet, and has A/C. Free on-site laundry.  There is also a patio where you can enjoy your morning coffee (weather permitting). Steps to public transit or rent-a-bikes. Located in one of Chicago’s best neighborhood voted by Redfin.
The layout is loft like and the entire space including bedroom are open.

The entire house is yours. Please treat it with respect.

Depending on the time of your arrival I will either meet you in person or I will leave a lockbox for you.

This is a very cozy place in the heart of West Town in between Wicker Park, Ukranian Village and West Loop park with lots of galleries, shops, restaurants and cafes. It's a Bohemian neighborhood with a lot of Chicago character.

There is a Starbuck, Jimmy Jones, UPS and Dry Cleaning across the street from the apartment.

Blue Line  is 7 min walking distance which takes you to O'Hare or downtown. There is a Divvy bike station outside of the apartment and Uber is under $10 to downtown. You can walk to West Loop in 10 minutes. Ogden has paid parking during the day and free after 6 pm during the week and free on the weekends.  Grand avenue is always free.

access: Private bedroom, shared bathroom, shared living room, shared dining room, shared kitchen. Back deck with grill and Backyard with fire pit.
description:
An affordable escape to Chicago! Located in the historic and up and coming Bridgeport neighborhood just South of Chinatown, Pilsen and Downtown Chicago. Come experience world class attractions in a safe, clean, and affordable space while avoiding the traffic and parking hassles of downtown.

I used to host in Springfield, IL, the home of Abe Lincoln, so the room is decorated in Lincoln artwork and comes with a library of Lincoln literature.

City of Chicago registration #R19000047758

The room is cozy and comfy. You have your own 55" TV with Amazon Fire Stick and local channels, and a library of Lincoln History and art. Enjoy access to a full kitchen with free keurig coffee, Darts, laundry, living and dining room, etc. In the living room there is a Wii, PS4, VHS, plenty of board games, puzzles and more. Make yourself at home!

Private bedroom, shared bathroom, shared living room, shared dining room, shared kitchen. Back deck with grill and Backyard with fire pit.

I keep very busy with work and school, so there's a high chance we won't run into eachother. Let me know if you'd like more interaction with me and I can likely arrange for it. I can certainly give local recommendations for anything you are looking for. I would love to make your stay as local feeling as possible!

A diverse and safe neighborhood a few miles South of Downtown. Bridgeport has become a neighborhood full of the arts with two renowned art centers, some nice bars, breweries, and restaurants. Very close to Chinatown, and Pilsen home of the best Mexican bakeries and restaurants around. Very police friendly neighborhood ensures it remains safe and secure. Close to White Sox stadium and McCormick place, easy access to downtown and the lakefront.

1 Mile to El train. Bus stops right outside, Divvy (Bikeshare) station across the street, Uber, Lyft. Free street parking.

I live in the second floor of a two-flat. You will have to climb one flight of stairs. The apartment is on a main street and you will hear traffic noise.
interaction: I keep very busy with work and school, so there's a high chance we won't run into eachother. Let me know if you'd like more interaction with me and I can likely arrange for it. I can certainly give local recommendations for anything you are looking for. I would love to make your stay as local feeling as possible!

access:
Guests will have a private entrance .
For long period of time the pricing will be adjusted, those guest can make use of the kitchen.
description:
This classy old house, built in 1895, is totally remodeled & owner occupied. It sits in a residential neighborhood with tree-lined streets & is surrounded by coffee shops. Located 1 1/2 miles from Lake Michigan and Wrigley Field, and walking distance from the bus to Downtown and Millennium Park.

Large luxurious, private bedroom suite with queen sized bed and roomy sitting area that includes a queen sized futon.There will be an extra charge of $25.for the use of the futon. Included is a large private bathroom with a double sink vanity, a shower ,plenty towels bathrobe and slippers.Shampoo and shower gel , hairdryer,toothpaste etc.

This suite is very cozy with its own fireplace, has a large closet, and can sleep 4 people. Accommodations are located on their own floor away from the private quarters, with a back entrance. Your also welcome to use the on-site washer & dryer ,iron and iron board.There is a microwave and refrigerator, coffee maker and dishes.

Guests will have a private entrance .
For long period of time the pricing will be adjusted, those guest can make use of the kitchen.

I have lived in my home and this area for 30+ years and enjoy traveling, dining, and partaking in all the culture and activities that Chicago offers. I am a native Dutch speaker and can also speak German. 

I am looking forward to sharing my home with you.

My neighborhood is on one site residential and the other site (website hidden) has lots of little places to eat ,an unique coffee/bicycle place were people take there (website hidden) is close to Lincoln Park conservatory and the Zoo .You can walk to Wrigley Field ,the John Hancock, and  theaters are down the street.

My house is one block from the bus station to take you east to the Brown Line ,CTA,or you can walk there in 10 min.You can be in 25 min down town or to the airport.,very good location.

This use to be a German neighborhood and you can still see that by the church ,St Alphonsus, and some of the buildings.
house_rules:
I don't take dogs or cats .
Don't be loud after 12 am because most people are sleeping. 
No smoking. Leave dirty dishes in plastic tub.

description:
Brand new service property. Beautiful single family house in a very convenient and safe Chicago west suburb, Forest Park. This suite has two bedrm & a private bathrm. Common areas including living & dining rm, kitchen, and laundry area. Accommodates business travelers with office amenities ( e.g., Wifi, printer, copier, iron, ...) & washer+dryer. 

Close to public trans & I-290 exprwy. 15 min to downtown via train & 15 min by car (normal traffic). Clse to Loyola Med Ctr, Hines VA & Rush Hsptls.

description: Welcome to 63rd and Morgan. Home to a group of residents that are invested in upholding a pride-filled neighborhood. The block is centrally located on Chicago's Southside in the historic Englewood community where there is a strong sense of village. Thus, the apartment is quiet, clean and looked out for by all the neighbors. We have a community garden that shares its bounty for free. 4 minute walk to Whole Foods. 20 minute drive to downtown. 4 minute walk to the Green Line train. Welcome.

additional_house_rules:
- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout

description:
Gorgeous Studio Unit in the heart of Chicago - Rivernorth. Professionally managed and fully stocked w/ everything from salt, pepper, shampoo and body-wash to a sparkling water welcome gift!

We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

Cozy and modern apartment units situated along Chicago's River North District. A few minutes away from the Chicago Riverwalk, the Puerto Convention Center and the Shedd Aquarium, along with hundreds of art galleries and local museums. The brown and the purple lines are the main mode of transportation in the city. Amenities include a 24Hr fitness center, a business center with wifi hot spots, hospitable accommodation and a rooftop swimming pool. All units include a modern kitchen, floor to ceiling windows, in-unit washer/dryers and flat screen TV's. Free fast wifi, kitchen/cookware and bathroom amenities are also provided. For any concerns, our amazing customer support team is available to assist.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests

- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout
interaction: We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week
notes:
Cozy and modern apartment units situated along Chicago's River North District. A few minutes away from the Chicago Riverwalk, the Puerto Convention Center and the Shedd Aquarium, along with hundreds of art galleries and local museums. The brown and the purple lines are the main mode of transportation in the city. Amenities include a 24Hr fitness center, a business center with wifi hot spots, hospitable accommodation and a rooftop swimming pool. All units include a modern kitchen, floor to ceiling windows, in-unit washer/dryers and flat screen TV's. Free fast wifi, kitchen/cookware and bathroom amenities are also provided. For any concerns, our amazing customer support team is available to assist.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests
summary: Gorgeous Studio Unit in the heart of Chicago - Rivernorth. Professionally managed and fully stocked w/ everything from salt, pepper, shampoo and body-wash to a sparkling water welcome gift!

additional_house_rules:
Before you book, please be aware of the following:

We strive to maintain the absolute highest standard of service on Airbnb.  However, we are not a 5-star hotel and are therefore unable to provide everything that you would expect from a hotel.  If you have specific things that you are very picky about, please discuss with us before booking.

Due to changing regulations on Airbnb in Chicago, we must ask that you maintain discretion with building staff.  Please do not approach them with any requests.  Definitely do not approach them to collect keys or “check-in.”

You will be asked to avoid the main lobby of the building and use an alternate entrance.

Please review the notes in the Location section of the listing before making your booking.

Once you arrive, we will ask you to follow our house rules.  

Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously.  Failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.	This building is 100% non-smoking.  No smoking or vaping of anything inside the unit or on building premises.  Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
2.	This a quiet and upscale residential building.  Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. Our neighbors are very sensitive and they will report loud noise.
3.	Absolutely no guests not in the reservation are allowed in the apartment or the building.
4.	Pets are not allowed at the property.
5.	Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed-upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check out fee.
6.	Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence.  Additionally, lost keys will incur a $200 per key fee.

access:
Guests will have access to all the amenities this building has to offer
Community Amenities:
    Complimentary coffee bar
    Professional fitness center with state-of-the-art cardiovascular and weight training machines
    Spa area with whirlpools and men's and women's steam rooms and sauna
    Outdoor pool and sundeck with grill area
    Resident lounge, equipped with high-definition TV and surround sound
    Resident lounge with billiards table and view of beautiful Lake Michigan
    MP3 (e.g., iPod) compatible sound system throughout amenities areas
    Wireless internet throughout amenities floor
    24 hour business center equipped with computers, printers and copier 


 
Apartment Features

    Energy-efficient floor-to-ceiling windows
    Granite or quartz countertops & stainless steel appliances throughout kitchen
    Hardwood maple kitchen cabinetry with mahogany finish
    Ceramic tile in kitchen and bath
    Stackable washer and dryer
    Walk-in closets, linen and guest closets
description: Shoot hoops in the basketball court and lift weights in the fitness center. Then cool down with a swim in the pool, before soaking in a rooftop hot tub. Back in the huge corner apartment, take in unmatched views through floor-to-ceiling windows.

neighborhood_overview: Marvel at the cutting-edge architecture and views of Lake Michigan to be had nearby. Visit renowned institutions like the Field Museum and the Adler Planetarium, dine on cuisines from all over the world, and experience the legendary blues scene.
notes:
You will be provided 1 set of keys to access the property.

Please be advised that all guests will be asked to sign a rental usage agreement that governs the terms of your stay.  For the protection of all parties, the booking party will also be required to provide a copy of a valid government issued ID and matching credit card prior to check in. This information is collected for verification purposes only and is not stored or otherwise used for any other purpose
By completing the reservation you agree to the following:
    - I agree to be bound by our rental terms and conditions.
    - I acknowledge that I will be required to provide a copy of a valid government issued ID and matching credit card prior to check in.
    - I acknowledge that I may be required to undergo a background check if mandated by the property management company or the building, as stated in accordance by my rental agreement and condition of the booking.
space:
Located In The Heart Of Downtown Chicago Right Off The Magnificent Mile
Located only 1 block from the world famous Michigan Ave
In this modern building you'll enjoy:
-Prime location in Chicago right off of Michigan Ave 
-24 Hr Doorman 
-Sophisticated Modern Interiors 
-Bamboo Flooring 
-Stainless Steel Appliances and Fully Loaded 
-Kitchen Granite Countertops and Wood Cabinets 
-Professionally Cleaned with Fresh Linens/Towel for every guest 
-Great Views overlooking the city 
-In Unit Washer and Dryer 
-Fully Stocked Kitchen 
-High Speed internet with WiFi 
-Pack & Play (for the young ones)
-Cable TV 
-Fitness Center 
-Indoor Lap Pool 
-Rooftop Lounge Area with Hot Tub 
-Outdoor Rooftop Hot Tub 
-Basketball Court 
-Great Terrace overlooking the Chicago River
summary: Shoot hoops in the basketball court and lift weights in the fitness center. Then cool down with a swim in the pool, before soaking in a rooftop hot tub. Back in the huge corner apartment, take in unmatched views through floor-to-ceiling windows.
transit:
You are minutes away from bus and train stops.  

We find our guests prefer to use Uber, which is a very convenient and cheap way to get around the city.  

There is no parking available in the building, however there are several garages and lots within a block of the building.  We recommend the apps SpotHero or ParkWhiz to find and book parking.

access: You will receive a check-in doc a few days before your trip with information on parking, access instructions and nearby amenities.
description:
Located in one of Chicago's hottest neighborhoods, Logan Square, our recently rehabbed 3 bedroom apartment is perfect for groups, families and business travelers looking for a nice, tidy and quiet place to stay and enjoy Chicago. You are near the Western Blue Line Train stop giving you easy access to O'Hare and downtown. Nearby the home are also restaurants, nightlife and more!

This recently renovated 3 bedroom is able to comfortably sleep  5 people with 2 comfy king sized beds and a full sized bed. You and your group can also enjoy a nice meal in the fully stocked kitchen.

Our living room has a smart TV that is Roku enabled giving you access to streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, etc. We do not have cable TV, so please take advantage of the free streaming services you have access to!

There is a parking spot out back for one car as well!

You will receive a check-in doc a few days before your trip with information on parking, access instructions and nearby amenities.

We are off-site but available when needed!

Cheap eats and bike-friendly streets. Gourmet coffee, scruffy dive bars and artisanal cocktail lounges. Some may say it's a recipe for a hipster haven but there's a proud, working-class sensibility that keeps this Northwest Side neighborhood grounded. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.

You are a 15 min walk from the Western Blue Line Train stop giving you access to downtown and O'Hare. If you are driving, Highway 90/94E is a quick 5 min drive as well.

Otherwise, we recommend taking an Uber/Lyft to get around as they are plenty roaming around!

access:
Guests have access to the entire apartment. 

Check in super fast and easy. The apartment is equipped with a secure electronic, keyless access system so you'll be able to enter hassle free with no delays or waiting around. Simply enter your unique code on the keypad and you're in. No keys required.
description:
This beautiful and spacious 3 bedroom apartment was designed specifically for Airbnb comfort. It is diligently maintained to luxury hotel standards and is conveniently located right where Chicago's hottest neighborhoods converge (Wicker Park, Bucktown, Logan Square, and Humboldt Park). Perfect for couples, families, and small groups.

This newly renovated apartment is on the first floor of a private 4 unit building on a quiet residential street in East Humboldt Park, just steps away from Wicker Park, Bucktown, West Town, and Logan Square - all of Chicago's hottest neighborhoods. The 606 Bloomingdale Trail and Park is just one block away. 

The apartment has been designed like a large luxury hotel suite to accommodate the needs of visiting guests, without any of the personal clutter found in most listings. It's a very warm, welcoming, well-equipped space to call home while you explore everything incredible Chicago has to offer, and hop from gallery to bar to restaurant and back again! 

It is professionally cleaned and prepared before every visit, and comes well stocked with extra bedding, towels, and other necessities. 

The apartment features:

★Large living room with ample seating for 6-7 adults
★Large flat screen HDTV with Roku (access Netflix, Amazon, HBO with your own account)
★Complimentary high-speed wireless internet 
★3 private bedrooms, each with a queen-sized CASPER mattress
★Mirrors in 2 of 3 bedrooms and a full-length mirror in the dining room for getting ready
★Make-up removal towels in the bathroom
★Bathroom stocked with hair dryer, toiletries, and plenty of fresh towels
★Private secure entrance with keyless entry
★Fully equipped kitchen with coffee maker (Keurig), toaster, and lots of serveware 
★Access to full size washer/dryer in building (free)
★Free street parking in front (availability may vary)

Guests have access to the entire apartment. 

Check in super fast and easy. The apartment is equipped with a secure electronic, keyless access system so you'll be able to enter hassle free with no delays or waiting around. Simply enter your unique code on the keypad and you're in. No keys required.

I always check that guests are happy, but other than that I leave them alone to enjoy the apartment in peace!

However, I am on hand 24/7 for any issues, and I always respond very fast to messages and texts.

The apartment is on the border of Humboldt Park and Logan Square, and very close to both Bucktown and Wicker Park. It is a 5 minute walk from both Humboldt Park (the actual park, not the neighborhood) and the new 606 Trail, an elevated pedestrian walkway which cuts across Logan Square and Bucktown! The area is a quiet residential neighborhood, with tree-lined streets filled with a mix of single family homes and small 2-4 unit apartment buildings and condos. It is within walking distance of a grocery store, convenience store, a Walgreens, bars, restaurants, dry cleaners, etc.

The apartment is on a one-way street with free street parking on both sides of the street. The L Blue Line that runs between O'hare Airport and the Loop (downtown) is a 12 minute walk away. Both the California Ave bus and the North Ave bus stops are a block away.

Check in begins at 4pm and check out time is 12pm noon. Please message me in advance if you have any special requests.

I always check that guests are happy, but other than that I leave them alone to enjoy the apartment in peace!

However, I am on hand 24/7 for any issues, and I always respond very fast to messages and texts.

access: Free laundry is downstairs in the basement (please excuse the storage area).
description:
Big room on a quiet street. 10 minute walk to the CTA Blue line which lets you travel to downtown Chicago in about 30 minutes. 
Private Entrance from the side door for complete privacy. 
1 Block from Walgreens and a neighborhood grocery store. 
Free laundry in basement. 
Fast Wi-Fi

Minifridge and microwave included for leftovers  

This room shares a bathroom with one other room upstairs so please excuse any small cleanliness issues in the shared areas.

A furnished room in a 100 year old home. Yes the wood is dark, the stairs and floors creak a bit, but the brick house is cool in the summer and nice and warm in the Chicago winter. This space is far away from the hustle and bustle of the city but still offers all the amenities with downtown being a 25 minute ride on the blue line (or a 15 minute uber with no traffic). During the summer the street is a verdant green with a conservatory and an art district within walking distance for exploration.

Free laundry is downstairs in the basement (please excuse the storage area).

I will be available for quick questions through text

Blocks away from Oak Park's art district filled with weird shops and cozy little cafes. There is a conservatory on Garfield ave with talking parrots and offers a nice escape from the cold in the winter. Roosevelt is lined with bars, breweries, and restaurants (Fitzgeralds is a famous music venue).

10 minute walk to CTA Blue Line
15 minute Uber downtown

access:
As an "Entire home" reservation, you'll have the ENTIRE suite to yourselves. Enjoy the privacy and luxury of this unique experience :)

All amenities shown in the pictures are available to guests too: hot tub, gym, club room, lounge. Just please be polite and respectful to others in the building.
description:
Located in Chicago's Loop, this large 2 Bedroom is in the heart of all things Chicago. Theatres, shopping, great restaurants, nightlife, parks and Lake Michigan are all nearby!

This luxurious suite creates the perfect centerpiece for any trip to Chicago, whether for business, pleasure, or both. Not only will you have an incredible view day and night, you will also be centrally located in a hub of all that Chicago has to offer in sightseeing, nightlife, arts, and entertainment.  The unit is located in the heart of the city, very close to Michigan Ave., in a haven that has a reputation for being eclectic, interesting, artistic and tightly-woven.

As an "Entire home" reservation, you'll have the ENTIRE suite to yourselves. Enjoy the privacy and luxury of this unique experience :)

All amenities shown in the pictures are available to guests too: hot tub, gym, club room, lounge. Just please be polite and respectful to others in the building.

We can interact as much or as little as you want.  I travel frequently, so even if I'm not here, you can always reach out to me for anything you may need.  The best way to reach me is through airbnb messaging.  If I'm around I'd be happy to show you around or just leave you alone :-).

Located in downtown Chicago's Loop, the area has a reputation for being eclectic and interesting, artistic and tightly-woven. Walking distance to Chicago's bustling business district, shopping, dining, culture, and entertainment.  2 miles from McCormick Place.  Here is a list of my favorite restaurants, cultural centers, and entertainment venues all within walking distance of the apartment:
Restaurants - Mercata a la Planxa, Hackney's, Giocco, Umai, South Loop Club, Blackie's, Chicago Firehouse Restaurant, Lou Malnati's, Buddy Guy's Legends
Culture/Entertainment - Willis (Sears) Tower, Lake Michigan, Soldier Field, Museum Campus (Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium), Buckingham Fountain, Art Institute of Chicago, ShowPlace ICON Movie Theatre, Chicago Cultural Center, Oriental Theatre, Petrillo Music Shell, Harris Theatre, Auditorium Theatre at Roosevelt University, Chicago Theatre, Pritzker Music Pavilion, Goodman Theatre, Symphony Center.

If you can avoid having a car, I recommend it. If not, your best option will be to download an app such as SpotHero or ParkWhiz to find discounted spots in parking lots throughout the area. If using public transportation, Chicago's public train system called The L is the best way to get around.

The building does not have a parking garage available to guests. I recommend using an app, such as SpotHero, to find discounted parking nearby. If you're driving to Chicago, but won't be using your car during your stay, parking somewhere further north around Lincoln Park or further South around the South Loop is definitely your best option!

description:
We are a block from Roscoe Village, with its many restaurants and boutiques, coffee shops, bars, a bakery, dry cleaner, two major grocery stores, a drugstore, and a fine bookstore - all within walking distance. The apartment is sunny and airy, in the tree tops on a double city lot. Private deck. Antique furniture.  Easy street parking. Public transportation a block away.
Our place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

Restaurants
Within four blocks on Roscoe Street (between Claremont and Damen), there is a mecca of restaurants, boutiques, salons, coffee shops, a liquor store, several bars and taverns, dry cleaners, flower shop, a big thrift store and a fine independent bookstore. Please let us know if you are searching for a specific type of store or restaurant, and we can point you in the right direction!

Roscoe Village restaurants and taverns (an abbreviated list!):
Le Sud Mediterranean - southern French cuisine
Turquoise - Turkish cuisine
Altiro - fusion Latin cuisine
Cuba 312
Piazza Bella - Italian cuisine
Volo - fine American
Kitsch'n - American "retro" comfort food
Paciuga Gelato Caffe
John's Place -  American comfort food
Victory's Banner - Vegetarian and vegan. Breakfast & lunch only.
Lush - wide selection of wines, beer and liquor & restaurant. Sunday wine tastings.
Hot Woks Cool Sushi
Village Tap 
Riverview Tavern
Commonwealth Tavern
Four Moon Tavern - on Roscoe, east of Damen

Coffee shops on Roscoe Street:
Hero Coffee Bar (terrific sandwiches too)
Starbuck's
Pilates & Coffee

Bus and the L (Elevated Train)
You can catch the Western Avenue bus (no. 49 and 49Xpress) at the corner of Roscoe and Western. You will need correct change for the bus: $2.25.

If you want to go downtown take the 49 or 49X bus north to the Brown Line "Western" L stop (you'll see the elevated tracks) at Western & Lincoln Ave. Once on the L, it's a 20-30 minute ride to downtown Chicago, depending on time of day.

Or, if you want to cut out the bus link (as I do), you can walk 15 minutes east (towards the lake) on Roscoe Street to the Brown Line "Paulina" stop. The L station is where Roscoe Street, Lincoln Ave., and Paulina cross. Look for the elevated tracks and the station is nearby on Lincoln Avenue.

Divvy Bikes - short term city bike rental. Bikes can be deposited at any depot.
There's a depot just around the corner on Roscoe. Rental information is posted there.

Chicago River Canoe & Kayak: You are a short ten minute walk from the river (head west on Roscoe). The boat rental is at Roscoe and Rockwell, housed in the beautiful boathouse there designed by the renowned architect, Jeanne Gang.

Checkout Instructions
We kindly ask that you check out by 11 am. This will ensure that we have time to properly clean the house in preparation for other guests checking in. Let us know if this is going to be a problem and we will try to make arrangements that better suit your timeline. 

Leave keys in the black lock box at the top of your back stairs.  (I will point this out to you). Do not place keys in our regular mailboxes outside the house. 
P.S. If it's snowy on the back stairs, we'll make another arrangement!
house_rules:
- Absolutely no smoking and no drugs on the premises.
- As we live on the first floor, we appreciate rather quiet guests, especially after 9pm! We hope that you also enjoy peace and quiet.

description:
Only ONE BLOCK away to United Center. Best location and most affordable price! You can get to Untd Cntr in 5min walking. You have all the nice bars and restaurants of west loop 7min away by car.Hearth of downtown 10min away with not traffic. And 15min by public transp. Free parking on the street. We offer all the amenities you might need. My cohost runs over 40 rooms around the city. We have a whole team to help you anytime and to make sure everything is perfect! Place is clean every single day.

Only ONE BLOCK away from United Center(5min walking).

Super close to Downtown chicago( 7min away to west loop area where all the bars and restaurants).
10 min by car to the hearth of Downtown with no traffic.
15 by public transportation

You can get there by Uber or public transportation. Parking is free on the street. Right in front of the building it’s free but you’re not supposed to park there when there is events in United Center. But on the two other street of each corner of the street where the building is you can park for free as well

The room is private but you will share common areas ( kitchen , living room, and the bathroom/s) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd because most of Airbnb guests are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you! 
The room has one full size bed. If you want to add 3rd or 4th guest in the reservation I could add 1 extra air mattress with no extra fee if the reservation is set for 3 or 4. If the reservation is for 2 and you’d like to have an extra air mattress we charge $15p/night and we provide air mattress and linens for it. the room will become smaller for luggage becase you will have two beds on it. This is a good option if you want to save even more money otherwise you can book two rooms! 
As most houses in United States this is not made with concrete so you will hear people walking or outside sounds. It doesn’t bother most of the guest but if you are a very light sleeper maybe you should choose an entire place. or have an earphone or something to block the sound. There will be security cameras ON in shared spaces only( living room, kitchen, hallways, entrance of the apartment, exits of the apartment).

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen
- Free private parking

Wicker Park highlights
- Walkability score: 93
- 4 minute walk to Big Star (best Mexican street food)
- 6 minute walk to Bongo Room (inventive brunch fare)

Getting around
- 4 blocks to Damen subway station
- 20 minute drive to downtown
- 35 minute drive to ORD Airport

Boasting a youthful energy and trendy dining and shopping scenes, Wicker Park puts endless possibilities at your fingertips. Walkable streets are littered with boutique shops, cafes, and art galleries. Craft cocktail bars and performance venues make it one of the city's most popular nightlife destinations, while the Bloomingdale Trail and Park offer joggers and bikers a welcome respite from bustling streets.

This Sonder has cathedral-style ceilings and prone to noise.

There is no elevator.

There is basic cable. Additionally, we've provided a ROKU streaming device.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.
neighborhood_overview: Boasting a youthful energy and trendy dining and shopping scenes, Wicker Park puts endless possibilities at your fingertips. Walkable streets are littered with boutique shops, cafes, and art galleries. Craft cocktail bars and performance venues make it one of the city's most popular nightlife destinations, while the Bloomingdale Trail and Park offer joggers and bikers a welcome respite from bustling streets.
notes:
This Sonder has cathedral-style ceilings and prone to noise.

There is no elevator.

There is basic cable. Additionally, we've provided a ROKU streaming device.
space:
- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen
- Free private parking

Wicker Park highlights
- Walkability score: 93
- 4 minute walk to Big Star (best Mexican street food)
- 6 minute walk to Bongo Room (inventive brunch fare)

Getting around
- 4 blocks to Damen subway station
- 20 minute drive to downtown
- 35 minute drive to ORD Airport
summary:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

description:
Nearby O’hare international airport and downtown Chicago is just 20 miles away. Easy access to highways and trains. Quiet neighborhood  and a gated pet friendly yard.  Free parking ! Close proximity to major malls and recreational paths /parks. Craft Brewery and nightlife within walking distance .

Garden apartment, living space, desk small refrigerator, 1/2 bath, large private bedroom

We love interacting with guests. There is always something to learn from others but we also are respectful of privacy as many enjoy

Parks and recreation trails shopping malls the highways are mile away, craft breweries, river 

Downtown chicago is under 20 miles away

Car is convenient around our neighborhood but inner city chicago Traffic can standstill so be sure to plan well ahead if driving downtown. We recommend taking the train into downtown to avoid parking prices. our location is a mere 1.2 miles south of the Metra Train station (UNion pacific westline )which takes you directly to the heart of Chicago.

NEW SHOWER  and SINK installed!!!  YAY!!!!   Now the space is entirely Private  7/10/2019

description:
Come relax in this stylish 1BD/1BA apartment, professionally managed by Kasa. 
In the middle of all Chicago has to offer - near Oak Street Beach, Michigan Avenue and Gold Coast are all within walking distance. Chicago's best shopping, dining and entertainment just foot steps away. 

Key features include: 
* Relax in the luxurious king-sized bed with memory foam mattress
* Queen Size Sofa Sleeper in living room
* Cook and enjoy wonderful cuisine with the modern high-end kitchen 
* Browse the web and stream HD video with ultra high-speed internet 
* Pet Friendly! Enjoy your Kasa with your furry friend! 
Note: Pet Fee of $15 per day will apply with a 1 pet limit.

House Rules: 
We created Kasa to be your home on the road.  We’re committed to being great neighbors and strictly enforce these House Rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. NO Smoking - Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property. This applies to the entire apartment (including the balcony or patio), as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. Noise - At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment. In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9:00 p.m. to 8:00 a.m.  Parties and large gatherings are prohibited.  Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy.   Occupancy – Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit. There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted.  Lost and Found - Kasa assumes no liability for lost, misplaced, stolen, or damaged belongings, including any belongings which are left in the unit after your departure time has passed.  Pets –With the exception of service animals, breed and pet restrictions are imposed by the building management. Requests to bring a pet must be approved by Kasa prior to booking. $15 Daily pet fee per day will apply. Pet fees are not included in the total reservation price. If you are authorized to bring a pet, an additional pet fee will be applied after the booking is complete. Kasa has a 1 pet per apartment limit.  Return of Fobs & Keys – All designated fobs, keys, and parking passes must be left in the apartment upon check out.  Failure to do so will result in an immediate replacement fee of up to $250.00 per item. Please alert Kasa staff immediately if any items are missing at the beginning of your stay.   Infestation - If Kasa determines that you have brought any infestation into the unit or onto the premises, Kasa reserves the right to charge you for any and all costs and expenses that Kasa deems necessary to address the infestation.  Parking at Own Risk - All vehicles parked on the premises must be registered with Kasa prior to arrival. Vehicles are parked at the risk of the owner. Kasa shall not assume liability or responsibility for any vehicle, occupants, or contents while operated or parked on the property.  Damaged or Missing Property - Guests are liable for any damage and/or theft at the unit, premises, or property caused by the guest, their visitors, or other persons present in the unit during the guest’s stay. This includes damage to rooms, fixtures, furnishings and equipment (such as towels, artwork, electronics, and kitchen equipment). Kasa reserves the right to charge guests for 120% of such amounts as it shall in its sole discretion deem necessary to compensate or make good the costs or expenses incurred or suffered by Kasa as a result of the damage and/or theft. Charges may include but are not limited to: all property damage; missing or damaged items; smoking fee; cleaning fee; and guest compensation.  Identity Verification - To protect against identity theft and fraud, and for the safety of other guests and neighbors in the community, you will be required to provide a scanned or photographed copy of your valid, government-issued photo ID during the virtual check-in process for the purpose of performing a background check or screening.  Use - The unit and amenity areas shall not be used for any unlawful or illegal purpose. No nails, screws, or other items may be driven into any portion of the unit. Guests shall use the unit for residential purposes only. Guests shall not conduct any commercial, industrial, or retail activity in the unit.  Client Accommodation Agreement - Prior to arrival, all guests must agree to abide by the Kasa Stay Rules, which will be provided to the guest for review and signature during the virtual check-in process. Security Deposit – Non-compliance with the House Rules and Kasa Stay Rules could result in a penalty and/or forfeiture of the Security Deposit and/or eviction without a refund.

description:
Elegantly decorated and spacious 2-bedroom/1.5 bath apartment in Lakeview.

✔ Easy self-check-in & keyless entry.
✔ Experienced hosts on-call to answer your questions.
✔ Close to transit, dining, bars, shops, groceries, and Wrigley Field.
✔ 12-min train ride to downtown via the nearby Belmont 'L' train stop.

“It felt like every time we walked around the neighborhood we discovered another interesting restaurant or shop that we wanted to explore.” -William, Washington, D.C.

The perfect blend of modern styling and classic charm that can only be found in an updated vintage unit like this.

This apartment comfortably sleeps six.

🧍🧍 → Room 1 (queen bed)
🧍🧍 → Room 2 (queen bed)
🧍🧍 → Air mattress (queen)

APARTMENT HIGHLIGHTS

✔ Keyless entry
✔ Fully equipped kitchen
✔ Furnishings from West Elm
✔ High-speed internet
✔ Keurig coffee maker
✔ 50" Smart TV w/ Netflix (no cable TV)

EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS

During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club and co-working space located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower (for reservations <14 days).  Included with your membership:

– Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars.
– Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan.
– Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck.

Metropolitan Club Hours:

Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm
Saturday: 5pm – 10pm
Sunday: Closed

HAVE A QUESTION?

Check the “Other Things to Note” section of this listing for the answers to our most frequently asked questions.

WHY STAY WITH TROVE?

⭐ Fast Communication
We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes.

⭐ Experienced Hosts
We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years.

⭐ Exclusive Perks
Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower.

⭐ Easy Self-Check-In
Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay!

⭐ Central Location
You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.

We're located in Lakeview, one of Chicago's safest and most popular neighborhoods. Most of the area's restaurants, bars, and shops are concentrated on Belmont Ave,  Sheffield Ave, Clark St, Broadway St, and Halsted St. There are also plenty of hidden gems and tucked-away spots to discover for those who like to wander.

THINGS TO DO NEARBY

✔ Walk to Wrigleyville and catch a Cub's game.
✔ Admire the Chicago skyline from the Lakefront Trail.
✔ Catch a live show at the Vic Theatre.
✔ Choose from over 300 beers at Beermiscuous.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Belmont Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is a 3-minute walk away.
→ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?”

Excellent public transit directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. Our building is just a short walk from the Belmont “L” train station. Search for “Belmont red line station” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest.

2. “Is there parking nearby?”

Parking in Chicago is always difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using an app called SpotHero to reserve a nearby paid parking spot. We love SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding one the day you arrive.

3. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3pm or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30am to drop off your bags in the living room (just note that our staff will have your room ready by 3pm).

Check-out is at 11am. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11am, but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30pm at the latest.

additional_house_rules:
1) Check in is from 5-10PM. I can not greet guests before 5PM or after 10PM, so don’t even ask. If you arrive at 10:01PM, I will not be available to greet you under any circumstances because 10:01 is after 10PM. 
2) Check out is at 11:00AM.
3) Please read the itinerary that AirBnB will send you upon booking. The address and wifi information is on there. 
4) Read the signs as far as parking and yes, it's free and available. Don’t park on the South side of the street because that’s permit parking only. 
5) If you book the room for safety reasons I would prefer (meaning require) to greet you and hand you the keys, not your guests. 
6) I've found it best to communicate with guests only through the Airbnb message thread because it helps me remember guests' questions. So please talk to me through that Airbnb message thread only. 
7) If keys get lost I must charge $50 to replace them. 
8) Please wash, dry, and put away dirty dishes. If dishes are left out, I must charge a $20 fee. 
9) Before you check out please empty the garbages in each room and in the kitchen and take the garbage bag around to the back yard and place it in the larger garbage cans. Then place a clean garbage bag in the garbage can in the kitchen. Again, if this isn't done or if it's left in the back hallway then I must charge $20. 
10) Please tell me a day in advanced what time in between the hours of 5-10 you will be arriving. 
11) Be sure to have a current profile pic of yourselves that allows me to clearly see your face and not, say, you in a paintball mask or at age 10. 
12) If glitter is found in the house, you must pay $100, just cuz taking all that time to get glitter out of everywhere is redounkulous and I don’t have that time. 
13) Please be sure to upload a Gov ID to Airbnb’s website before sending a reservation request. 

Thanks for your inquiry and interest. I work hard to accommodate guests and be sure that the rooms are very clean. If you have any questions, please ask. :)

access: Four guests can stay here. Maybe 5 guests, but they must sleep on the couch.
description:
Five minutes from the train station, which is 15 min from the city center. Great, lively neighborhood. Street parking is free and available. Downtown Pilsen is an up and coming artist neighborhood in Chicago. It has a 50" HD TV, Bluetooth 30 watt sound bar, Amazon Fire Stick, and wifi with 75MB, so it's fast. Lastly, I can not check-in guests early or late so please don’t even ask.

The apartment has two bedrooms with two full size beds in each room. The back room is 8.5 feet by 7.5 ft.(2.60meters by 2.3 m), the front room is 9 ft. by 8 ft. (2.74m by 2.4m), and the bathroom is 7.5 ft. by 7.5 ft. (2.3m by 2.3m) including measuring the shower area. Each room has a closet, space heater, and towels. The kitchen has cook ware, dishes, and silverware. If you need something I don't have to cook with tell me and I'll go get it. The bathroom is on the smaller side. In an area in the hallway the floor is slightly damaged, but it's easy to avoid. Be sure to click on the picture to see the entire picture and then you’ll see it circled on the lower right hand corner of the pic. If you have 5 guests please keep in mind that the fifth person will have to sleep on the couch and the couch is not a hide a bed, couch. 

And you should know that before every guest arrives I clean thoroughly, including the bathroom. I use a drill brush (and sometimes a sponge) in the bathtub and bathtub tile, scrub around and on the toilet, sink, and windex the mirrors, and sweep the floor so it’s not going to get any cleaner. If there’s an off-white tinge to the bathtub area that’s a stain and not because it’s dirty. 

Parking is free. Be sure to read the signs to know if street cleaning will be arriving. They usually come from the month of November every 4th Monday between the hours of 7AM-9AM, or something like that. If you're driving and would prefer to drive to The Loop instead of paying for the train, then be sure to download the app, "Parkwhiz" or "SpotHero.(URL HIDDEN)
I like to interact with guests. You will be given your own set of keys to the building and apartment and can come and go as you please. 

It's at a great location with restauraunts around that I'm frequenting always. Cool pubs are down the street. It's directly across from the National Museum of Mexican Art, which is free. Free parking. 

Thanks for viewing. This place is perfect for college-aged or young professionals, but everyone with positive and safe energy is welcome, too. 

This neighborhood is considered an up and coming where some professionals and artists have settled. Some students also live here. It's hip with a raw feeling to it. I love it. Within 1 block there's an internet cafe, called NiteCap, and delicious authentic Mexican restaurants nearby.  Pubs are easy to walk to. I recommend Simone's, but Harbee's is closer. It's also next to a park and a Mexican Museum. There's a liquor store right next (West side) of the train station and a Family Dollar- which if you buy something there you can withdraw money and the ATM fees are only $1.50. So I go there to get laundry cash all of the time... and where I get my Junior Mints. Aldi, a supermarket, is nearby. 

•The Pink Line train station is less than 5 minutes walk to my place.
•The bus #18 on 18th St. is 1 minute away.    
•Bike rental is available next to the train station.

If you're able to send me an inquiry about certain dates then those dates are, indeed available and I'd love to host you. For everyone's safety I do request that guests upload a picture ID to AirBnB's website.    
 
Train and bus passes can be purchased at any train station and the attendants are very helpful if you have any questions. It's about $20 for a 3-day pass and $28 for a 7-day pass for both bus and the train.  And to rent bikes for 24 hours it's $7.

Four guests can stay here. Maybe 5 guests, but they must sleep on the couch.

The neighborhood is definitely safe. And awesome.

Take the train to downtown even if you've driven. It's a cool ride.

I ask for a security deposit because I have a TV and sound bar, mainly, I'd  like protected, just in case. I do not believe that it would be charged unless you gave your permission or Airbnb charges it, but please ask AirBnB any questions because I am unfamiliar with the details.

3) Please read the itinerary that AirBnB will send you upon booking. The address and wifi information is on there. 
4) Read the signs as far as parking and yes, it's free and available. Don’t park on the South side of the street because that’s permit parking only.

additional_house_rules:
****bookings without reviews will have to provide an ID via the Airbnb messaging system or at check in. LOCAL, one night stays must provide IDS of all guests via messaging system PRIOR to check in. 

NO UNAUTHORIZED GUESTS ALLOWED****  

NO SMOKING IN THE UNIT. $200 fine + cleaning fees.  

NO SHOES in the apartment (its a Japanese thing). We have provided slippers for you. It keeps the place cleaner. If you have a pet we can consider it based on a case to case basis but please contact me first.   

Please no one under 21 yrs old without a parent or guardian. Thank you.  

Please WASH any dishes you use. There will be a $25 extra fee for anything more than a few dishes left behind. Thank you.  

Please be HONEST about how many guests are staying. There is a surcharge for deception... just BE HONEST. The building has cameras! Additional guests without prior notification will be charged DOUBLE the nightly guest rate.    

ABSOLUTELY NO PARTIES... You will immediately forfeit your stay and not receive a refund. Thank you. *IF YOU ARE TRYING TO BE SLICK AND BOOK TO THROW A PARTY AND/OR THEN TRY TO CANCEL: I WILL KEEP WHATEVER MONEY YOU PAY PER THE CANCELLATION POLICY.   

For stays with children under 2 yrs old: The unit is not "baby proofed" but is suitable if the child is under constant supervision. 


 I want to preface the following by saying 95% of our guests leave our places in amazing condition. We are very understanding about small messes that may have been overlooked as I know I am by no means perfect. That being said the following is to address the 5% who may not understand quite how airbnb works yet.  

1. We are not a hotel.  
2. We are not your personal maids.   

While there is a cleaning fee, the fee is to cover changing of linens, washing of towels and "normal" cleaning of the kitchen, bathroom and living areas. What is not covered and WILL incur an extra fee are the following:   

1. A pile of dishes left in the sink (violates house rules)
2. Excessive kitchen messes such as cooking grease all over the stove. 
3. Excessive food on the floors (I dont mean a few crumbs-I mean it looked like someone was feeding pigeons). 
4. Chewing gum ground into the furniture (yes, that has actually happened). 
5. OBVIOUS wearing of shoes in the unit (we are a no-shoes house- see house rules) ie shoes foot prints, tracked in dirt and mud. 
 Anything else above and beyond what is considered "normal" cleaning.  
6. smoking in the unit will AUTOMATICALLY  incur a $200 fee.  
7. NO PETS. We have other units available that allow pets. please contact me about them. $100 fee if pets are found staying in the unit without prior consent.    

Again- this ISNT the majority of our guests and we understand things can be overlooked. Upon an "excessive cleaning" situation, I will not leave any review, I will simply send a request for an extra cleaning fee (usually around $25-50) depending on how much extra time it took to clean. Thank you for your understanding.

access: The entire building is accessible.
description:
BEST neighborhood in Chicago. The 1st real neighborhood west of all the high-rises, close to restaurants, shops and blue line. Two units available for your group. Two kitchens and bathrooms. High quality memory foam mattresses, 1000tc sheets and duvets, IN UNIT laundry, Kuerig coffeemakers, microwaves, stoves, fridges and stocked kitchens. CENTRAL AIR CONDITIONING. Sleeps up to 13 people but really a perfect size for 9. Plenty of FREE street parking too! *NOT CORPORATE OWNED

Two Airbnbs available in the same building! Great for large families or business trips where you want to stay in close proximity to one another. both units are two bedrooms with one bath. Both kitchens are fully stocked with full size appliances and laundry. Central air conditioning is also available in both units. Both units have a flat screen TV with Netflix and Hulu. there is also an Amazon Alexa and a Samsung soundbar for your musical needs.
Sleeping arrangements: one unit has TWO bedrooms with queen size beds. ONE fold down couch that one person can sleep on. ONE air mattress. The second floor unit has two bedrooms, one with a queen size bed and the other with FULL size bunks with a trundle. An air mattress can also be used in the dining area.

The entire building is accessible.

I can be as available as needed. I don't live far from the unit and about 10 min away.

Located in the fantastic neighborhood of "Noble Square" conveniently located close to tourist sites, downtown, and restaurant row. Uber is very inexpensive and the Chicago blue line stop is a 7 min walk away. Great restaurants, Starbucks and parks are all located within walking distance.

Uber, Lyft, Chicago blue line, Grand Ave bus and your own car are great ways to get around. Plenty of free street parking available and permitted parking as well.

additional_house_rules:
1) Check in is from 4-10PM. 
2) Check out is at 11:00AM.
3) Please read the itinerary that AirBnB will send you upon booking.
4) Read the signs as far as parking and yes, it's free and available. 
5) And if you book the room for safety reasons I would prefer to greet you and hand you the keys, not your guests. 
6) I've found it best to communicate with guests only through the Airbnb thread because it helps me remember guests' questions. So please talk to me through that Airbnb message thread only. 
7) If keys get lost I must charge $50 to replace them.
8) The apps on the fire stick are offered but I do not offer my personal username and password for the apps, so you’ll have to have your own. 
9) While check in is from 4-10 a greeting time or an estimated greeted time must be told to me a day in advanced so that I can plan my day accordingly if you book a reservation before the day of your arrival. If you do send me an estimated time of arrival then please specify that your arrival time is an estimate and then I could agree to also meet you at that estimated time. 

Thanks for your inquiry and interest. I work hard to accommodate guests and be sure that the rooms are very clean. If you have any questions, please ask.

description:
Decorated with art from local artists, this is a clean space and has everything you need. Full size comfortable bed with a night stand next to it and a small closet. Feel free to cook what you would like in the kitchen. It's a 5 min walk from the train station and only a 15 minute train ride to The Loop and down the street from Thalia Hall.

Thanks for viewing. This place is perfect for college-aged or young professionals, but everyone is welcome, including LGBT peeps, people with disabilities, all immigrants from any and every country, all women, minorities, international travelers, marchers, and everyone else. Positive, safe, and fun energy is welcome here. 

Parking is free. Park on Wood. Be sure to read the signs to know if street cleaning will be arriving. They usually come from the month of April every 4th Monday between the hours of 7AM-9AM, or something like that(URL HIDDEN)
I like to interact with guests. You will be given your own set of keys to the building and apartment and can come and go as you please. 

This neighborhood is considered an up and coming area for artists and is very cool. Within 1 block there's an internet cafe, called NiteCap, and delicious authentic Mexican restauraunts, Los Camales and El Mesquite.  Pubs are easy to walk to. I recommend Simone's but Harbee's is closer. It's also next to a park and a Mexican Museum. There's a liquor store right next (West side) of the train station and a Family Dollar- which if you buy something there you can withdraw money and the ATM fees are only $1.50. So I go there to get laundry cash all of the time... and where I get my Junior Mints.:)  

The Pink Line train station is less than 5 minutes walk to my place.
The bus #18 on 18th St. is 1 minute away.    
Bike rental is available next to the train station.

If you're able to send me an inquiry about certain dates then those dates are, indeed, available and I'd love to host you. For everyone's safety I do request that guests upload a picture ID to AirBnB's website.    
 
Train and bus passes can be purchased at any train station and the attendants are very helpful if you have any questions. It's $20 for a 3-day pass and $28 for a 7-day pass for both bus and the train.  And to rent bikes for 24 hours it's $7.

The vibe of The Flower Power room is that it's similar to a hostel, but with private rooms. It's a 2-bedroom apartment and the other room, The Sugar Skull Room, https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6957460, also has AirBnB guests. You will have the opportunity to meet other travelers if you want or have as much privacy as you’d like. 

I find that guests who enjoy staying here are those that truly enjoy interacting with other guests. So don't be afraid to chat with your flat mate, share a story, grab a meal together, or explore the wonderful city together, if you're inclined. 

To insure safety I require guests to upload their drivers license or passport to AirBnB's website.  Often, guests enjoy each other's company and sometimes attend the same events, so it enhances their Chicago experience. And, of course, you'll have your key to the bedroom, too, so, again, no privacy will be given up.

It's safe.

The Pink Line is less than 5 minutes walk.
The bus #18 on 18th St. is 2 minutes away.    Bike rental is available next to the train station.
 
Train and bus passes can be purchased at any train station and the attendants are very helpful if you have any questions. It's $20 for a 3-day pass and $28 for a 7-day pass for both bus and the train.

While check in is from 4-10, I do offer the option to guests to check in early or late, check-out late, and luggage storage if I'm available for a flat $20 fee. Under no circumstances can I show guests to a dirty room. When asking to check in early or late please give me at least a day in advanced so preparing your room will be the first of things to do on my list.

Feel free to cook what you would like in the kitchen. It's a 5 min walk from the train station and only a 15 minute train ride to The Loop and down the street from Thalia Hall.
transit:
The Pink Line is less than 5 minutes walk.
The bus #18 on 18th St. is 2 minutes away.    Bike rental is available next to the train station.
 
Train and bus passes can be purchased at any train station and the attendants are very helpful if you have any questions. It's $20 for a 3-day pass and $28 for a 7-day pass for both bus and the train.

access: Guests will have access to fitness center, laundry, and an incredible rooftop deck!
description:
Location, location, location! Clean & Comfortable! Recently updated studio with all you could need!

This high-end unit is completely furnished down to all your kitchenware, towels, and everything you could possibly need, also all your utilities are included so you will have no additional bills. 

Please feel free to search 14 West Elm Apartments to check out the building website for more information!

Completely upgraded studio in the Gold Coast, Chicago just blocks from the lake!

Features include granite counter tops, white shaker cabinets, stainless steel appliances, wall to wall hardwood flooring, nice size living and sleeping square footage! Tons of natural light with windows viewing State and Rush Street.

All of this in one of Chicago's most exquisite neighborhoods! Featuring leasing staff six days a week, friendly door staff, on-site maintenance, fitness center, incredible outdoor sun deck with lake views and gas grills, as well as laundry and bike storage!

Guests will have access to fitness center, laundry, and an incredible rooftop deck!

We will try and communicate as much as needed, although if you need anything please do not hesitate to let us know! This apartment is managed by the on-site leasing office, therefore we are easily available!

Just north of downtown Chicago, and nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline, is the Gold Coast. As the name would imply, the area is one of the country's most affluent neighborhoods. With streets that are lined with historic mansions and specialty boutiques, the Gold Coast is an intensely popular area for residents and visitors.

Branching off of The Magnificent Mile is Oak Street, an upscale shopper's dream. The retail revelry includes internationally recognized stores, swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions. If carrying around loaded shopping bags makes you hungry, you can stop at one of the district's many celebrated restaurants, including Michelin-starred winners and classic Chicago steakhouses.

A day of shopping becomes a night of revelry on the neighborhood's fabled Rush Street. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, you will find a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events. Treat yourself to the Gold Coast, you deserve it.

Red Line stop one block away and bus stops right across the street!

Available for monthly, weekly (summer), or long-term! 

For the safety of the building, we run a quick criminal background check when you arrive.

Check-in – between 3 pm - 8 pm (flexible subject to availability). 

Check-out – by 11 am (flexible subject to availability).

For the comfort of all guests, The Sono is a completely smoke-free environment.

All Rates include continental breakfast (8 am – 10 am in the kitchen area.

Children under the age of 14, unregistered guests, and pets, unfortunately, cannot be accommodated.

Each additional person above two guests in a room is $20 per night.

Parking – Free street parking with permit provided by The Sono Chicago. (Please be aware that parking is restricted within 15 feet on either side of fire hydrant and parking is restricted in school zone across from The Sono Chicago. We are not responsible for any parking violations received.

For the comfort of our other guests and neighbors, The Sono upholds a zero-tolerance policy towards commotion, excessive noise, and parties (between the hours of 10 pm and 8 am)

description:
We offer guests intimate accommodations in a quiet neighborhood to really have a peaceful experience in Chicago. Our cozy and charming rooms include luxurious beds in either king or queen size. The spacious rooms have one or two beds. Each room has a modern style and neutral tones for a refreshing, luxurious finish.

Head down to our ground floor kitchen for breakfast every morning before beginning your Chicago adventures for the day. We are located in Chicago’s historic Old Town neighborhood, within walking distance to North Avenue Beach or nearby other destinations such as the Chicago History museum, Royal George Theatre, and the Chicago Center for the Performing Arts.

Each room includes
Large flat screen TV
Free WiFi
Private en-suite bathroom

We have an inn-keeper who lives on-site. We are available for our guests at any time and love nothing more than providing recommendations for things to do and eat.

The Sono Chicago is conveniently located at 1428 N. Cleveland Avenue in Chicago's Old Town neighborhood. A variety of restaurants are within walking distance, offering options to mingle with both tourists and locals alike. North Avenue Beach, Chicago's most famous beach, is a close 20-minute walk, where you can soak up the sun, swim, play beach volleyball or participate in other water activities on Lake Michigan. Spas, boutiques, comedy clubs, parks, museums, sporting venues and more shopping than you can imagine are located in close proximity to The Sono, providing endless options for added relaxation and entertainment for your Chicago getaway.
