access: Your Airbnb rental includes access to all of Units 2 & 3, including the private back patios. You will be provided with a 4-digit access code for your group.
description:
This listing is for two condo units (#2 & #3) in the same building that can be combined to accommodate groups of 12-15. Each unit features 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths, a sofa bed, jetted bathtub, and private back patio with gas grill. Sleeps 12 comfortably. PARKING UP TO 4 VEHICLES INCLUDED.

Location is blocks from shopping, Wrigley Field, and transportation downtown. 

Professionally decorated; fully-stocked kitchen for cooking; HD cable; dining tables; sleeps 12 comfortably.

This spaces are thoughtfully decorated to reflect the character of the neighborhood and the city.

Your Airbnb rental includes access to all of Units 2 & 3, including the private back patios. You will be provided with a 4-digit access code for your group.

My preference is to give guests their space, but I’m always available by text or call should you have any questions!

Southport Corridor (a semi-official part of the larger Lakeview area) is fast-becoming one of Chicago's premiere neighborhoods, offering a variety of dining, shopping, and lifestyle options along a one-mile stretch between Belmont and Irving Park. Situated alongside Wrigley Field to the southwest, Southport Avenue is a mix of popular chains (JCrew, Gap, Anthropologie, Lululemon) as well as independently-owned specialty shops and boutiques. The area is very pedestrian-friendly, with businesses catering to the needs of neighborhood families, young professionals, and dog owners. Adjacent to Southport Corridor, and a ten minute walk to the northeast, Wrigleyville has recently undergone extensive renovations and new construction that blend the traditional ballpark with modern amenities which serve to enhance the game day experience.

This location, at Belmont and Southport avenues, is ideal for enjoying the neighborhood. Shopping, dining, and entertainment are within walking distance to the north and northeast. Multiple transportation options enable you to visit all parts of the city and return home at the end of the day for a comfortable night's rest.

Southport L Train Station (Brown Line)
Belmont L Train Station (Red, Brown, and Purple Lines)

77 Bus (East/West on Belmont)
East to the lake on Belmont (stops across Belmont on the SW corner)
West to the Belmont Blue Line Stop (stops across Southport on NE corner)

Divvy - shared bike system (station on west side of Southport north of Schuba's)

Checkout instructions: Please put all trash in trash bags, dishes in sink or dishwasher, and towels on the bathroom floor. Thank you!

- Please do not use confetti or glitter for any celebrations. It is nearly impossible to clean up.

additional_house_rules:
Please READ ALL THE RULES before booking, this helps to ensure both a happy guest and host!! Happy people are awesome!! 
--If you need an odd hour early check-in, late check-out or luggage storage, I am flexible with times but let's discuss before completing reservation and there will be a $25 dollar charge to your reservation for EARLY check -in, this includes luggage storage. Your room may still be in use by previous guest and I need time to make it clean and ready for you so early check-in is not always available! IF YOU CHECK OUT LATE AND ITS NOT PRE ARRANGED at least 24 hrs before check-out, YOU WILL BE CHARGED $25 every 15 minutes past CHECK OUT TIME, this charge starts 1 minute after the check out time and this is not a joke, holding up cleaning the room for another guest or for whatever reason I desire, is quite rude and I expect that you leave at the scheduled time. This includes luggage storage which is $25 charge. Dear Instant book guest and SAME DAY BOOKERS, if you make your reservation after MIDNIGHT, most likely I am asleep and will not respond till normal waking hours. Please be patient for reply and understand that access to enter the home is not immediate. 
-Weekdays, no noise and quiet is needed after 10pm. We rise early for our workdays. Please be considerate. The walls are very thin and noise travels through the vents, please keep volume down and use bedroom voices  after 10pm. 
-Weekends, no noise after midnight.
-No noise before 9am on weekends or holidays.
-Noise and conversations must be contained in your room, This is a peaceful quiet house, therefore please be extra considerate at all times with regards to your volume level. No loud conversations, no loud TV, no loud music, no yelling, no heckling, no cackling! All electronics must be used with headphones in common areas. This includes TV, videos, radio from your phone.  Other people live here , please remember that!
-Please report bothersome noise from inside the home, to me ASAP, sometimes I have other guest that cause disruption and I am not aware. There is another airbnb room underneath this room in basement and noise carries through the vents. 
-Your Clock Alarm can be heard through the whole house, please turn it off once it goes off the first time. Hitting snooze and allowing your alarm to repeatedly go off is very disturbing and rude, other people live here and may not have the same schedule. 
-Please be mindful of loud cell phone use in common areas, if you are in a common area such as kitchen or front room, and must answer your phone, you must ALSO leave the area and complete your conversation in your room. No one else here wants to hear your conversation!! It is very rude to have a phone conversation while someone else in the room is preparing their food, eating at the table or simply just wants to chill in the same room.  In particular I ask for Absolutely NO talking on phone in bathroom and NO SPEAKER PHONE conversations in the home. Speaker phone conversation are extremely loud and can be heard through the entire home. 
-The dress code is WEAR CLOTHES IN COMMON AREAS
-Do not leave clothes laying around in the common areas
-Do not move furniture
-Lost keys will be charged $25
--If you use more than ONE TOWEL, you will be charged an extra $2
-Long term guest over 28 nights get TWO Towels,  the 3rd will get charged an extra $2
-Do NOT burn or light incense/candles. Besides the danger in this, the odor maybe intolerable to others in the home. Be considerate and use logic please! You will be charged a fee if incense or candle is used. 
-DO NOT TOUCH the thermostat, if you are cold or too hot please let me know and I will adjust the temperature. In particular please be aware the windows should be CLOSED if heater or air conditioner is ON.
-Please turn off lights, radio, computer, etc.. when not in use/and or you leave the room
-Your bathroom is shared, be courteous with time! do not hang out in bathroom for phone use and other non-bathroom activities. Doing laundry in bathroom is NOT permitted, laundry needs to be done in laundry room. If you are a long term guest with a scheduled day for laundry , and you missed your laundry day, please talk to me about rescheduling, or go wash  your laundry at the laundry mat, there are several in the immediate neighborhood. 
-ONLY TOILET PAPER in the TOILET, anything else for example, sanitary napkins, tampons, q- tips, cotton balls, hair balls/shavings please dispense in trash. The toilet will get clogged if anything but toilet paper is flushed into it.  Please do not rinse hair shavings or trim into the sink, it will clog the sing.
-Please clean out your hair from drains.
-No smoking in the home, smoking is permitted in backyard or anywhere outside basically.
-Drinking alcohol is allowed, but I strongly request that you limit you intake and maintain responsibility for your behavior while drinking in my home. This is not a place to party or get crazy drunk.  
-No food or drink allowed in your room, sorry! Only capped bottles of water are allowed. Use kitchen at anytime, but please be mindful of the noise......example: do not use the blender or prepare a 6 course meal at 2am!! no matter how quiet you try to be, we will hear you
-Oven use is ONLY permitted for long -term guest, those staying over 28 days. Short-term guest CANNOT use the oven. Please note that there will be a additional cleaning fee of $50 for oven use regardless how often you use it. Let's talk before you use the oven.
-Please do not leave your food cooking unattended. This is very dangerous, and I do not want my house to burn down!  If you are cooking please stay in the kitchen, If I notice stove or oven ON and you are not in the kitchen, I will turn it off. 
-Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen immediately after use! this includes the sick, stove, counter-tops, table, fridge and floor of kitchen.   Dirty items left on counter-tops or table, brings in hoards of ants and other  unwanted insects.
-Food that is stored in the fridge or cupboards needs to be inside a closed container with a lid, do NOT store open containers or plates of food in fridge, your food will be THROWN OUT! I have glassware you can borrow, but you must buy your own foil or saran warp if that is the way you wish to store your food. Storing your food in an improper manner causes foul odor and a mess, hence this rule!
-Black garbage can is for recycle trash. Metal garbage is for regular trash.
-There is a fee for laundry services, using washer and laundry is two dollars fee per load. please leave the cash in the tin box that is labeled to the right of the washer. Long term guest will have a slightly different fee arrangement. If you want someone to do your laundry for you, I can arrangement that as well with an additional charge.  Let's talk before using the washer and dryer. 
-Long Term guest: anyone staying for twenty eight days or more, are required to pay for extra cleaning service or agree to maintain the cleanliness of their space during their stay. Note the the payment for cleaning with booking is a one time fee that is not substantial if you staying long term.
-NO guest in home that are not part of the reservation. Exception to rule is  if you are a long term guest, staying over twenty eights nights, you may have guest, but no Over-Night guest and I must know their names and purpose of their visit 
-Well behaved pets and children are allowed, but I reiterate "well behaved".  Unfortunately we cannot accommodate your pet if they have anxiety issues, chew/ claw at furniture, are not potty trained or barks/ meows during sleeping hours,   Pets cannot be left unattended and  are not allowed on beds, couches or any furniture. Please note that a Pet fee will be added if you choose to bring your furry friend, this fee is equal to the additional guest price adjustment, please discuss your pet as a second guest with me before booking.  Furry friends must be kept to the bedroom and are not allowed to roam the home. 
-Laundry for your pets needs to be done at outside laundry mat. My washer and dryer cannot handle pet hair/dander. 
-The home is not child proof, please keep a mindful eye on your child and do not let them wander into unattended rooms of the home. We cannot accommodate your child if they cannot sleep through the night,  have bed wetting issues or behavioral problems. I am a parent myself and do apologies for the rules with children and pets but I need to keep the home suitable with low maintenance for future guest
-If you break or damage something, please notify me immediately, I do understand accidents happen, but it is extremely offensive to withhold this information from your host
-Remember this is my home, and NOT a hotel
-Break the rules, you risk the reservation being canceled. which means you will be required to leave.

access:
Please feel free to use the kitchen and front room on the main floor.  If weather permits, feel free to hang out in the backyard.  You may enter and exit through the front door,  there is a backdoor to be used only in case of emergencies. The backdoor may be in use by other guest who have reserved the garden room in the basement, therefore please only use in emergency.
Please remember that the bathroom for this room is a shared bathroom on 2nd floor. The bathroom in the garden room/basement is off limits, do not use the bathroom in basement.
description:
Warm simple 10.5 ft  * 10.5 ft SIZE Room. FULL SIZE BED NEW Beautyrest plush mattress beginning Dec 2017. Bed Sleeps 2 person comfortable, 2nd guest also has option to sleep on Twin Air Mattress or sleeping bag on floor. Possible 3rd guest message me 1st. Ceiling fan, desk, drawers with cabinet. Shared bathroom. LGBTQ  welcomed! There is a PET FEE. Please see house rules!  CHECK OUT MY OTHER LISTING GRAFFITI GARDEN ROOM, which is bigger, more private & sleeps more people! READ ALL HOUSE RULES!

Quiet cozy lavender room in 2nd floor bedroom. Short flight of stairs to your, full size lotus bed with new beautyrest mattress. If 2nd guest, would rather not share your bed space, a twin size air mattress can be placed on floor of room. Be aware if you choose this option, it will be a tight squeeze but it is doable for air mattress, bean bag, sleeping bag on floor. On some nights possible to accommodate a 3rd guest in room next door or in same room, but must discuss first and we will determine if it suits your needs and at that point I will update my list to allow you to book for 3rd person. If we do not discuss first, my listing is only set up to allow 2 person booking.  Floor is vinyl tiles in bedroom and ceramic in kitchen & bathroom.  If you have a pet that will be joining you, please know that this will be priced as a second guest rate. When booking the room please include pet in the number of guest for correct pricing.  Hang in the front room if you like.  Read a book or work at your desk. Eat in the kitchen. Across the hall from shared bathroom. Home is supplied with central heat and air conditioning.
Most artwork, canvas paintings and photography by personal friends or family. If you are offended by artwork that displays nudity, violence, urban decay, sex , drugs, rock & roll or just plain can't stand the sight of a skull, please do not book here.

Please feel free to use the kitchen and front room on the main floor.  If weather permits, feel free to hang out in the backyard.  You may enter and exit through the front door,  there is a backdoor to be used only in case of emergencies. The backdoor may be in use by other guest who have reserved the garden room in the basement, therefore please only use in emergency.
Please remember that the bathroom for this room is a shared bathroom on 2nd floor. The bathroom in the garden room/basement is off limits, do not use the bathroom in basement.

We work and go to school during the weekdays. More flexible with our time on the weekends. Up for a chat, give suggestions for your trip and be available for you, should you have questions but depending on the time and days you will be here, we might hardly see each other.  As much privacy as you desire will be respected and provided. Feel free to call, text or send a message at anytime.

Quiet, clean, working- middle class family oriented neighborhood near public skate park, midway airport, CTA, race track and free abundant parking!
Garfield Ridge/ Vittum park neighborhood located 10 miles from downtown. Just 2 miles from Chicago Midway Airport and 1 mile from I -55/ Stevenson expressway. There is Vittum Chicago public park  2 blocks away with a tennis court, basketball court , children's playground and skating ramp. This is a residential location with ample free parking, perfect if you rent a car. We are down the street from Our Lady of Snows Elementary school and church. I have very active and friendly neighbors, please feel free to say hello and let the neighbor  know that you are a guest of mine should they seemed alarmed about a new face on the block. There are a few local owned bars and fast food places walking distance, but nothing fancy, a little travel is recommended for something more memorable. Polish deli & Puerto Rican cafe are some favorites by guests so far. Walking distance to several CTA bus lines that will take you CTA train. Safe to walk at night, but some buses do not run late evenings near my home. A Ride share service such as Uber or Lyft can get you home from the nearest CTA train station for about Ten dollars. Can also prearrange a ride from me for a cost. Racetrack in Cicero is less than two miles away. Entrance/Exit to Stevenson expressway less than two miles away.

There are four bus routes just a 10 min walk / half a mile away.
#62 bus- Travels East,
 takes you straight into Chinatown and  Downtown, stops at Orange line on the way
#62H bus -travels East and West takes you to midway airport/ Orange line
#47 st bus- travels mostly directly east, all the way to Lakefront , stops at red line on way, short trip West to Orange line/Midway airport at some non peak hours 
#54B Cicero Bus- Travels North and South, takes you to pink line and Orange LINE
The nearest Metra stop is the BNSF Railway in Cicero, Il. Just about 3 miles away.

Although we are avid music lovers, this is a quiet , low volume home due to our busy days, we highly value coming home to a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere, perfect if you want to study or get some work done, guest are encouraged to keep entertainment noise contained to their perspective room, with volume low or use headphones, in particular during the weekdays! The room is up a flight of stairs on 2nd floor.  The 2nd door to the left when you come up the 2nd floor hallway. The room is one of three bedrooms on the floor. So please keep it quiet after 10pm. There is a key to the bedroom, so feel free to lock up your room when you leave. You will have privacy but minimal sound barrier, meaning that noise travels easily through the walls and shut doors.  This maybe an issue if you are a light sleeper or extremely value a sound barrier. There maybe two or three people living in the home at the time of your stay. Weekdays, we get up around 630am and will be busy in the kitchen making some noise with breakfast and getting ready to head out for the day, the home will be silent after 730am when we leave for the day. I promise the noise in kitchen will only last a few minutes. Due to an elementary school being a few doors down, the children playing recess outside can be heard during the day. Other than that, its a pretty quiet home.  
The metal garbage can is for regular trash.
The black garbage can is for recycled trash. 
Everyone in the home is conscious of environmental issues and healthy diets, we recycle what we can, and eat the best that we can but as some would speculate, we are not  all vegetarians please note that there might be meat and non recycle items in the home. 
We are part of the local punk DIY community. Waldorf School, Loyola University of Chicago and Parson School of Design parent resides in the home. Musician and artist reside in the home. LGBTQ friendly. Babysitting, pet sitting, car rides, and laundry service might be available for separate fee, please ask if interested. There is a washer and dryer in the home, please make arrangements with me before using them on your own. There is a limit, set time and fee for washer dryer use. 
If you need additional heat, there will be extra blankets for you to keep warm but please tell me if you are cold or too warm, I will adjust the thermostat, no problem at all, the temperature might differ in each room so I might have no idea that your room is uncomfortable unless you tell me. 
There is a baby sitter and pet sitter for hire in the home, please ask for rates if interested in these services while your here. 
WIFI network: AIRBNB.Rockstar.ON.LaramieAVE
Code: Can be found on side of fridge in kitchen or check desk in your room

It is very rude to have a phone conversation while someone else in the room is preparing their food, eating at the table or simply just wants to chill in the same room.  In particular I ask for Absolutely NO talking on phone in bathroom and NO SPEAKER PHONE conversations in the home. Speaker phone conversation are extremely loud and can be heard through the entire home. 
-The dress code is WEAR CLOTHES IN COMMON AREAS
-Do not leave clothes laying around in the common areas
-Do not move furniture
-Lost keys will be charged $25
--If you use more than ONE TOWEL, you will be charged an extra $2
-Long term guest over 28 nights get TWO Towels,  the 3rd will get charged an extra $2
-Do NOT burn or light incense/candles. Besides the danger in this, the odor maybe intolerable to others in the home. Be considerate and use logic please! You will be charged a fee if incense or candle is used. 
-DO NOT TOUCH the thermostat, if you are cold or too hot please let me know and I will adjust the temperature. In particular please be aware the windows should be CLOSED if heater or air conditioner is ON.
-Please turn off lights, radio, computer, etc.. when not in use/and or you leave the room
-Your bathroom is shared, be courteous with time! do not hang out in bathroom for phone use and other non-bathroom activities. Doing laundry in bathroom is NOT permitted, laundry needs to be done in laundry room. If you are a long term guest with a scheduled day for laundry , and you missed your laundry day, please talk to me about rescheduling, or go wash  your laundry at the laundry mat, there are several in the immediate neighborhood. 
-ONLY TOILET PAPER in the TOILET, anything else for example, sanitary napkins, tampons, q- tips, cotton balls, hair balls/shavings please dispense in trash. The toilet will get clogged if anything but toilet paper is flushed into it.  Please do not rinse hair shavings or trim into the sink, it will clog the sing.
-Please clean out your hair from drains.
-No smoking in the home, smoking is permitted in backyard or anywhere outside basically.
-Drinking alcohol is allowed, but I strongly request that you limit you intake and maintain responsibility for your behavior while drinking in my home. This is not a place to party or get crazy drunk.  
-No food or drink allowed in your room, sorry! Only capped bottles of water are allowed. Use kitchen at anytime, but please be mindful of the noise......example: do not use the blender or prepare a 6 course meal at 2am!! no matter how quiet you try to be, we will hear you
-Oven use is ONLY permitted for long -term guest, those staying over 28 days. Short-term guest CANNOT use the oven. Please note that there will be a additional cleaning fee of $50 for oven use regardless how often you use it. Let's talk before you use the oven.
-Please do not leave your food cooking unattended. This is very dangerous, and I do not want my house to burn down!  If you are cooking please stay in the kitchen, If I notice stove or oven ON and you are not in the kitchen, I will turn it off. 
-Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen immediately after use! this includes the sick, stove, counter-tops, table, fridge and floor of kitchen.   Dirty items left on counter-tops or table, brings in hoards of ants and other  unwanted insects.
-Food that is stored in the fridge or cupboards needs to be inside a closed container with a lid, do NOT store open containers or plates of food in fridge, your food will be THROWN OUT! I have glassware you can borrow, but you must buy your own foil or saran warp if that is the way you wish to store your food. Storing your food in an improper manner causes foul odor and a mess, hence this rule!
-Black garbage can is for recycle trash. Metal garbage is for regular trash.
-There is a fee for laundry services, using washer and laundry is two dollars fee per load. please leave the cash in the tin box that is labeled to the right of the washer. Long term guest will have a slightly different fee arrangement. If you want someone to do your laundry for you, I can arrangement that as well with an additional charge.  Let's talk before using the washer and dryer. 
-Long Term guest: anyone staying for twenty eight days or more, are required to pay for extra cleaning service or agree to maintain the cleanliness of their space during their stay. Note the the payment for cleaning with booking is a one time fee that is not substantial if you staying long term.
-NO guest in home that are not part of the reservation. Exception to rule is  if you are a long term guest, staying over twenty eights nights, you may have guest, but no Over-Night guest and I must know their names and purpose of their visit 
-Well behaved pets and children are allowed, but I reiterate "well behaved".  Unfortunately we cannot accommodate your pet if they have anxiety issues, chew/ claw at furniture, are not potty trained or barks/ meows during sleeping hours,   Pets cannot be left unattended and  are not allowed on beds, couches or any furniture. Please note that a Pet fee will be added if you choose to bring your furry friend, this fee is equal to the additional guest price adjustment, please discuss your pet as a second guest with me before booking.  Furry friends must be kept to the bedroom and are not allowed to roam the home. 
-Laundry for your pets needs to be done at outside laundry mat. My washer and dryer cannot handle pet hair/dander. 
-The home is not child proof, please keep a mindful eye on your child and do not let them wander into unattended rooms of the home. We cannot accommodate your child if they cannot sleep through the night,  have bed wetting issues or behavioral problems. I am a parent myself and do apologies for the rules with children and pets but I need to keep the home suitable with low maintenance for future guest
-If you break or damage something, please notify me immediately, I do understand accidents happen, but it is extremely offensive to withhold this information from your host
-Remember this is my home, and NOT a hotel
-Break the rules, you risk the reservation being canceled. which means you will be required to leave.
interaction: We work and go to school during the weekdays. More flexible with our time on the weekends. Up for a chat, give suggestions for your trip and be available for you, should you have questions but depending on the time and days you will be here, we might hardly see each other.  As much privacy as you desire will be respected and provided. Feel free to call, text or send a message at anytime.
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet, clean, working- middle class family oriented neighborhood near public skate park, midway airport, CTA, race track and free abundant parking!
Garfield Ridge/ Vittum park neighborhood located 10 miles from downtown. Just 2 miles from Chicago Midway Airport and 1 mile from I -55/ Stevenson expressway. There is Vittum Chicago public park  2 blocks away with a tennis court, basketball court , children's playground and skating ramp. This is a residential location with ample free parking, perfect if you rent a car. We are down the street from Our Lady of Snows Elementary school and church. I have very active and friendly neighbors, please feel free to say hello and let the neighbor  know that you are a guest of mine should they seemed alarmed about a new face on the block. There are a few local owned bars and fast food places walking distance, but nothing fancy, a little travel is recommended for something more memorable. Polish deli & Puerto Rican cafe are some favorites by guests so far. Walking distance to several CTA bus lines that will take you CTA train. Safe to walk at night, but some buses do not run late evenings near my home. A Ride share service such as Uber or Lyft can get you home from the nearest CTA train station for about Ten dollars. Can also prearrange a ride from me for a cost. Racetrack in Cicero is less than two miles away. Entrance/Exit to Stevenson expressway less than two miles away.
notes:
Although we are avid music lovers, this is a quiet , low volume home due to our busy days, we highly value coming home to a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere, perfect if you want to study or get some work done, guest are encouraged to keep entertainment noise contained to their perspective room, with volume low or use headphones, in particular during the weekdays! The room is up a flight of stairs on 2nd floor.  The 2nd door to the left when you come up the 2nd floor hallway. The room is one of three bedrooms on the floor. So please keep it quiet after 10pm. There is a key to the bedroom, so feel free to lock up your room when you leave. You will have privacy but minimal sound barrier, meaning that noise travels easily through the walls and shut doors.  This maybe an issue if you are a light sleeper or extremely value a sound barrier. There maybe two or three people living in the home at the time of your stay. Weekdays, we get up around 630am and will be busy in the kitchen making some noise with breakfast and getting ready to head out for the day, the home will be silent after 730am when we leave for the day. I promise the noise in kitchen will only last a few minutes. Due to an elementary school being a few doors down, the children playing recess outside can be heard during the day. Other than that, its a pretty quiet home.  
The metal garbage can is for regular trash.
The black garbage can is for recycled trash. 
Everyone in the home is conscious of environmental issues and healthy diets, we recycle what we can, and eat the best that we can but as some would speculate, we are not  all vegetarians please note that there might be meat and non recycle items in the home. 
We are part of the local punk DIY community. Waldorf School, Loyola University of Chicago and Parson School of Design parent resides in the home. Musician and artist reside in the home. LGBTQ friendly. Babysitting, pet sitting, car rides, and laundry service might be available for separate fee, please ask if interested. There is a washer and dryer in the home, please make arrangements with me before using them on your own. There is a limit, set time and fee for washer dryer use. 
If you need additional heat, there will be extra blankets for you to keep warm but please tell me if you are cold or too warm, I will adjust the thermostat, no problem at all, the temperature might differ in each room so I might have no idea that your room is uncomfortable unless you tell me. 
There is a baby sitter and pet sitter for hire in the home, please ask for rates if interested in these services while your here. 
WIFI network: AIRBNB.Rockstar.ON.LaramieAVE
Code: Can be found on side of fridge in kitchen or check desk in your room
space:
Quiet cozy lavender room in 2nd floor bedroom. Short flight of stairs to your, full size lotus bed with new beautyrest mattress. If 2nd guest, would rather not share your bed space, a twin size air mattress can be placed on floor of room. Be aware if you choose this option, it will be a tight squeeze but it is doable for air mattress, bean bag, sleeping bag on floor. On some nights possible to accommodate a 3rd guest in room next door or in same room, but must discuss first and we will determine if it suits your needs and at that point I will update my list to allow you to book for 3rd person. If we do not discuss first, my listing is only set up to allow 2 person booking.  Floor is vinyl tiles in bedroom and ceramic in kitchen & bathroom.  If you have a pet that will be joining you, please know that this will be priced as a second guest rate. When booking the room please include pet in the number of guest for correct pricing.  Hang in the front room if you like.  Read a book or work at your desk. Eat in the kitchen. Across the hall from shared bathroom. Home is supplied with central heat and air conditioning.
Most artwork, canvas paintings and photography by personal friends or family. If you are offended by artwork that displays nudity, violence, urban decay, sex , drugs, rock & roll or just plain can't stand the sight of a skull, please do not book here.
summary: Warm simple 10.5 ft  * 10.5 ft SIZE Room. FULL SIZE BED NEW Beautyrest plush mattress beginning Dec 2017. Bed Sleeps 2 person comfortable, 2nd guest also has option to sleep on Twin Air Mattress or sleeping bag on floor. Possible 3rd guest message me 1st. Ceiling fan, desk, drawers with cabinet. Shared bathroom. LGBTQ  welcomed! There is a PET FEE. Please see house rules!  CHECK OUT MY OTHER LISTING GRAFFITI GARDEN ROOM, which is bigger, more private & sleeps more people! READ ALL HOUSE RULES!
transit:
There are four bus routes just a 10 min walk / half a mile away.
#62 bus- Travels East,
 takes you straight into Chinatown and  Downtown, stops at Orange line on the way
#62H bus -travels East and West takes you to midway airport/ Orange line
#47 st bus- travels mostly directly east, all the way to Lakefront , stops at red line on way, short trip West to Orange line/Midway airport at some non peak hours 
#54B Cicero Bus- Travels North and South, takes you to pink line and Orange LINE
The nearest Metra stop is the BNSF Railway in Cicero, Il. Just about 3 miles away.

access: You'll have a bedroom with a futon (bed), a bathroom, and kitchen. Smart TV offers Netflix and local broadcasts, WIFI available too.
description:
Cozy, clean, and artsy one bedroom/studio! You'll have the entire place. We are offering a bright and sunny garden apartment in the multi unit flat we live in! The neighborhood is a beautiful, tree-lined street with a boulevard and plenty of families! We live a few minutes away from several grocery and department shops including Walmart, Tony's, and Ross. A nine minute bus ride will take you to the Blue Line, that runs from O'Hare to downtown! Perfect for travelers!

You'll have a bedroom with a futon (bed), a bathroom, and kitchen. Smart TV offers Netflix and local broadcasts, WIFI available too.

We live on a unique tree lined boulevard in a family friendly neighborhood that boarders Hermosa and Avondale.

You can catch the number 77 Belmont bus steps away from the house. That bus can take you to the blue line train within 10 mins. The train can take you to O'hare, downtown, and all over the city.

This is a garden apt with slightly lower ceilings than your average apt. It is good note for those that are at 6'5 or taller in height.

access: Garage, mudroom, hallway, two bedroom suite and full bath on second floor.  At breakfast time, kitchen will be available for coffee and tea.
description:
Two Bedroom Suite with Ensuite Bath. Lots of windows. Perfect for small family. Wifi is included! Location is PERFECT- close to Beach, Town and Train- and a short shuttle to Ravinia Festival. Friendly hosts own a small poodle and two cats!

Two Corner Bedrooms in this Luxury Home, features automatic shades, hardwood floors, comfortable beds and bedding. Ensuite Private bath has a double sink marble vanity, tiled shower over tub with glass doors, skylight, and a private toilet closet. One bedroom has a Queen size bed and one bedroom has a fullsize (double) bed. Wifi included.

Garage, mudroom, hallway, two bedroom suite and full bath on second floor.  At breakfast time, kitchen will be available for coffee and tea.

We are generally available as we live in the house and are currerntly "empty nesters".

Highland Park is one of the top North Shore suburbs of Chicago - with ready access to Lake Michigan, Ravinia Festival, Chicago Botanic Gardens, and great downtown shopping.

We are walking distance to the Metra Train and CTA Buses, and a Shuttle to Ravinia operates from the Highland Park Train Station Parking Lot. Also, easy walk to Green Bay Trail, and Lake Michigan, easy highway access to Routes 41 and 94. Parking for one car is included. Additional parking upon request for extra charge.

Please make sure to remove your shoes upon entry to our home and going upstairs. A bench is provided for you to easily put on or take iff your shoes. A refrigerator is available in the garage for your use. Please label your items with your name and remove or discard them before checkout.

additional_house_rules:
We completely renovated the nearly 100 year old building in 2014. All new plumbing, water service, mechanicals, floors, new bath rooms with huge walk in shower and fully appointed kitchen with new appliances, Kuerig coffee maker (a wide selection of k coup coffee and tea bags), toaster (we provide the bread and muffins)  etc. So everything works.  
Regarding our old building: You will hear the tenants downstairs moving around and they will hear you if you have the TV or music turned up or if you have loud voices or stomp around. Please moderate your sound, including your footsteps, so that we minimize disturbing the neighbors, especially after 10pm.

We welcome families with children, however we do not rent to individuals or groups under the age of 21.
 
No drugs, no smoking.  If you smoke, there is a $500 cleaning fee. If you do drugs? We will ask you to leave. 

Pets may be allowed if we discuss it beforehand.
 If you bring a pet, we require a $250 security deposit for the pet, in addition to the regular deposit.

If anything isn’t working, please contact Jeffrey immediately. Text message is probably best. Reach out if you need anything for the apartment or you just want  advice on where to go and what to do.

Checking in and out
We will provide instructions in advance of your stay. If you need to make special arrangements please contact Jeffrey.
We ask that you not use the rear access except to empty waste cans if that is necessary.

Equipment
There is a manual inside the "book" box on the coffee table with instructions for the printer/scanner, TV, DVD, coffee maker, dishwasher, washer and dryer and HVAC.

No candles.
Use the coasters, trivets and placemats to protect the furniture.
If you have a small child  who is still in diapers traveling with you, please take any soiled ones to the garbage cans in the backyard next to the alley ASAP (before you leave for the day). Do not leave them in the trash.

No parties. No drugs. Clean up after yourself. Basic grown up behavior.
House cleaning is every Monday at 8am. Guest must leave the premises for at least 2 hours. . 
No food of any kind is to be stored in your room. 
No guests are allowed to stay in your room over night. 
All guests must check in with the host.

access:
Premium on-demand cable tv, Amazon Prime & Netflix
Fully appointed kitchen with dish washer & washer/dryer
Super fast Wi-Fi

Guests have full access to the kitchen and living areas.   But you do not have access to the 4th bedroom/back office. I work there, on weekdays, and I will generally be gone from the rest of the flat at other times.
This listing is for the front Bunkbed bedroom. 
However, the apartment is fully furnished for a large family, with a twin daybed in one room, queen bed in another for when my kids come to stay. If you want the whole place we can make it available in between their visits. It is listed on AirBnB as "Mayfair 3BR"
If you want a completely separate space, I have a 2 bedroom, 1 bath garden apartment in the same building listed on AirBnb as "Mayfair 2 BR I94/90/BlueLine"
description:
One of four spacious bedrooms that is available every other weekend. My boys sleep in these bunk beds when they are staying with me.

It's cozy and affordable and only available every other weekend.
A pair of rustic twin sized bunk beds, are all yours in this spacious 3rd floor walk up (no elevator) in a huge, sunny 4 bedroom apartment with 1.5 bath. Totally gut-rehabbed in 2014.  You will have the front  bedroom. You are welcome to use the fully equipped kitchen; just clean up after yourself. You will enjoy super fast Wi-Fi internet, premium cable TV/Netflix/Amazon and a 50 inch smart TV. Please check the map before you book. This is great access to freeway and close to O'Hare and short drive to hot spots downtown, even closer to Bucktown, Wicker Park, really close to Logan Square but NOT walking distance to much.

Premium on-demand cable tv, Amazon Prime & Netflix
Fully appointed kitchen with dish washer & washer/dryer
Super fast Wi-Fi

Guests have full access to the kitchen and living areas.   But you do not have access to the 4th bedroom/back office. I work there, on weekdays, and I will generally be gone from the rest of the flat at other times.
This listing is for the front Bunkbed bedroom. 
However, the apartment is fully furnished for a large family, with a twin daybed in one room, queen bed in another for when my kids come to stay. If you want the whole place we can make it available in between their visits. It is listed on AirBnB as "Mayfair 3BR"
If you want a completely separate space, I have a 2 bedroom, 1 bath garden apartment in the same building listed on AirBnb as "Mayfair 2 BR I94/90/BlueLine"

Not often in person but constantly vie text & mobile
You can call or text me pretty much any time if you have any questions or need anything at all. 
I work from home, and I live in the unit.  You will have access to the living and dining area, and both full and half bathrooms, along with the kitchen, but not to the fourth bedroom/office at the very back of the building, where I will work on weekdays, and where I may sleep. I'm often gone in evenings overnight. I won't get in your way, and am rarely around when guests stay, but close by if you need me. 
I am happy to act as a host and provide tips on where to go and what to see, or to just leave you on your own.

It's green and shaded. Located down the street from a 2.5 acre park—Mayfair. And it's really quiet with friendly neighbors. Beautiful tree lined streets with lots of kids and people walking their pets. 
Many of our neighbors have lived here for over 30 years and now their children are moving back. You will see bungalows being remodeled with a second story addition, and tear-downs getting replaced with big houses. Within a few blocks there are an amazing and diverse number of churches, temples and mosques. Plenty of groceries, pharmacies, restaurants and entertainment half a mile or so away, but this is more of a residential neighborhood, not the kinetic pace of the urban/mixed use neighborhoods closer in.
Four blocks from Mayfair Park.  Nearby are Independence Park (accessible on the Blue Line at Irving Park) and Portage Park (2 miles west and south from here and also on Irving Park Boulevard),  both of which run great farmer's markets on several Sundays through October.

There is a great sports bar two blocks away and several pubs and a well known Karaoke place. 
And three blocks away is a famous burger stand and soft serve joint (Susie's) that's open 24 hours! 
Great Middle Eastern restaurant a few blocks away. And I order pizza all the time from Saparinos. 
We have a guide to our favorites in the "book" box on the coffee table.
If you really want to experience the "foodie" part of Chicago, it's a short drive or L train to Logan Square, or Armitage & Western or to North Ave & Damen, where you can find several hundred restaurants and bars. Then come home to peace and quiet in my hood.
Independence Park (accessible on the Blue Line at Irving Park) and Portage Park (2 miles west and south from here and also on Irving Park Boulevard),  both of which run great farmer's markets on several Sundays through (website hidden) to Irving Park, Mayfair and Chicago

Dining Out Nearby
Susie’s, one of the city’s famous burger joints is nearby at 4126 West Montrose. (Killer cheese fries.) It is open 24 hours a day.

BP gas station at  Montrose & Pulaski: Pizza and Dunkin Donuts during business hours. Open 24 hours for snacks or petrol.  A good spot for late night Ben & Jerry's.

Marie’s Pizza & Liquors, 4127 W Lawrence Ave a couple of blocks west of Pulaski

Sarpino’s Pizzeria, 4830 North Pulaski,  just north of Lawrence. Delivery.

Ay Ay Picante, Peruvian Restaurant, 4569 North Elston

Ruby’s Fast Food, cash only Filipino Restaurant, 3740 West Montrose

Zebda,4344 North Elston Moroccan take out

Bread and Wine 3732 West Irving Park . One of our favorite places, owned by friends. Go for weekend brunch or any night except Monday.  3734 West Irving.

Community Tavern 4038 North Milwaukee, at the famous 6 corners of Irving Park, Cicero, and Milwaukee. A steakhouse with a French flavor.

Guey Lon Restaurant, an old fashioned neighborhood Chinese restaurant. A long time participant in Taste of Chicago.

#1 Chop Suey 4307 W Irving Park, between Kildare and Lowell

McNamara’s Restaurant is a great place for a pub lunch or brunch 4238 West Irving Park, music on Saturday nights.

Sabatino’s is one of the oldest Italian restaurants  in the city and very well thought of 4441 West Irving Park

 For finer dining, and pretty close, try  The Portage, 3938 North Central. A  fancy gastropub with duck fat fries, a kind of fusion menu, and serious drinks

Smoque BBQ, 3800 North Pulaski, is fabulous and gets really crowded. You can order it and pick up or eat there.

Chicago Pizza and Pasta, 4520 West Irving Park, is a good option for carry out or delivery

Honey Butter Fried Chicken, 3361 North Elston a bit of a drive, but to die for chicken, great sides, and an outdoor patio bar.  Open Wednesday thru Sunday. 

Provisions and Eating In
We have provided some power bars, on the kitchen counter in the red woven ceramic dish, and some snacks (popcorn, nuts, cheddar goldfish) in the oval dish to the right of the sink, and extras in packages in the cabinet above the stove. 

The closest place for stocking up on basic food is Cuenta 4229 West Montrose, just about 3 blocks from here. Go south to Montrose and then east.  They sell milk, eggs, and a few other staples, and they cook and serve South American food. Mostly they are a bakery.

Nick Pantry at the corner of Elston and Montrose has a larger selection, again mostly staples, beverages, ice cream, etc. 

For a better grocery selection go to  Mayfair Market at the corner of Lawrence and Pulaski, or better yet
Tony’s  Finer Food at  4137 North Elston, south from the corner of Montrose and Elston several blocks
or 
7-11 at  Elston and Lawrence.

One of the best fish markets in the city is The Fish Guy at 4423 North Elston just a few doors north of Montrose. In addition to fresh fish they have some prepared items and a small dining area. Wonderful place!

Lalich Deli, at 4208 West Lawrence  is a Serbian place for smoked meats and sausage,

Mariano’s market is 1.6 miles from here at 5353 North Elston, and they have a great take out selection, as well as more typical groceries.  

Blue line: Montrose stop (6 blocks away)
Bus: 78 Montrose (2 blocks south)
Brown Line (over a mile away).

Really easy actually. It's about a 10  minute walk, with luggage,  to the Blue Line which goes to the Loop in 25 min or outbound to O'Hare in about 20. 
The Montrose bus is two blocks away and a 25 min ride to the beachfront at Lake Michigan or to the Brown Line. 
The Lawrence Ave bus is a few blocks north and travels east about a mile to the Brown Line (or all the way to the lakefront, too). Brown Line goes to the Loop and stops a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue as well, with stops along the way at DePaul or Lincoln Park or Old Town.
You can transfer to the Red Line from the Brown Line at Belmont or Fullerton and go to the Apple Store Lincoln Park or keep going  and get off at Grand to walk over to North Michigan Avenue or on to State Street and all that provides.

If you are traveling by car, your GPS will find us easily.

We got a Labrador puppy last year. Cassius. He’s 1 year now in 2019. Super friendly. Horrible guard dog. Loves all people. Sleeps in the way back porch. Never in anyone’s room, unless you invite him. 

$250 fee if you don’t return the keys
house_rules:
We completely renovated the nearly 100 year old building in 2014. All new plumbing, water service, mechanicals, floors, new bath rooms with huge walk in shower and fully appointed kitchen with new appliances, Kuerig coffee maker (a wide selection of k coup coffee and tea bags), toaster (we provide the bread and muffins)  etc. So everything works.  
Regarding our old building: You will hear the tenants downstairs moving around and they will hear you if you have the TV or music turned up or if you have loud voices or stomp around. Please moderate your sound, including your footsteps, so that we minimize disturbing the neighbors, especially after 10pm.

We welcome families with children, however we do not rent to individuals or groups under the age of 21.
 
No drugs, no smoking.  If you smoke, there is a $500 cleaning fee. If you do drugs? We will ask you to leave. 

Pets may be allowed if we discuss it beforehand.
 If you bring a pet, we require a $250 security deposit for the pet, in addition to the regular deposit.

If anything isn’t working, please contact Jeffrey immediately. Text message is probably best. Reach out if you need anything for the apartment or you just want  advice on where to go and what to do.

Checking in and out
We will provide instructions in advance of your stay. If you need to make special arrangements please contact Jeffrey.
We ask that you not use the rear access except to empty waste cans if that is necessary.

Equipment
There is a manual inside the "book" box on the coffee table with instructions for the printer/scanner, TV, DVD, coffee maker, dishwasher, washer and dryer and HVAC.

No candles.
Use the coasters, trivets and placemats to protect the furniture.
If you have a small child  who is still in diapers traveling with you, please take any soiled ones to the garbage cans in the backyard next to the alley ASAP (before you leave for the day). Do not leave them in the trash.

No parties. No drugs. Clean up after yourself. Basic grown up behavior.
House cleaning is every Monday at 8am. Guest must leave the premises for at least 2 hours. . 
No food of any kind is to be stored in your room. 
No guests are allowed to stay in your room over night. 
All guests must check in with the host. 

Basically, we just ask that you treat the apartment well, and have a great stay. And we hope that you will want to come back again.
Small crated dogs are allowed as we stated. There is an additional $250 deposit required, plus $30 per night.

access: Anything in the apartment can be used by guests.
description:
Small cute and cozy guest suite with separate entrance from the alley where parking spots are.  Our home is right near United Center just few minutes away from west loop where many restaurants, cafes and bars are and about 8 minutes away from south loop, the heart of city.

Our home has a guest suite that is attached to the rest of the house with a separate entrance from the alley. We have a extra parking spot for guests that need parking, please just ask for it. Our home is secured with ADT and has a siren system;  guest suite also has a door sensor and a glass break detector. Our guest suite is a cozy small studio that has a bed, closet, sofa, tv, table, dinnerware, small refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster and a full bathroom. Anything in the suite can be used by guests. Any special requests can be made through messaging. I am available through text messages at any time, we also live in the attached home so if there are any problems that occur during stay we can help right away.

Anything in the apartment can be used by guests.

We live in the attached home which makes us available at all times. I am also very easy to reach via text messaging. We tried to do our best with any special requests.

5 minute walking distance to United Center
15 minute walking distance to west loop
8 minute drive to south loop
10 - 15  minute drive to gold coast
15 minute drive to Navy Pier
10 minute drive to Art Museum / Michigan Ave 
10 minute drive to Millennium Park 
15 minute drive to North Ave beach

Walking distance to west loop
Can easily get to Michigan Ave / South loop using bikes/scooters. Usually uber gets to our home in 1-3 minutes when requested.

No parties
No smoking
No extra guests if not stated on Airbnb

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.
1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty.
3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance.
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.

access: You will have access to the entire unit
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

Welcome! A stylish 2-bedroom condo designed to be your home base in Chicago awaits! You will be staying in a hip and modern Chicago neighborhood, surrounded by renowned restaurants, bars and shopping. Only 15min from downtown (“The Loop”). Great for couples, families, a group of friends, solo or business. You will be steps away from exciting North Ave, in a rear-facing first floor unit. Walk Score 97 ("Walker's Paradise")!

* 2 beds + 1 sofabed with room for a total of 6 people
* 1st bedroom includes Queen bed, closet and mirror
* 2nd bedroom includes Queen bed & closet
* Living room with comfy couch and chairs to enjoy during the day. 
* By night the sofa converts into a pull out bed
* AppleTV with Netflix
* Washer/Dryer in unit
* Complimentary high-speed wireless internet
* Bathroom stocked with hair dryer, toiletries, and plenty of fresh towels
* Private secure entrance with self-checkin lockbox 
* Kitchen with coffee maker, and serveware
* FREE street parking.

You will have access to the entire unit

We will not be on site during your stay, but consider us your concierge that's just a message away! We will be happy to provide restaurant and activity recommendations and answer any questions that come up during your stay.

Wicker Park is HOT! One of Chicago's creative epicenters conveniently located just outside downtown. Famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park is known for palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour.

Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues ("the six corners"), you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up shop to satisfy the on-trend crowds.

Walk to absolutely everything!  Divvy Bike Station, the CTA Blue Line, the 606 recreational trail, The "six corners" filled with restaurants, shopping and nightlife. Several more highly regarded restaurants, cafes and bars just outside your door. 8 minutes to the Damen stop of the CTA blue line which can get you downtown in 15 minutes and to O'Hare airport in just 30 minutes. Wide Lyft/Uber coverage gets you anywhere fast. 
The North Avenue bus runs East/West and stops just steps from the building.

NOTE: FREE street parking. Free overnight on both North Avenue and Paulina. Metered during the day on North.

description:
This is a new listing from experienced Airbnb hosts. Check out our other reviews! Stay in a beautifully preserved 19th century building on Lincoln Park's historic Armitage Avenue. Countless food/shopping options! We're next to a CTA train stop, so getting around Chicago couldn't be easier! Very spacious master bedroom in 2 bedroom apartment (the other bedroom in the apartment is also available on Airbnb).

THIS TROVE HAS

✔ Queen-size bed
✔ Turkish cotton bath and hand towels
✔ 50" HDTV w/ Netflix (no cable TV)
✔ Keurig coffee maker
✔ Body wash and shampoo
✔ Iron and ironing board

--and more!

PLEASE NOTE: this room is adjacent to the "L" train tracks. This means you will hear train noise regularly in the apartment and your room. 

EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS

During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower.  Included with your membership:

✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars
✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan
✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck

Metropolitan Club Hours:

Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm
Saturday: 5pm – 10pm
Sunday: Closed

HAVE A QUESTION?

Check out the “Other Things to Note” section of this listing for the answers to my most frequently asked questions.

WHY STAY WITH TROVE?

⭐ Fast Communication
We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes.

⭐ Experienced Hosts
We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years.

⭐ Exclusive Perks
Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower.

⭐ Easy Self-Check-In
Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay!

⭐ Central Location
You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.

We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Armitage Brown Line 'L' train station is next door.
→ O'Hare is 50 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?”

Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're adjacent to the Armitage 'L' train station. Search for “Armitage Brown Line station Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest.

2. “Is there parking nearby?”

Parking in Chicago is often difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using a service called SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a nearby paid parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding parking when you arrive.

3. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room.

Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest.

4. “Can a third person stay in the room with me?”

We allow a maximum of two guests per room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more than two people. Send us a message for more info.

5. Will I have my own private bathroom?

The bathroom is shared with the other bedrooms.

summary: This is a new listing from experienced Airbnb hosts. Check out our other reviews! Stay in a beautifully preserved 19th century building on Lincoln Park's historic Armitage Avenue. Countless food/shopping options! We're next to a CTA train stop, so getting around Chicago couldn't be easier! Very spacious master bedroom in 2 bedroom apartment (the other bedroom in the apartment is also available on Airbnb).
transit:
Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Armitage Brown Line 'L' train station is next door.
→ O'Hare is 50 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

description:
BEST LOCATION! This lovely 1 bedroom apartment is located in the heart of Oak Park right on Oak Park Ave! This unit has a beautiful view of Oak Park Ave that overlooks historic architecture and wonderful restaurants, shops, and more! It has a great deal of space with plenty of room to house 3 people comfortably. Located right by the CTA Green Line(1 minute walk) with a 20 minute train ride to The Loop.
-Queen sized bed  
-Full Kitchen/ Living Room
-1 Full Bathroom  
-Laundry 
-Wifi and Cable TV

This 2nd floor apartment is located inside a freshly renovated historic Oak Park Building. New everything! It has a fantastic historic appearance on the outside with a lovely new and modern look on the inside. The apartment has just been furnished will all new appliances and furniture. No expenses have been spared in order to provide a welcoming and cozy experience for our guests! 
Disclaimer: 
-The only access to this apartment is through stairs. Not recommended for those who struggle to climb more than two stories. 
-There is no parking included for this apartment. The most convenient place to park will be in the parking garage across the street.
house_rules: Please be respectful of other tenants in the building please and thank you!

description:
• Luxury private room located In the heart of Uptown/Wrigleyville
• 24 hour Serviced apartment with hostess living in the first floor to help you with any request
• Complimentary quality Coffee & Tea
• Superfast Wifi (250-350 MB/sec)
• 4K HDTV + Roku + YouTube TV
• Fully equipped, stocked, amazing kitchen
• 4 private parking spaces
• High Chair + Play pen for babies 
• Bunch of table games
• Brand new Laundry machine and Drier
• Before leaving this page, check out the photos, please! ;) Peace!

This is a private room in a 3BR newly remodeled and renovated apartment(August 2019). Restaurants, shops, bars, Aragon ball room and Wrigley Field, Montrose beach are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 15-minute train ride away via the adjacent Argyle Red Line station. EXCELLENT for medical students or patients who visit WEISS MEMORIAL HOSPITAL.

Additional amenities and information:

• Hostess living in the building. Ready to help and support with any requests 24/7
• 3 Queen Size Beds, 1 Queen Size Sofa Bed 
• Laundry in the building 
• A/C + Heat (Nest Smart Thermostate)
• Custom furnishing 
• Keurig coffee machine and Keurig pods
• Around 40 Twinning tea types for your taste
• VonShef Egg cooker
• High Chair for kids
• Play Pen for kids
• Iron + Steamer for clothes
• Shampoo + Conditioner + Soap
• Toothbrush(individual) + Toothpaste(individual)
• Small one time use cotton hand towels(individual)
• Black&Decker Hand vacuum cleaner
• Professional First Aid Kit
• Black&Decker 4-slice toaster
• Wine Glasses + Wine opener
• Hamilton Beach Wave Crusher Blender
• Arctic Chill ice cube trays
• Revlon Volumizing hair dryer
• Cuisinart set of Stainless steel knives + steak knives
• Mixology Bartender Kit
• Epicure battery operated Salt and Pepper Grinder set + Himalayan pink salt
• Ceramic knife set
• Sewing kit
• Phillips 4K HDTV + YoutubeTV + Roku TV + Pluto TV(free movies)

Dear guest,

If You wish to stay in our place but the date You're looking for is gone in calendar, You could still check for the other rooms. Don't forget that we have 6 rooms available for our dear guests within our premises. Please check out the links below for the other rooms:

1. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/38132264
2. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/38080914
3. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/38101368
4. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/37977237
5. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/37949860
6. https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/38082581

description:
4 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo
Extra bedding options (air mattress and roll-out)
Ideal for groups of 4-8 people
Netflix 
Patio
Just blocks from the beach & lakefront path
Mix of and vintage furniture makes for shabby-chic, yet modern feel
Close to Hyde Park, University of Chicago, LaRabida Children's Hospital, Museum of Science & Industry, Local Market (grocery store,) Lake Shore Drive for easy access to Downtown Chicago.

If you've got a group of 4-8 folks, this space is perfect! Easy access to many awesome attractions and amenities make this condo ideal. You can relax for a "staycation" type feel or "touch and go" here for an activity-packed trip to Chicago. Either way, you'll enjoy the space along with the comfort and ideal location.

Guests can use the entire 4 bedroom apartment.

I’m available by app or phone.

Ideally-located spot for those wanting easy access to Chicago's beaches, LakeShore Drive, Hyde Park, Museum of Science & Industry, downtown and more.

Uber, Lyft and public transportation comes here frequently.

description:
Our renovated 3BR apartment is a great space for you and your family, friends or business colleagues.  Within walking distance to Roosevelt red line subway station you will be able to explore all the city. The bedrooms offers queen size beds and closets. We will provide you with fresh towels, shampoo, conditioner, body soap and more for you to use in the two bathrooms. Kitchen is fully equipped with everything you might need to cook your breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Located close to the best of Chicago, the apartment is equipped with:

Full kitchen:
- refrigerator
- stove
- oven
- microwave
- electric kettle
- electric kettle
- coffee machine
- dinner table
- all kitchen utensils: dishes, glasses, cutlery, pots and pans.

Private bathrooms:
- free toiletries (shampoo, body soap, conditioner)
- hair dryer
- large towels

Comfortable 3 bedrooms:
- queen size beds
- bed linens
- blankets
- pillows
- closets

Living room:
- comfortable sofa
- Big flat screen TV with Netflix

And to guarantee you’re gonna have a nice stay, we offer Wi-Fi high-speed in all property, besides air conditioning and heater.
All the comfort and structure you need to have an unforgettable trip.

Acesso dos hóspedes
Guests will have access to the entire apartment and the following will be accessible:
• Flat-screen TV with Netflix
• High-speed Wi-Fi 
• Air conditioning in summer and adequate heating in winter
• Sheets, clean blankets and fresh towels
• All bathroom and kitchen amenities
• The apartment professionally decorated and cleaned in full after each guest

Guests have access to all the space and to the gym available at the building.

We are always accessible on the Airbnb platform. If you have any type of doubt like: availability, apartment`s details, please do not hesitate to send us a message, I will be more than happy in solve it.

The keys will be delivered during check-in, at the meeting points previously agreed with guests, and then the apartment will be presented to the same as well as all the necessary information

access: You are welcome to any part of the apartment except our bedroom. Feel free to cook, work at my desk or the dining table, or watch a movie on the couch. Just please note I do work from home, so if you are here on a weekday, I will need general quiet from 9-5.
description:
Welcome to our treehouse apartment! Located on the third floor, our spacious and sunny Andersonville home is a five minute walk from the many shops and restaurants on Clark and has free street parking. We're happy to go over must-see spots and restaurants and let you know the best way to get around. If you let her, our dog Lea will be your best friend during your stay; she loves making new friends!

We look forward to hosting you!
Chelsea and Jason

We're located in Andersonville, a traditionally Swedish neighborhood that is full of antique shops, coffee houses, boutiques, an independent bookstore, and many restaurants. (Really, we have everything - Italian, Irish, Swedish, Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, Mexican, Japanese, lots of spots to grab a cocktail... you get the idea.)

Our apartment is located a five-minute walk from near the top of Andersonville. The building has retained a lot of the old Chicago character, with a big bay window in the living room and a brick fireplace (non-working). While we are very close to the heart of Andersonville, being just two blocks away and on the third floor means it's generally very quiet and peaceful. In the early morning, sunlight floods the living and dining rooms, and in spring, we generally wake up to birdsong. Essentially, it's gorgeous and green in summer, yellow and orange in fall, and when it snows in the winter, the snow sitting on the tree branches is gorgeous.

Please note that Jason and I do have a dog. She's super sweet, eight-years-old, and absolutely loves having visitors. She's not very big (about 35 lbs.), doesn't bark, and doesn't jump. Please note that she does shed (we clean frequently though, not to worry!), so if you have allergies this probably isn't the place for you. We will provide you with a lint roller during your stay.

You are welcome to any part of the apartment except our bedroom. Feel free to cook, work at my desk or the dining table, or watch a movie on the couch. Just please note I do work from home, so if you are here on a weekday, I will need general quiet from 9-5.

Andersonville is an historically Swedish neighborhood full of restaurants. In our neighborhood (mainly on Clark Street) you will find:

- One of the best burgers in Chicago at Little Bad Wolf
- Amazing sushi at Tanoshii (Also try their udon noodle soup!)
- One of the best Italian dinners of your life at Anteprima
- Coffee at Coffee Studio, La Colombe, Colective, or Kopi
- Fantastic brunch at M. Henry or The Bongo Room
- A summertime patio perfect for a drink at HopLeaf
- Truly phenomenal pie at First Slice Cafe

Wonderful shops you'll find include a lot of antique stores and furniture stores. Also included on the strip is the Swedish American Museum and Women and Children First bookstore.

If you venture through the beautiful residential neighborhood to the train (Bryn Mawr stop), you'll have even more fantastic food options. Our favorites are:
- Ben's Noodles and Rice for the most amazing pineapple fried rice for $10
- The best croissants in Chicago at Phlour
- Amazing and comforting Pho Ga (for those who are unfamiliar, it's essentially Vietnamese chicken noodle soup) at Little Vietnam

- There is free parking on and around my block. Parking is very easy; we have rarely needed to park as far as the opposite end of the block.
- You can catch the 22 bus east two blocks from our apartment to downtown and Wrigley Field. Note that you must either have a transit card or cash to board. Bus rides are $2.25 cash and they do not give change.

- The 24-hour Red Line train is a lovely .8 mile walk and will take you directly downtown. Train tickets are $3 for a single ride.  

(Insider's note- If you buy a card, it's only $0.25 to transfer from one mode of transportation to the other if you transfer within 2 hours of your original boarding time. But if you plan on riding a lot while you're here, just get a 3-day pass.)

For the amenities please note:

- To keep down on clutter, the straightener, hair dryer, and ironing board are put away. If you need them, please let us know and we are happy to get them for you. 

- Shower soap, shampoo, and conditioner are located in the shower.

- Our coffee machine is a French press (we also have a kettle). Please note we do not provide coffee.

Essentially, it's gorgeous and green in summer, yellow and orange in fall, and when it snows in the winter, the snow sitting on the tree branches is gorgeous.

Please note that Jason and I do have a dog. She's super sweet, eight-years-old, and absolutely loves having visitors. She's not very big (about 35 lbs.), doesn't bark, and doesn't jump. Please note that she does shed (we clean frequently though, not to worry!), so if you have allergies this probably isn't the place for you. We will provide you with a lint roller during your stay.
summary:
Welcome to our treehouse apartment! Located on the third floor, our spacious and sunny Andersonville home is a five minute walk from the many shops and restaurants on Clark and has free street parking. We're happy to go over must-see spots and restaurants and let you know the best way to get around. If you let her, our dog Lea will be your best friend during your stay; she loves making new friends!

We look forward to hosting you!
Chelsea and Jason
transit:
- There is free parking on and around my block. Parking is very easy; we have rarely needed to park as far as the opposite end of the block.
- You can catch the 22 bus east two blocks from our apartment to downtown and Wrigley Field. Note that you must either have a transit card or cash to board. Bus rides are $2.25 cash and they do not give change.

- The 24-hour Red Line train is a lovely .8 mile walk and will take you directly downtown. Train tickets are $3 for a single ride.  

(Insider's note- If you buy a card, it's only $0.25 to transfer from one mode of transportation to the other if you transfer within 2 hours of your original boarding time. But if you plan on riding a lot while you're here, just get a 3-day pass.)

access:
You'll have access to a private bedroom. Bathroom, kitchen, living room, dining area, and porch are shared with other airbnb guests. We carefully select our guests for hosting, 98% of our guests are graduate students and young professionals who are in town for conferences. There is free WiFi, free Netflix, and a refrigerator stocked with bottled water and beverages. Parking is free and is street parking in front of the apartment.
Check in is any time after 5 pm, early check in is possible
Checkout is before 12 noon, late check-out is possible
description:
Huge private bedroom with real queen size bed, holds 4 with an airbed added. There is free WiFi, free parking, free Netflix, and the apartment is located close to restaurants, bars, museums, and shopping malls. There are 5 bus routes and the train line is close.

Complimentary bottled water, fresh fruits, can soda, and wine

A huge private bedroom within a centrally located large 3 bedroom apartment with beds, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, etc. Living room has a couch and TV.  We carefully select our guests for hosting, 98% of our guests are students and young professionals who are in town for conferences. 

The apartment is very close to downtown and great view of city from the top rear deck of the building. Affordable, clean, friendly, close proximity (1-5 min) to transportation such as buses and trains. Close to bars, restaurants, stadiums, points of interest such as Grant Park, Millennium Park, and McCormick Place. Night life and food is great!!!

The price is the cheapest you can find in Chicago. This is because we enjoy hosting travelers and meeting exciting people from all over the world, being that we are international people ourselves this is extremely fun for us.

Free and available street parking and Free WiFi. Towels, bedding, shampoo, and body wash is provided.  

Several small/medium art museums in the neighborhood and the University Village and University of Illinois is a stone throw away.

Great view of the the city's skyline from rear deck

Access to roof, back porch, back yard, and a park with pool is 1 min away.

Great and affordable food in the neighborhood

Close to lake Michigan

Number 8 bus (to Broadway-5 minute walk away), number 18 bus (to Michigan Avenue-1 minute walk away), and the pink line train are a few blocks away. The Chicago Transit Authority (i.e CTA) bus routes 9, 21 and 60 are also 5 minutes away.
