additional_house_rules:
Please READ ALL THE RULES before booking, this helps to ensure both a happy guest and host!! Happy people are awesome!! 
-If you need an odd hour early check-in,  late check-out or luggage storage, I am flexible with times but let's discuss before completing reservation and there will be a $25 dollar charge to your reservation for early check -in this includes luggage storage. Your room may still be in use by previous guest and I need time to make it clean and ready for you so early check-in is not always available! IF YOU CHECK OUT LATE AND ITS NOT PREARRANGED at least 24 hrs before check-out,  YOU WILL BE CHARGED $25 every 15 minutes past CHECK OUT TIME, this charge starts 1 minute after the check out time and this is not a joke, holding up cleaning the room for another guest or for whatever reason I desire, is quite rude and I expect that you leave at the scheduled time. This includes luggage storage which is $25.  Dear Instant book guest and SAME DAY BOOKERS, if you make your reservation after MIDNIGHT, most likely I am asleep and will not respond till normal waking hours. Please be patient for reply and understand that access to enter the home is not immediate. 
-Weekdays, no noise after 10pm, We rise early for our workdays.
-Weekends, no noise after midnight.
-No noise before 9am on weekends or holidays.
-Noise and conversations must be contained in your room, This is a peaceful quiet house, therefore please be extra considerate at all times with regards to your volume level. No loud conversations, no loud TV, no loud music, no yelling, no heckling, no cackling! All electronics in commons spaces must be on headphones, other people live here , please remember that!
-Please be mindful of loud cell phone use and electronics in common areas, if you are in a common area such as kitchen or front room, and must answer your phone, you must ALSO leave the area and complete your conversation in your room. No one else here wants to hear your conversation!! It is very rude to have a phone conversation while someone else in the room is preparing their food, eating at the table or simply just wants to chill in the same room.  In particular I ask for Absolutely NO talking on phone in bathroom and NO SPEAKER PHONE conversations in the home. Speaker phone conversation are extremely loud and can heard through the entire home. Please use headphones for all electronics in common areas.
-Please report bothersome noise from inside the home, to me ASAP, sometimes I have other guest that cause disruption and I am not aware. There is another airbnb room above this one and noise carries through the vents. 
-Your Clock Alarm can be heard through the whole house, please turn it off once it goes off the first time. Hitting snooze and allowing your alarm to repeatedly go off is very disturbing and rude, other people live here and may not have the same schedule. 
-The dress code is WEAR CLOTHES IN COMMON AREAS
-Do not leave clothes laying around in the common areas
-If you use more than ONE TOWEL, you will be charged an extra $2
-Long term guest over 28 nights get TWO Towels,  the 3rd will get charged an extra $2
-Lost keys will be charged $25
-Do not move furniture. This means DO NOT MOVE FURNITURE. This also means DO NOT REARRANGE FURNITURE! If the location of the furniture you see in the photos does not suit your needs, do not book here!!
-Only exception to furniture rule: Move furniture (pink couch/desk)  away from wall heater if in use, and please remember to turn it off when leaving the room for extending period of time. Please speak with before turning ON wall heater. 
-Do NOT burn or light incense/candles. Besides the danger in this, the odor maybe intolerable to others in the home. Be considerate and use logic please! You will be charged a fee if incense or candle is used. 
-DO NOT TOUCH the thermostat, if you are cold or too hot please let me know and i will adjust the temperature. In particular please be aware the windows should be CLOSED if heater or air conditioner is ON.   The basement is always much cooler than rest of home.
-Please turn off lights, radio, computer, etc.. when not in use/and or you leave the room
-No smoking in the home, smoking is permitted in backyard or anywhere outside basically.
-Drinking alcohol is allowed, but I strongly request that you limit your intake and maintain responsibility for your behavior while drinking in my home. This is not a place to party or get crazy drunk.  
-No food or drink allowed in your room, sorry! Only capped bottles of water are allowed. Use kitchen at anytime, but please be mindful of the noise......example: do not use the blender or prepare a 6 course meal at 2am!! no matter how quiet you try to be, we will hear you.
-Oven use is ONLY permitted for long -term guest, those staying over 28 days. Short-term guest CANNOT use the oven. Please note that there will be a additional cleaning fee of $50 for oven use regardless how often you use it. Let's talk before you use the oven.
-Please do not leave your food cooking unattended. This is very dangerous, and I do not want a fire in my house! If you are cooking please stay in the kitchen, If I notice stove or oven ON and you are not in the kitchen, I will turn it off. 
-Food that is stored in the fridge or cupboards needs to be inside a closed container with a lid, do NOT store open containers or plates of food in fridge, your food will be THROWN OUT! I have glassware you can borrow, but you must buy your own foil or saran warp if that is the way you wish to store your food. Storing your food in an improper manner causes foul odor and a mess, hence this rule!
-Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen immediately after use,  this includes the sink, stove, counter-tops, table, fridge and floor of kitchen. Dirty items left on counter tops or table brings in hoards of ants and other  unwanted insects.
-Black garbage can is for recycle trash. Metal garbage is for regular trash.
-ONLY use your designated bathroom. 
-ONLY TOILET PAPER in the TOILET, anything else for example, sanitary napkins, tampons, q- tips, cotton balls, hair balls/shavings please dispense in trash. The toilet will get clogged if anything but toilet paper is flushed into it.  No hair shavings or trim in the sink drain, it will get clogged.
-Please clean your hair out from the drains.
-Long Term guest, anyone staying for twenty eight nights or more, are required to pay for extra cleaning service OR agree to maintain the cleanliness of their space during their stay. Note the the payment for cleaning with booking is a one time fee that is not substantial if you staying long term. You will be charged additional cleaning fees through resolution center if upon your departure your long term rental requires deep cleaning do to negligence. (example: two inches of mold in shower) 
-There is a fee for laundry services, using washer and laundry is two dollars fee per load. please leave the cash in the tin box that is labeled to the right of the washer. Long term guest will have a slightly different fee arrangement. If you want someone to do your laundry for you, I can arrangement that as well with an additional charge.  Let's talk before using the washer and dryer. 
-NO guest in home that are not part of the reservation. Exception to rule is  if you are a long term guest, staying over twenty eights nights, you may have guest, but no Over-Night guest and I must know their names and purpose of their visit 
-Well behaved pets and children are allowed, but I reiterate "well behaved".  Unfortunately we cannot accommodate your pet if they have anxiety issues, chew/ claw at furniture, are not potty trained or barks/ meows during sleeping hours,   Pets cannot be left unattended and  are not allowed on beds, couches or any furniture. Please note that a Pet fee will be added if you choose to bring your furry friend .This room cannot accommodate cats. Dogs only. Cats will be considered on a case by case basis, for my other listing:  Lush Bed Lavender Room. 
-Laundry for your pets needs to be done at outside laundry mat. My washer and dryer cannot handle pet hair/dander. 
-When booking the room please include pet in the number of guest for correct reservation and will discuss pricing for pet fee before booking.  
-The home is not child proof, please keep a mindful eye on your child and do not let them wander into unattended rooms of the home. We cannot accommodate your child if they cannot sleep through the night,  have bed wetting issues or behavioral problems. I am a parent myself and do apologies for the rules with children and pets but I need to keep the home suitable with low maintenance for future guest.
-If you break or damage something, please notify me immediately, I do understand accidents happen, but it is extremely offensive to withhold this information from your host
-Remember this is my home, and NOT a hotel
-Break the rules, you risk the reservation being canceled. Which means you will be required to leave. Due to the listing's strict cancellation policy, this also means you will not be refunded if your reservation gets canceled early due to non- compliance with house rules.

access:
Please feel free to use the kitchen and front room on the main floor.  If weather permits, feel free to hang out in the backyard.  You may enter and exit through the front or back door, most people use the front door because it is easier. 
There is an home alarm, will set up a code for you to use before you arrive.  
Do not come upstairs to the 2nd floor, this is our bedroom area which may include another guest, we value our privacy as much as you value yours. The only guest allowed on 2nd floor is guest who is renting a bedroom on that floor. If you need something do not come upstairs to look for it, please give a shout, call, text or email and I will gladly try and help you get what you need.
description:
Finished basement in single family home: Queen bed- memory foam, Queen air bed & Ikea Friheten Queen size Sofa Bed. Room sleeps total 6 people. Private bathroom newly remodeled March 2018! Private entrance exit included. Free, no hassle parking. Safe to walk at night. Relaxed, quiet environment near midway airport, public park, CTA & race track.  LGBTQ  welcomed in our home! PET FEE 4 fur babies. READ ALL HOUSE RULES! Budget private room in same house, see other listing  LAVENDER RM LUSH BED

Very traditional for the area in this type of home a Chicago basement room. The Graffiti on the walls created by local Chicago graffiti artist.
Most artwork, canvas paintings and photography by personal friends or family. If you are offended by artwork that displays nudity, violence, urban decay, sex , drugs, rock & roll or just plain can't stand the sight of a skull, please do not book here.  There is no TV, electronics or stereo in the room at the moment.  There is a Queen size bed that fits two people, a Queen size sofa bed that fits two more people and a Queen size air mattress is available for a two additional people. Please realize that it will be a tight fit, as all the beds will be in same room.
The floor of bedroom is vinyl tile. Bathroom and kitchen are ceramic tile.
The home is supplied with central heat and air conditioning, because this is a basement room, it does tend to be cooler than the rest of the home. For this reason, there is a additional wall heater for comfort during the winter months, located in the rear of the room, on the North wall.

Please feel free to use the kitchen and front room on the main floor.  If weather permits, feel free to hang out in the backyard.  You may enter and exit through the front or back door, most people use the front door because it is easier. 
There is an home alarm, will set up a code for you to use before you arrive.  
Do not come upstairs to the 2nd floor, this is our bedroom area which may include another guest, we value our privacy as much as you value yours. The only guest allowed on 2nd floor is guest who is renting a bedroom on that floor. If you need something do not come upstairs to look for it, please give a shout, call, text or email and I will gladly try and help you get what you need.

We work and go to school during the weekdays. More flexible with our time on the weekends. Up for a chat, give suggestions for your trip and be available for you, should you have questions but depending on the time and days you will be here, we might hardly see each other.  As much privacy as you desire will be respected and provided.
PREFERRED MODE OF CONTACT IS AIRBNB MESSENGER SYSTEM. Text and phone calls are acceptable but please try and use the Airbnb messenger system as main mode of communication.

Very safe residential area, we are in Chicago but have a suburb feel.  Quiet, clean, working- middle class family oriented neighborhood near public skate park, midway airport, CTA, race track and free abundant parking! You will feel comfortable walking home alone during late nights if need be.  Garfield Ridge/ Vittum park neighborhood located 10 miles from downtown. Just 2 miles from Chicago Midway Airport and 1 mile from I -55/ Stevenson expressway. There is Vittum Chicago public park  2 blocks away with a tennis court, basketball court , children's playground and skating ramp. This is a residential location with ample free parking, perfect if you rent a car. We are down the street from Our Lady of Snows Elementary school and church. I have very active and friendly neighbors, please feel free to say hello and let the neighbor  know that you are a guest of mine should they seemed alarmed about a new face on the block. There are a few locally owned bars and fast food places walking distance, but nothing fancy, a little travel is recommended for something more memorable. Polish deli & Puerto Rican cafe are some local favorites by guests so far. Walking distance to several CTA bus lines that will take you CTA train. Again, safe to walk at night, but some buses do not run late evenings near my home or weather might get be uncomfortable for walking, if that's the case just about ten bucks to use ride sharing service from nearest train line. Can prearrange a ride with me for a cost, if I am available. Racetrack in Cicero and Stevenson expressway less than two miles away.

There are four bus routes just a 10 min walk / half a mile away.
#62 bus- Travels East,
 takes you straight into Chinatown and  Downtown, stops at Orange line on the way
#62H bus -travels East and West takes you to midway airport/ Orange line
#47 st bus- travels mostly directly east, all the way to Lakefront , stops at red line on way, short trip West to Orange line/Midway airport at some non peak hours 
#54B Cicero Bus- Travels North and South, takes you to pink line and Orange LINE
The nearest Metra stop is the BNSF Railway in Cicero, Il. Just about 3 miles away.

Although we are avid music lovers, this is a quiet , low volume home due to our busy days, we highly value coming home to a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere, perfect if you want to study or get some work done, guest are encouraged to keep entertainment noise contained to their perspective room, with volume low or use headphones, in particular during the weekdays! The room is down a flight of stairs and separated from the rest of the house by a curtain.  There is no door, only this curtain. Additional privacy can be added by a room divider that is set up for you at the foot of staircase/ entrance to the room. You will have privacy but no sound barrier, meaning if we are on the main floor/ kitchen you will hear us and we will hear you. This might be an issue if you are a light sleeper or extremely value a sound barrier. There maybe two or three people living in the home at the time of your stay. Weekdays, we get up around 630am and will be busy in the kitchen making some noise with breakfast and getting ready to head out for the day, the home will be silent after 730-8am when we leave for the day. I promise the early morning noise in kitchen will only last a few minutes, but if you want a place to sleep in, please consider another location as it is hard for me to control normal daytime noise from other airbnb guest in the home who need to use the kitchen as well. Due to an elementary school being a few doors down, the children playing recess outside can be heard during the day. Other than that, its a pretty quiet home.  
Everyone in the home is conscious of environmental issues and healthy diets, but as some would speculate, we are not all vegetarians please note that there might be meat and non recycle items in the home.  We are part of the local punk DIY community. Waldorf School parent and  Loyola University of Chicago parent resides in the home. Musician and artist reside in the home. LGBTQ friendly. Babysitting, pet sitting, car rides, and laundry service might be available for separate fee, please ask if interested. 
Please include children in the number of guest when booking!!
Please include pet as a second guest, although this listing, will not automatically charge you for the second guest, there will be a pet fee added if you decide room here with your pet.  There Will BE A PET FEE!
There is a washer and dryer in the home, please make arrangements with me before using them on your own. There is a limit to washer & dryer use!
The metal garbage can is for regular trash
The black garbage can is for recycled trash
If you need additional heat, there will be extra blankets (check the closet next to the bathroom or laundry room) for you to keep warm but please feel free to turn on the wall heater,  move the furniture away from the wall heater before you turn it ON and remember to to turn off the it OFF when you leave the room for an extending period of time. Please speak to me before turning on wall heater!!!
This my home, not a hotel please remember that:-)
WIFI network: AIRBNB.Rockstar.ON.LaramieAVE
Code: Can be found on side of fridge in kitchen
house_rules:
Please READ ALL THE RULES before booking, this helps to ensure both a happy guest and host!! Happy people are awesome!! 
-If you need an odd hour early check-in,  late check-out or luggage storage, I am flexible with times but let's discuss before completing reservation and there will be a $25 dollar charge to your reservation for early check -in this includes luggage storage. Your room may still be in use by previous guest and I need time to make it clean and ready for you so early check-in is not always available! IF YOU CHECK OUT LATE AND ITS NOT PREARRANGED at least 24 hrs before check-out,  YOU WILL BE CHARGED $25 every 15 minutes past CHECK OUT TIME, this charge starts 1 minute after the check out time and this is not a joke, holding up cleaning the room for another guest or for whatever reason I desire, is quite rude and I expect that you leave at the scheduled time. This includes luggage storage which is $25.  Dear Instant book guest and SAME DAY BOOKERS, if you make your reservation after MIDNIGHT, most likely I am asleep and will not respond till normal waking hours. Please be patient for reply and understand that access to enter the home is not immediate. 
-Weekdays, no noise after 10pm, We rise early for our workdays.
-Weekends, no noise after midnight.
-No noise before 9am on weekends or holidays.
-Noise and conversations must be contained in your room, This is a peaceful quiet house, therefore please be extra considerate at all times with regards to your volume level. No loud conversations, no loud TV, no loud music, no yelling, no heckling, no cackling! All electronics in commons spaces must be on headphones, other people live here , please remember that!
-Please be mindful of loud cell phone use and electronics in common areas, if you are in a common area such as kitchen or front room, and must answer your phone, you must ALSO leave the area and complete your conversation in your room. No one else here wants to hear your conversation!! It is very rude to have a phone conversation while someone else in the room is preparing their food, eating at the table or simply just wants to chill in the same room.  In particular I ask for Absolutely NO talking on phone in bathroom and NO SPEAKER PHONE conversations in the home. Speaker phone conversation are extremely loud and can heard through the entire home. Please use headphones for all electronics in common areas.
-Please report bothersome noise from inside the home, to me ASAP, sometimes I have other guest that cause disruption and I am not aware. There is another airbnb room above this one and noise carries through the vents. 
-Your Clock Alarm can be heard through the whole house, please turn it off once it goes off the first time. Hitting snooze and allowing your alarm to repeatedly go off is very disturbing and rude, other people live here and may not have the same schedule. 
-The dress code is WEAR CLOTHES IN COMMON AREAS
-Do not leave clothes laying around in the common areas
-If you use more than ONE TOWEL, you will be charged an extra $2
-Long term guest over 28 nights get TWO Towels,  the 3rd will get charged an extra $2
-Lost keys will be charged $25
-Do not move furniture. This means DO NOT MOVE FURNITURE. This also means DO NOT REARRANGE FURNITURE! If the location of the furniture you see in the photos does not suit your needs, do not book here!!
-Only exception to furniture rule: Move furniture (pink couch/desk)  away from wall heater if in use, and please remember to turn it off when leaving the room for extending period of time. Please speak with before turning ON wall heater. 
-Do NOT burn or light incense/candles. Besides the danger in this, the odor maybe intolerable to others in the home. Be considerate and use logic please! You will be charged a fee if incense or candle is used. 
-DO NOT TOUCH the thermostat, if you are cold or too hot please let me know and i will adjust the temperature. In particular please be aware the windows should be CLOSED if heater or air conditioner is ON.   The basement is always much cooler than rest of home.
-Please turn off lights, radio, computer, etc.. when not in use/and or you leave the room
-No smoking in the home, smoking is permitted in backyard or anywhere outside basically.
-Drinking alcohol is allowed, but I strongly request that you limit your intake and maintain responsibility for your behavior while drinking in my home. This is not a place to party or get crazy drunk.  
-No food or drink allowed in your room, sorry! Only capped bottles of water are allowed. Use kitchen at anytime, but please be mindful of the noise......example: do not use the blender or prepare a 6 course meal at 2am!! no matter how quiet you try to be, we will hear you.
-Oven use is ONLY permitted for long -term guest, those staying over 28 days. Short-term guest CANNOT use the oven. Please note that there will be a additional cleaning fee of $50 for oven use regardless how often you use it. Let's talk before you use the oven.
-Please do not leave your food cooking unattended. This is very dangerous, and I do not want a fire in my house! If you are cooking please stay in the kitchen, If I notice stove or oven ON and you are not in the kitchen, I will turn it off. 
-Food that is stored in the fridge or cupboards needs to be inside a closed container with a lid, do NOT store open containers or plates of food in fridge, your food will be THROWN OUT! I have glassware you can borrow, but you must buy your own foil or saran warp if that is the way you wish to store your food. Storing your food in an improper manner causes foul odor and a mess, hence this rule!
-Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen immediately after use,  this includes the sink, stove, counter-tops, table, fridge and floor of kitchen. Dirty items left on counter tops or table brings in hoards of ants and other  unwanted insects.
-Black garbage can is for recycle trash. Metal garbage is for regular trash.
-ONLY use your designated bathroom. 
-ONLY TOILET PAPER in the TOILET, anything else for example, sanitary napkins, tampons, q- tips, cotton balls, hair balls/shavings please dispense in trash. The toilet will get clogged if anything but toilet paper is flushed into it.  No hair shavings or trim in the sink drain, it will get clogged.
-Please clean your hair out from the drains.
-Long Term guest, anyone staying for twenty eight nights or more, are required to pay for extra cleaning service OR agree to maintain the cleanliness of their space during their stay. Note the the payment for cleaning with booking is a one time fee that is not substantial if you staying long term. You will be charged additional cleaning fees through resolution center if upon your departure your long term rental requires deep cleaning do to negligence. (example: two inches of mold in shower) 
-There is a fee for laundry services, using washer and laundry is two dollars fee per load. please leave the cash in the tin box that is labeled to the right of the washer. Long term guest will have a slightly different fee arrangement. If you want someone to do your laundry for you, I can arrangement that as well with an additional charge.  Let's talk before using the washer and dryer. 
-NO guest in home that are not part of the reservation. Exception to rule is  if you are a long term guest, staying over twenty eights nights, you may have guest, but no Over-Night guest and I must know their names and purpose of their visit 
-Well behaved pets and children are allowed, but I reiterate "well behaved".  Unfortunately we cannot accommodate your pet if they have anxiety issues, chew/ claw at furniture, are not potty trained or barks/ meows during sleeping hours,   Pets cannot be left unattended and  are not allowed on beds, couches or any furniture. Please note that a Pet fee will be added if you choose to bring your furry friend .This room cannot accommodate cats. Dogs only. Cats will be considered on a case by case basis, for my other listing:  Lush Bed Lavender Room. 
-Laundry for your pets needs to be done at outside laundry mat. My washer and dryer cannot handle pet hair/dander. 
-When booking the room please include pet in the number of guest for correct reservation and will discuss pricing for pet fee before booking.  
-The home is not child proof, please keep a mindful eye on your child and do not let them wander into unattended rooms of the home. We cannot accommodate your child if they cannot sleep through the night,  have bed wetting issues or behavioral problems. I am a parent myself and do apologies for the rules with children and pets but I need to keep the home suitable with low maintenance for future guest.
-If you break or damage something, please notify me immediately, I do understand accidents happen, but it is extremely offensive to withhold this information from your host
-Remember this is my home, and NOT a hotel
-Break the rules, you risk the reservation being canceled. Which means you will be required to leave. Due to the listing's strict cancellation policy, this also means you will not be refunded if your reservation gets canceled early due to non- compliance with house rules.

space:
Very traditional for the area in this type of home a Chicago basement room. The Graffiti on the walls created by local Chicago graffiti artist.
Most artwork, canvas paintings and photography by personal friends or family. If you are offended by artwork that displays nudity, violence, urban decay, sex , drugs, rock & roll or just plain can't stand the sight of a skull, please do not book here.  There is no TV, electronics or stereo in the room at the moment.  There is a Queen size bed that fits two people, a Queen size sofa bed that fits two more people and a Queen size air mattress is available for a two additional people. Please realize that it will be a tight fit, as all the beds will be in same room.
The floor of bedroom is vinyl tile. Bathroom and kitchen are ceramic tile.
The home is supplied with central heat and air conditioning, because this is a basement room, it does tend to be cooler than the rest of the home. For this reason, there is a additional wall heater for comfort during the winter months, located in the rear of the room, on the North wall.
summary: Finished basement in single family home: Queen bed- memory foam, Queen air bed & Ikea Friheten Queen size Sofa Bed. Room sleeps total 6 people. Private bathroom newly remodeled March 2018! Private entrance exit included. Free, no hassle parking. Safe to walk at night. Relaxed, quiet environment near midway airport, public park, CTA & race track.  LGBTQ  welcomed in our home! PET FEE 4 fur babies. READ ALL HOUSE RULES! Budget private room in same house, see other listing  LAVENDER RM LUSH BED

description:
Perfect oasis for STUDENTS, PROFESSIONALS, and VACATIONERS. We have served people from South America, Europe, and Asia so far. This is your new home your home away from home.

*Complimentary coffee (with creamer & sugar) and tea
*Wireless Internet 
*TV
*Netflix
*Kitchen Use 
*Central AC/Heating 
*Washer use 
*Dryer use

Check-in time is listed at 1pm and check-out time is listed at 11am. We can accommodate your needs and will work outside these hours as long as it works with other guest schedules and our ability to have a clean and beautiful space for you to stay.

We expect clean, respectful, and relatively quiet guests. Bonus if you're fun, interesting, and generally a nice person!
Smoking must be done outside on the back porch.

2-min walk to BUS #4, #63, and #59
2-min walk to CTA Green Line Train (Cottage Grove stop)
2- min walk to Divvy bike station (63rd & Cottage Grove)

*Cook in or Eat out! There are so many restaurants in Woodlawn/Hyde Park, ranging from high end cuisine to casual family dining. In the mood for Japanese or Middle Eastern or Italian or French or Soul? Woodlawn/Hyde Park has it all! Please visit my GUESTBOOK for ideas!

Order in! Download the GrubHub app on your smartphone or visit GrubHub's website for local food delivery services.

I'm easily reachable by phone, text, email, and in-person.

2-min walk to CTA Green Line Train (Cottage Grove stop)
2- min walk to Divvy bike station (63rd & Cottage Grove)

*Cook in or Eat out! There are so many restaurants in Woodlawn/Hyde Park, ranging from high end cuisine to casual family dining. In the mood for Japanese or Middle Eastern or Italian or French or Soul? Woodlawn/Hyde Park has it all! Please visit my GUESTBOOK for ideas!

Order in! Download the GrubHub app on your smartphone or visit GrubHub's website for local food delivery services.

description:
Beautiful Townhome all to your self available. 3 bedrooms and 1 baths. Bronze ville area is 15 minutes to downtown Chicago.  Lots of restaurants and shopping a few minutes away. 3 queen size beds, 2 couches. Free parking on the street. This home can comfortably sleep 10  people. but you can use air mattresses to sleep more. TV fire-stick watch any live channel you want.

Stay in a nice townhome with  a full kitchen with all the amenities,  3 bedrooms with 3 queen size beds 2 couches, 1 full bath, living room, dining area and  a lovely backyard area. Parking in on the street is Free. There is no washer dryer in the unit but there is a laundry mat not to far away.

It’s likely you won’t see me during your stay, which allows you more privacy and convenience. However, I am here anytime you need to reach out. If you need anything or have questions, just send me a message via Airbnb and I’ll be quick to respond.

great location near highway and train easy access to downtown chicago. Close distance to restaurants and shops

Top things to do in Chicago area.

 Wrigley Field watch the chicago cubs play, ton of bars, restaurants, and nightlife

Sky Deck Willis tower downtown Chicago

the Bean at Millenium Park towner downtown Chicago

 Shedd Aquarium. Down town Chicago

 Rivers Casino Rosemont IL 

HorseShoe Casino Hammond IN
 Museum of Science and Industry Downtown Chicago 
Magnificent Mile down town chicago.
Maggie Daley Park. Downtown Chicago
Lincoln Park zoo Chicago IL
Lake Front trail for walking and biking. Beaches summer time. Down town Chicago 
 Field Museum for history. Down town Chicago
Chicago River Walk ton of shops and restaurants. Down town Chicago
 Chicago Cultural center. Down town Chicago
 Boat tours Down town Chicago
 Buckingham Fountain Down town Chicago
 Art Institute Down town Chicago
 360 Chicago Observatory Deck Down town Chicago
Richard H. Driehaus Museum Down town Chicago 
Symphony Center - Chicago Symphony Orchestra Down town Chicago 
United Center watch the Bulls, Blackhawks play
Comiskey Park watch the whitesox play

Taxis, Uber, and Lyft are available anytime and cost about $20 to get to anywhere else in town. I prefer Uber.   Also, the public bus stops are a few blocks away come every 15 minutes.

description:
* Also See NOTES in "The Space"  *
Lovely single family house with a fenced backyard and a nice deck. One garden-level bedroom  with common areas including living rm, dining rm, kitchen, and laundry rm (washer & dryer). Sleeps up to 3. Has office amenities (Wifi, printer, copier, iron, ...) and washer & dryer for business travelers. This room has a bit of oriental flavor in its decoration. It  has ample space after a queen size bed and a working desk are placed. -->

Quiet and nice suburb.  Close to public transportation & I-290 expressway. 8 minutes walking to CTA Blue Line Austin Station and arrive Chicago O'Hare Airport as its last station (no need to change train). 15 min to downtown Chicago via CTA train & 15 min by car (normal traffic). Near Loyola Med Ctr,  Hines VA and Rush Hospitals. 

***** NOTES *****
(1) REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY (see below)
(2) The host typically would like to greet the guests in person, occasionally this may not be possible.  In the latter case, please contact the host for the procedure of "Self Check-in".~~  Do not wait in front of the house or the porch of the house (stay in your car if you drive) while you are talking with or waiting for the host. Not all neighbors like the concept of Airbnb, and  sometimes people can exaggerate a little thing into a big matter.  We want to stay low key and not disturb our neighbors.  ~~
(3) Each room has its own numeric lock (no charge) and the guest can set his/her own code. The lock is very secure. If you forget the code, the lock must be cut and destroyed.  The cost  for each lock is $11 when it must be destroyed.  Please leave the host your code and do not try to reset the lock (as you are likely to make a mistake and render the lock useless).
(4) Typically we can arrange 24-hour FREE street parking (just in the front or near the front of the house) for up to 33 days of stays.  It is the Guests' responsibility to do a simple registration with the village for street parking (Please ask the host for details). Street parking is pretty safe in this area as it is safe to begin with and the village polices are very  diligent in patrolling.  However if you still want a garage parking for some reasons, the cost is $6 per day and its availability is on the first come first serve basis.  The payment for Garage Parking (free for street parking) needs to be made right after your booking for securing the garage space. If you stay in the house for more than one month, please discuss the parking matter with the host as part of your booking process.

REASONS FOR YOU TO CHOOSE THIS PLACE TO STAY
Guests choose a place to stay based what it serves them the best.  We would like to highlight a few items worth considering and invite you to book this place.
(a) We run a very efficient operation and have a very competitive room rate with high quality rooms and services;
(b) This house is located in an exceptional great locale.  It is about 8 minutes to Blue Line Austin Station by walking (hence very close to downtown Chicago) and has convenient access to west, north west, and south west of greater Chicagoland by car. Via CTA Blue Line, you can arrive Chicago O'Hare Airport as its last station.
(c) Free parking up to a month can be easily arranged.  Parking can be very very expensive in any larger metropolitan, including downtown Chicago.  Therefore it is much more economical to park here and take the train to downtown Chicago. If you rent a room in or near downtown Chicago, you implicitly or explicitly spend a lot of money just on parking.
(d) The "Occupancy Tax" is about 11% in this village which is much less than 23% or higher (doubled) in Chicago. The occupancy tax is paid by the guests based on the sum of room rate and cleaning fee.  With this tax and parking cost in mind, it is much more economical (and still without losing convenient access to downtown Chicago) to stay in a convenient suburbs rather than in Chicago or downtown Chicago. Since the "Occupancy Tax" is waived if you stay 31 days or longer, you can avoid this tax and save quite a bit of money if you plan your trip ahead and check with the host for room availability.

====== Other Information  ========
Cereal, waffles and coffee are provided by the host for the ARRIVAL day/night of the guests. 

The closest grocery stores are Fair Share Finer Foods, Amer Grocery Store and Carnival Grocery. Nearby coffee shops include Circle K, Buzz Cafe and The Happy Apple Pie Shop. Nearby restaurants include Pete's Red Hot's, Happiness Chinese and Bodhi Thai Bistro.

description:
This home is located 10 minutes from downtown and 5 minutes from midway area and just 3 minutes from HW 55!! In car !!! But if you use public transportation, down town is about 20 and midway about 20!!!  Buses run right at the corner from the street and the train is about 10 minutes walkWith so many restaurants around and even just in front of a major L.A fitness center , is nothing less than a pleasant convening place if you love being close to downtown in the hearth of Chicago!

Very quite neighborhood although is in the city! One thing Let you know is that my place is very close from downtown with about 10 minutes by car and 15 to 20 in train also we have the CTA  transportation right on the corner and nevertheless with the comfort of a walk away including restaurants whether you like fast food or Chanise or a coffee ! I am very flexible so just let me know and I do my best to acomódate you! So I hope to see you !

You could watch tv make some coffee  or just relax out side of the house!

I rather give you your space but if you need something just call me not a problem or text me!

Close to downtown and midway  And LA fitness and hw 55 and United center not to forget the black sox, first this is a quite neighborhood but of course in Chicago!!

Around the area there is a park where you can walk safe and 2 important  av which take you whatever you like get to downtown or midway

The dishes and please no parties or drugs allowed . absolutely no smoking inside please if you smoke do it outside 20 feet way from the house with the door closed again no smoking in side it seems every one forgets this rule no smoking in the house or in the room!!!  Totally if you  are not willing to share the house with other guesses and prefer to be alone  , this place will have other guesses from time to time!

access: Free use of washer/dryer. Use of all common areas such as garage, dinning room, kitchen, and family room. Nice backyard!
description:
The house is near multiple major highways for easy access to the airport and Chicago. Many public transportations are nearby. There are many stores around the area. The house in a quiet and safe neighborhood. 
A master bedroom suite in this house with private attached bath.  Large walk in closet/additional room, Sleep up to 3.

The house is clean, elegant, and large. It has a nice kitchen, a comfortable living room, and a beautiful backyard. Close to highway, shopping and quick access to downtown Chicago and airport.

Free use of washer/dryer. Use of all common areas such as garage, dinning room, kitchen, and family room. Nice backyard!

We are always available via Airbnb chat.

The house is in a tranquil and quiet neighborhood. The people are very nice. Walking distance to many continent stores.

1、Driving is the best mean of transportation.
It’s 25 minutes to O’Hare airport, 30 minutes to Chicago downtown. 33 minutes to Midway   airport. 
2、Use the public transportation.
It's (1.5 miles ) 30 minutes' walk from BNSF Metro station, 10 minutes by bike, and bus stations are nearby.

Noted that we live nearby and there might be other guests in the house.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- In-suite laundry
- Fully equipped kitchen 

South Loop highlights
- Walkability score: 92
- 7 minute walk to Eleven City Diner (our favorite brunch spot)
- 3 minute walk to The Scout Waterhouse + Kitchen (catch a game and enjoy some American pub grub)

Getting around
- 7 minute walk to Roosevelt 'L' Station 
- 13 minute drive to Navy Pier
- 28 minute drive to MDW Airport
- 77 minute drive to ORD Airport

The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

Exact views from the apartment are not guaranteed, the views could vary from the pictures listed.

There’s no cable. We’ve provided a Chromecast for streaming.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen
- Views of Lake Michigan and Grant Park

South Loop highlights
- Walkability score: 96
- 4 minute walk to Yolk (best breakfast spot)
- 1 minute walk to SX Sky Bar (upscale cocktail bar)

Getting around
- 7 minute walk to Harrison Red Line Station 
- 5 minute walk to downtown
- 31 minute drive to MDW Airport
- 60 minute drive to ORD Airport

The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

Access to the amenities is not available at this time.

The number of overnight guests cannot exceed the maximum occupancy. Up to three visitors are allowed during the day.

License: HL 2671122

This is a central location and prone to noise.
house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $400 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive
- Self check-in

- Private balcony
- In-suite laundry
- Sleeper sofa
- Fully equipped kitchen 

Building amenities
- Fitness room

South Loop highlights
- Walkability score: 92
- 7 minute walk to Eleven City Diner (our favorite brunch spot)
- 3 minute walk to The Scout Waterhouse + Kitchen (catch a game and enjoy some American pub grub)

Getting around
- 7 minute walk to Roosevelt 'L' Station 
- 13 minute drive to Navy Pier
- 28 minute drive to MDW Airport
- 77 minute drive to ORD Airport

The South Loop is a vibrant blend of notable attractions, beautiful parks, and stunning Lake Michigan views. Picnic in the charming green space surrounding Museum Campus, or attend one of the many events at Grant Park such as The Taste of Chicago. Spend the day exploring the countless museums, or journey to the top of the 108-story Willis Tower for breathtaking views of the city.

The bedroom wall is partially open to the living room and is not soundproof.

Exact views from the apartment are not guaranteed, the views could vary from the pictures listed.

There’s no cable. We’ve provided a Chromecast for streaming.

access: You have access to the entire apartment!
description:
River North is a chic and lively district with shops, nightclubs, cocktail lounges and luxurious restaurants. Around this area, lofts and warehouses converted into artists' studios form a nucleus that sustains the most important art galleries in the area.

This is the perfect place for those who appreciate dinning, art, design and a vibran nightlife.

Feel welcome and enjoy the privacy and luxury of this unique experience that includes the following amenities:

•1 Queen Bed
•Memory foam mattresses.
•Laptop friendly workspace.
•Wifi
•Stainless steel appliances with fully stocked kitchen.
•Oven, microwave, dishwasher, fridge, freezer, pots & pans, cooking utensils, cutlery, dishes.
•Coffee maker and refrigerator 
•Washer and dryer available in the unit, laundry detergent provided
•43-inch flat-screen TV with Cable, Netflix and YouTube
•Towels, shampoo/conditioner, body soap, extra large towels and another essential objects
•Iron and Hairdryer
•Air conditioning and heating in all apartment.

You have access to the entire apartment!

I am best reached via Airbnb Messaging Service. Also available via E-mail, Call or Text!!

Historical and artistic neigborhood close to everything you may need in your visit to Chicago, easy access to public transportation, impressive walking streets, beautiful showcases!!

You can access the CTA Red and Blue lines and the Chicago Pedway within 200 meters each (2 mins walk)

additional_house_rules:
COZY HOME HOUSE RULES: 
 
As a Superhost, we aim to make your stay as comfortable as it can be. Our mission is to help our guests have the best experience in our cozy home. For us to do so, we would truly appreciate it if you can follow these house rules. Thank you in advance and truly appreciate your cooperation!

• Max capacity is four people
• No children under 18 years old
• Quiet time after 11PM “on weeknights” 
• No outside visitors, no overnight guests without previous approval from your host
• No parties
• If you break or damage something, please let me, I won’t be upset 
•  No smoking in the house of any sort. This includes vaping
• Keep all "EXIT" doors closed
• We have provided cotton balls, black wash towels to remove makeup. Please do not use other towels as makeup and other facial products permanently stain
• Soiled/stained sheets will be disposed of for everyone's health and safety.  If linens are stained, there will be a charge against the security deposit
• Clean out refrigerator of opened food items at checkout
• Under no condition are packages or mail  to be delivered 
   
Late Check-out Request
• Late check out requests may be made in advance, and are subject to determination based on occupancy. If you call first and make a request, we'll usually give you an extra half hour
• Overstay check-out, and we don't know about it ahead of time, additional $20/hr fee for every hour after 11:00 a.m, but under no circumstances can check-outs be later than 1pm, as other guests are arriving and the space must be cleaned
• If you overstay by 3 hours and after 2 pm, you will be charged a full day rate.

access: Available between June and August. Yard has a patio, patio lounge chairs, fire-pit and grill for guest to use.
description:
The 1100 sq ft private apt is  located in the heart of Downtown Forest Park. The apartment has been updated and  maintains its historic charm. 

- Apartment has a private entrance
- Main Bedroom: has a queen size bed, closet and a makeup vanity
- Second Bedroom: has a full size bed and nightstand
-Updated full kitchen with cooking essentials
-Complimentary coffee and tea 
-Updated bathroom with a shower/tub
-SmartTV with Netflix, Amazon Prime, HBO, WiFi
-Workspace
-Spacious living & dinning room

Guest will find beautiful artwork by local artist displayed throughout the house. The rooms have Platform beds and complimenting bedroom furniture is an expression of minimalist furniture combined with the natural beauty of handcrafted solid wood. A fantastic place of rest for you and yours.

Available between June and August. Yard has a patio, patio lounge chairs, fire-pit and grill for guest to use.

We live on the first floor of the two flat apartment. Also love our yard and regularly grill. You are more than welcome to join. :)

The two bedroom apartment is located in the heart of downtown Forest Park and located just ten miles west of downtown Chicago. Forest Park is a vibrant, active and diverse community rich in history and small-town charm with an urban feeling. Ample choices for an alfresco dinner, coffee shops or drinks. Short walk to the train (The Blue and Green Line train) to downtown Chicago, Frank Lloyd Wright Home, Oak Park Historic District, Whole Foods and Trader Joe’s, short walk to park, playground, water park, pilates, yoga and a fitness center all around the corner from the house. Near Rush Oak Park Hospital and Loyola University Chicago.

Short 10-15 minute walk to the train (The Blue and Green Line train and Metra train). Downtown Chicago is 25 minutes via car and 20 minutes via train.

access: Whole 900 sq ft studio is guests' private space with private/separate entry. Coin-operated washers and dryers are available in basement.  Our guests are invited to hang out or join us on our front porch too.
description:
Private, 3rd floor/walk-up, smoke-free studio apartment in vintage Queen Anne with hosts living on first floor. The Aragon Ballroom, Riviera Theater and the legendary Green Mill Jazz club all within a 5-minute walk.  The CTA's Red Line/Lawrence station is only one block away;  downtown Chicago about 25-30 on train. Overnight street-parking  decals available for our guests.

Private, smoke-free, 3rd floor walk-up studio apartment with one queen-size bed and one queen-size sofa sleeper; tables and chairs for dining or working.  Full kitchenette with coffee-maker, electric kettle for tea or hot cocoa, mini-refrigerator, microwave, and regular stove/oven. 32" TV available for guests' own laptop or phone; no cable or antenna connection provided.

Whole 900 sq ft studio is guests' private space with private/separate entry. Coin-operated washers and dryers are available in basement.  Our guests are invited to hang out or join us on our front porch too.

Hosts live on first floor; guests welcome to just knock on our door for help or questions. Also available by phone/text.

Uptown is one of Chicago's most diverse and fastest gentrifying neighborhoods, with a variety of entertainment venues, coffee shops, and restaurants. We have lived here for almost 22 years and love it!

Overnight street-parking  decals/permits available and given when guests check in. The CTA's Red Line/Lawrence station is just over a block from our address; Wrigley Field's Addison station is only 3 stations away, and downtown's Chicago station near Water Tower is about a 25-minute ride.  Bike and car share available within two blocks.

NOTES:  
* NO SMOKING indoors at all times and no loud music-playing/noise after 10 PM please, in respect of building residents.
* 2-hour CHECK-IN window (between 2:00-8:00 pm) must be confirmed by guests at least 24 hours before arrival.
* Our dog, Milo, gets excited when guests arrive or pass through front entranceway, but he is very friendly, after introductions! There are also two resident cats on second floor.

access: All
description:
Spectacular three level home with 3 story atrium, soaring ceilings, skylights, lots of windows and high-level finishes in Chicago's hot Bucktown neighborhood. 

Luxurious, design-forward retreat combines the contemporary 'wow' factor with extreme livability. State of the art Bulthaup kitchen, high end furniture from Flexform, Ligne Roset, Draenert, B&B Italia, and more. Bathrooms feature Hansgrohe and Dornbracht.

Recent cover feature article in Chicago Home & Garden Magazine (google "Making it Work Chicago Home Garden Kathryn Quinn" to read).

This home has three levels, all connected with an open and dramatic sense of space.  Main floor features entryway, living room and kitchen with seating for six at the enormous island, a powder room, and a view to the two-story family room.  

Lower level has the two-story family room with walkout backyard and patio.  Lower level also has a dining table, a media room (there's an office setup in the media room) and a full bath.

Upper floor has the master suite with private deck and master bath, laundry, and a second full bath shared by two additional bedrooms.  Each of the three bedrooms has a queen bed -- there is nowhere else to sleep.  Therefore, a maximum of six people, depending on your sleeping configuration.

Note:  There are open risers on the main stairwell, and on the front entry stairs -- you are responsible for your own safety in the entire house including the stairs, and for the safety of your children and pets.

High-speed wireless internet, home theater, three 65 inch smart TVs, everything to relax or take care of business including a printer and scanner.

Easy walking distance to public transportation and the best that Chicago has to offer.

All

Please reach out with any questions.  We love Chicago and would be happy to offer advice or suggestions.  We have a property manager who lives just around the corner, for a friendly, in-person welcome  and/or a local resource in an emergency.

Bucktown is one of the most vibrant and energetic in Chicago.   While this home is in the heart of Bucktown, it is set-off from the bustle in a lovely little "pocket" on a quiet, tree-lined street.

Easy and quick access to public transportation, restaurants, shops, a dog park and the 606.  Private garage parking for one car, off the alley, is included with rental.  Our car will take up the other half of the two-car garage.  The street is not zoned, and parking is usually abundant, so you may prefer to park on the street.
house_rules:
- Security Deposit.
- Maximum of six people, including children.
- Agree to waive liability for safety of yourselves, your children, your guests and your animals whether pets, or service or emotional support animals.  Main stairwell, and stairs to front entry, has open risers.
interaction: Please reach out with any questions.  We love Chicago and would be happy to offer advice or suggestions.  We have a property manager who lives just around the corner, for a friendly, in-person welcome  and/or a local resource in an emergency.

description:
Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this spacious one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped River North home with stunning  views over the city. (#CHI112)

Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your comfortable living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this River North apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Gym
- Roof Deck

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

- Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty)
- All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property.
- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

access:

description:
We are located by the I-290 and a 10 minute walk to the CTA. Enjoy your stay in our home. You will have a private room with a queen sized bed. Closet with hangers and extra storage space in the dresser. 42” Tv with Roku in your room. 

Shared office desk available.

55” TV with Roku in the shared Living Room. 

Plenty of free street parking available in front of the home and in the back.

-Located on the first floor. 
-Queen Sized Bed comfortably sleeps two. 
-Carpeting throughout the house. 
-Bathroom stocked with shampoo/conditioner, and body wash.
-Kitchen has stove, microwave, fridge, and cooking utensils. All accessible to you at any time.
-Smoking allowed on front porch

The two front doors have an automatic lock keypad. You will be provided with a code prior to arrival. Please lock doors when arriving and departing. 

Security systems throughout the house for guest safety. Cameras inside and outside.

I am not always on the property, but I am always a phone call or text away. When I am home I do like to socialize with the guests.

15 minutes from Logan square
18 minute drive to Sears Tower
10 min walk to the Garfield Park Conservatory 
Close to public transportation (82 bus, and green line) 
10 minuets from United Center
24 minuets to Navy Pier
23 minutes to Oak Street Beach
25 minuets to The free Lincoln Park Zoo
19 minuets from Millennium Park/Grant park
24 minuets to Shed Aquarium, the field museum and the Adler planetarium.

The train station is a 10 minute walk. Uber or lyft is always a easy way to get around.

Smoking is allowed on the front porch outside.

description:
Luxury 2bed, 2bath CONDO. Renting 1 room with semi-private bathroom (use for guests). Excellent Ukrainian Village Location...12m Walk to Damen Blue Line Stop, 4m Walk to the 50 Bus, and Quick Walk to Everything... Renter Gets Own Bathroom!!! Bedroom = 11 x 10 - Upgraded Granite Kitchen w/ Stainless Appliances (D/W) and Large Island Hardwood Floors Washer & Dryer In-Unit ----  Tons of Outdoor Space Including MASSIVE Private Roof Deck!!!! Central Air

You will be able to use the living room, kitchen, bathroom and bedroom. The entry will be via the shared front entrance. Feel free to use the roof as well.

I will be available during your stay to answer any questions. I stay in the second room.

Ukrainian Village/ Wicker Park Favorites: Letizia's Bakery, Pub Royale, Cafe Streets, En Hakorre

close to the 50 Damen bus, walk 6m to division to catch the 70 Division bus, Damen blue line is a 12-15 m walk north up Damen, great restaraunts/bars/stores within a 5 min walk away

There are three sets of stairs up to the apartment. If you normally do steps, you will be fine but this is not wheelchair friendly. Sorry :(

access: Guests have full access to the entire private first floor apartment and private deck. Access to the owner's patio/backyard is also possible. Just need to ensure there's no conflict with the owner's plans for the backyard during your stay.
description:
Your private getaway in the heart of Lakeview and Wrigleyville. Tastefully-appointed home, beautiful natural light, separate living and dining rooms, spacious fully equipped eat-in kitchen, and private deck overlooking a landscaped garden and patio.

Walking distance to Wrigley Field, Boystown, the Music Box Theater, shops, bars and restaurants on the Southport Corridor. Easy access to Lincoln Park and Chicago's Loop (downtown). Easy street parking and private 1-car garage available.

Location, Location, Location – Lush, quiet residential street. Walking distance to Wrigley Field yet away from all of the noise and hassle. Home on first floor of a beautiful, fully restored classic Chicago 1920's greystone 2-apartment building. The residence is completely free of clutter and personal items, such as family pictures, etc. I'm 100% committed to providing a 5 star experience. 

• Home – Traditional layout, classic vintage features with beautiful original wood accents and floors. Contemporary bathrooms and kitchen with modern appliances.

• 3 Bedrooms - Two large bedrooms with queen-size beds, one firm and one extra-firm mattress, seating area and large walk-in closets. Third bedroom with two twin-size/single beds. Regular and firmer pillows in each bedroom, bedside outlets and USB connections. 

• 2 Bathrooms – One with full-size walk-in shower, second one with vintage clawfoot bathtub/shower combination.

• Living Room – Large space with comfortable full-size sleeper sofa. Sleeper can accommodate 2 average height/weight adults.

• Dining Room - Large multipurpose space for dining/entertaining and dedicated work area with desk. Game/dining table can seat 6 for dinner, converts to game table for poker or bumper pool.

• Kitchen - Spacious eat-in room with seating for 4. Fully equipped and perfect for preparing a delicious gourmet meal.

• Complimentary coffees, teas, sugar & cream, carbonated flavored waters.

• 50” 4K Television and soundbar, DVR, DirectTV/cable with HBO, Showtime and many more premium channels. Strong wireless access throughout entire apartment and immediate surroundings.

• Host/Owner - Available for any questions, assistance or advice as needed.

→ Always looking forward to hosting great people searching for a unique and above average stay. Feel free to email me to see if we can work out a deal for your budget. I quickly respond to all inquiries.

*** PARKING ***
Plenty of FREE street parking typically available on our block or nearby, except before, during and after major Wrigley Field events and Cubs games. If you don't need to move the car during Wrigley events you'll be fine with street parking. We will provide complimentary street parking permits for each night of your stay. Overnight street parking is restricted to residents and their guests.

If you prefer the convenience and additional security of indoor parking, we can accommodate one car in an enclosed garage. It's a private 2-car garage, in the rear of the property, steps from the back door of the building. You'll have unlimited in and out privileges to the garage with a remote opener. This private space is available for $25.00 per night during your stay. Message me after your booking to arrange payment, which can be done right through AirBnB.

Guests have full access to the entire private first floor apartment and private deck. Access to the owner's patio/backyard is also possible. Just need to ensure there's no conflict with the owner's plans for the backyard during your stay.

Guest home is separate from the only other apartment in the building. The entire place, including the deck off the kitchen is private and for the sole use of the guests. Doorbell with security camera on main entry.

Host are always available as needed via phone or text.

Easy walking distance to two lines of Chicago's Elevated "L" rapid train system. The Brown line train is less than two blocks away. The Red line train is 5 blocks away. Also, 3 blocks from the Clark Street buses.

*** CHECK-IN ***
We make every effort to greet all guests at check-in. Self check-in can be arranged if meeting in person is not possible due to arrival time constraints.

Apartment keys, or instructions for a self check-in, will only be provided to the individual completing and paying for the reservation. Other arrangements need to be completed ahead of arrival.

*** SECURITY DEPOSIT – How it works ***
AirBnB will not charge you for the deposit when booking. Our understanding is that a temporary reserve/hold will be placed on your credit card for the security deposit amount. The security deposit only comes into play in case of damages to the apartment or its contents. AirBnB has a process for resolving damage claims. During booking you'll only be charge the per night rate plus AirBnB fees and taxes.
house_rules:
- No smoking of any type allowed inside the apartment or by doorways. If you're a smoker we will gladly provide suggestions where you can smoke.
- You'll be staying in a residential neighborhood so use common sense regarding quiet hours.
- Acceptable to have friends or family stop by for a visit, to enjoy a glass of wine or a meal. But no large parties or gatherings of any type.
- Respect all laws while you and your guests are in our property.

- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout

description:
Gorgeous 2BD/2BA Unit in the heart of Chicago - Magnificent Mile. Professionally managed and cleaned with stylish kitchen, free high-speed wifi and 24/7 support. Fully stocked with all the convenience you would expect at a hotel.

We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

Located in one of Chicago's lakefront neighborhoods. This apartment is ideal for those who want to have the best of both worlds. City living at it's finest with the best dining and shopping places and just a few minutes away is Oak Street Beach which is a great place for water sports and biking. Enjoy its warm red brick exterior that highlights the rich history that this apartment is known for. Floor to ceiling windows provides the open concept living/dining room apartment a lot of natural light. All units are furnished and provided flat screen TV's, free fast wifi service, kitchenware/cookware and bathroom amenities. Our amazing customer support team are always available to attend to your needs.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests

access: Guests have access to the building's fitness center and indoor pool.
description:
Enjoy scenic city views in this 2 bedroom/2 Bath apartment near Navy Pier. This space comes with modern amenities such as a rooftop lounge area and fitness center. There are also restaurants and bars just about 10 min walk. Here you’ll find all the comforts of home: full kitchen, custom artwork, and furnishings curated to reflect the beauty of the Windy City. Come stay with us at this beautiful Domio and experience the best that Chicago has to offer.

This space exemplifies the Domio standard: uncompromising style and maximum comfort. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath apartment boasts a radiant living room, exquisite furniture, and premium finishes. In addition to a fully-stocked kitchen with professional-grade appliances, guests will be pleased to find hand-picked artwork throughout the home. Each bedroom has a queen size bed.

Guests have access to the building's fitness center and indoor pool.

There’s no need for us to get in your way of having a good time. If you need anything though - questions, recommendations, or just want to chat - our Domio delighters are always one phone call away!

Streeterville is one of Chicago's most walkable neighborhoods and you'll be steps from the famed Navy Pier which is a short walk away. Easily walk to restaurants and bars to truly experience Chicago.

Chicago Registration Number: R19000039543

access: Full unit access.
description:
Beautiful fully furnished unit on the high floor of a Gold Coast neighborhood high-rise building. Located among the million dollar single family homes neighborhood. Everything in the unit is in great condition, contemporary and the bathroom is updated. Please read other details about the unit for more information. We require a minimum of 30 days stay.

Beautiful fully furnished unit on the high floor of a Gold Coast neighborhood high-rise building. Located among the million dollar single family homes neighborhood. Everything in the unit is in great condition, contemporary and the bathroom is updated.  Furnishings include a beautiful seating area, 40 inch LED/HD TV, dining table, QUEEN size SLEEPER SOFA, queen size bed, all of your kitchen needs with pots, pans, silverware, appliances and everything you need. Just move right in!! We also supply bath and kitchen towels, bed linens, vacuum and iron. 
Heat/AC, water, electric, HD cable TV , hi-speed wi-fi  internet are included in the price. Please note that electric bill is covered up to $50. For the bill above $50 dollars you will be charged extra after your stay. We will presume the actual bill for your records.

There is a coin-laundry in the basement. The building also has a rooftop sundeck and tennis courts.

Full unit access.

Guests can call us during their stay.

You will love this neighborhood. This building is walking distance to everything Chicago has to offer: Lake Michigan and its beaches, Michigan Ave and its fabulous shopping, incredible restaurants and night life, famous comedy clubs in Old Town are just minutes away, along with grocery stores (including one next door to the building), unique boutique stores, and the “L” train are just a few blocks away.  Unit overlooking the Lake and North Avenue Beach with Hancock Tower views. Lincoln Park is 5 minutes away, Lincoln Park Zoo is within walking distance!

A few minutes walking distance to "Magnificent Mile", Rush Street area, Old Town neighborhood and North Avenue Beach on Lake Michigan. Bus stop for #36 and #22 is right in front of the building.

We can be flexible with the check in and check out times depending on the availability of the unit. 

Doorman after 4.00 pm, valet parking at additional cost ($35 weekly !) There is also monthly parking available for a really affordable rate for Chicago area at $135/month.  

Rent is negotiable if staying 3 or more months.

1st month’s rent and security deposit of $400 due immediately .

Everything in the unit is in great condition, contemporary and the bathroom is updated. Please read other details about the unit for more information. We require a minimum of 30 days stay.
transit: A few minutes walking distance to "Magnificent Mile", Rush Street area, Old Town neighborhood and North Avenue Beach on Lake Michigan. Bus stop for #36 and #22 is right in front of the building.
